4200245948,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-24hassistance-4200245948?position=47&pageNum=0&refId=Nz1L37jIF3FitVj25fkcDA%3D%3D&trackingId=b%2FWWhp1mOOhay6yAwZF4KA%3D%3D,Data Analyst,24hassistance,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Siamo alla ricerca di un Data Analyst da inserire nel nostro Team Datalab. Il nostro candidato ideale possiede una laurea in materie STEM con fondamenti di modellazione statistica e di proiezione di serie storiche. La risorsa sarà inserita all'interno di una realtà dinamica e fortemente stimolante.
In Questo Ruolo Ti Occuperai Di
Costruzione ed esecuzione di processi di data quality e di data validation
Analisi delle serie storiche dei dati con identificazione dei trend emergenti
Applicazione di tecniche di interpolazione, estrapolazione sulle evidenze di business
Costruzione ed elaborazione di un sistema di Advanced Analytics integrato ed automatizzato per il monitoraggio dei principali KPI’s di produzione e di andamento tecnico
Interpretazione quantitativa e qualitativa dei risultati per suggerire lo sviluppo del business
Costruzione di sistemi di “Early warning” e supporto alla definizione di modelli predittivi di retention/conversion e di elasticità del prezzo
Benchmark di competitività e più in generale attività di market intelligence
Almeno 2 anni di esperienza nel ruolo, preferibilmente in ambito finanziario/assicurativo/economico
Capacità non solo di programmazione con linguaggi specializzati per l'analisi statistica (Python, R, SQL) ma anche di gestione dell'architettura del codice utilizzato
Conoscenza di software di data visualization/guided analytics (Tableau, PowerBI, QlikView …)
Livello avanzato di conoscenza della lingua inglese
Conoscenza delle tecniche statistiche multivariate parametriche (Es. GLM) e di machine learning per la valutazione e personalizzazione del rischio
Preferibile conoscenza di software di data visualization/guided analytics (Tableau, PowerBI, QlikView)
Giorno libero per il proprio compleanno
Convenzioni e scontistiche dedicate ai dipendenti

Informazioni contrattuali: Parleremo delle informazioni contrattuali in sede di colloquio in modo da offrirti il giusto compenso adeguandolo alla reale esperienza e alla tua competenza. L’orario di lavoro è Full Time.

Siamo alla ricerca di un Data Analyst da inserire nel nostro Team Datalab. Il nostro candidato ideale possiede una laurea in materie STEM con fondamenti di modellazione statistica e di proiezione di serie storiche. La risorsa sarà inserita all'interno di una realtà dinamica e fortemente stimolante.

In Questo Ruolo Ti Occuperai Di

  • Preparazione della base dati
  • Costruzione ed esecuzione di processi di data quality e di data validation
  • Analisi delle serie storiche dei dati con identificazione dei trend emergenti
  • Applicazione di tecniche di interpolazione, estrapolazione sulle evidenze di business
  • Costruzione ed elaborazione di un sistema di Advanced Analytics integrato ed automatizzato per il monitoraggio dei principali KPI’s di produzione e di andamento tecnico
  • Interpretazione quantitativa e qualitativa dei risultati per suggerire lo sviluppo del business
  • Costruzione di sistemi di “Early warning” e supporto alla definizione di modelli predittivi di retention/conversion e di elasticità del prezzo
  • Benchmark di competitività e più in generale attività di market intelligence

Requisiti

  • Almeno 2 anni di esperienza nel ruolo, preferibilmente in ambito finanziario/assicurativo/economico
  • Capacità non solo di programmazione con linguaggi specializzati per l'analisi statistica (Python, R, SQL) ma anche di gestione dell'architettura del codice utilizzato
  • Conoscenza di software di data visualization/guided analytics (Tableau, PowerBI, QlikView …)
  • Capacità di debugging
  • Passione per la “data culture”
  • Livello avanzato di conoscenza della lingua inglese
  • Orientamento al raggiungimento degli obiettivi

Completano Il Profilo

  • Conoscenza delle tecniche statistiche multivariate parametriche (Es. GLM) e di machine learning per la valutazione e personalizzazione del rischio
  • Conoscenza di Azure Databricks
  • Preferibile conoscenza di software di data visualization/guided analytics (Tableau, PowerBI, QlikView)

Benefit

  • Smartworking
  • Buoni pasto
  • Mensa aziendale
  • Giorno libero per il proprio compleanno
  • Convenzioni e scontistiche dedicate ai dipendenti

Informazioni contrattuali: Parleremo delle informazioni contrattuali in sede di colloquio in modo da offrirti il giusto compenso adeguandolo alla reale esperienza e alla tua competenza. L’orario di lavoro è Full Time.

4203400960,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-intern-at-heritage-holdings-4203400960?position=48&pageNum=0&refId=Nz1L37jIF3FitVj25fkcDA%3D%3D&trackingId=UVKluRwILvqqT3bp1u5tzw%3D%3D,Data Analyst Intern,Heritage Holdings,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Who We Are

At Heritage, we are dedicated to being at the forefront of the alternative investment industry by creating a next-generation fund that combines traditional investment sourcing and evaluation strategies with proprietary technology solutions and data-driven approaches.

Our mission is to connect elite families and entrepreneurs globally with carefully vetted top-performing private market opportunities, leveraging our digital products to make the alternative investment market more accessible, efficient, and connected. Furthermore, we embrace the principles of ""skin in the game"" as we co-invest with our partners, and ""innovation"" as we work to create lasting value through continually advancing the investment sector.

Our team comprises of a diverse international group of individuals from leading organisations and with diverse backgrounds, including private equity, venture capital, banking, software development, law, and entrepreneurship. We are committed to attracting top-notch talent and providing opportunities for growth and development based on their individual strengths and interests

Are you passionate about leveraging technology to drive financial innovation? We’re on the hunt for energetic individuals to provide exceptional operational support and insight, helping propel our team to new heights. During your time at Heritage, you will gain exposure to a wide range of activities at the intersection of finance and technology:

Be a data expert – Use your analytical mindset to work with complex data sets. Analyze daily transactions and bank statements to build clear, compelling visualizations of client net worth—including both public and private assets.
Own the account aggregation tool – Take full ownership of the tool, ensuring the database remains accurate and efficient. Continuously identify areas for improvement and lead innovation initiatives.

A fast-paced, analytical, numerical thinker who thrives in a dynamic environment
Committed to excellence, with a proven track record of achieving results through data-driven decision-making
An exceptional problem-solver with strong analytical and critical thinking skills

Independent yet collaborative, ready to make a difference within our team

A paid internship in the heart of Milan lasting six enriching months, will help shape you into a well-rounded professional. You will join an international team from 10+ nationalities whom you will interact with daily and at quarterly team-building events.

The Hiring Process At Heritage Includes The Following Stages
Final Interview with the Department Manager

At Heritage, we are proud to have a diverse team representing over 15 nationalities, with all communication conducted in English. We are deeply committed to providing equal opportunities and work actively to remove potential biases in our hiring process by involving a Hiring Committee in all decision-making.
By applying to this job offer, you confirm that you have read and understood Heritage's privacy policy: http://bit.ly/privacypolicy121.

Who We Are

At Heritage, we are dedicated to being at the forefront of the alternative investment industry by creating a next-generation fund that combines traditional investment sourcing and evaluation strategies with proprietary technology solutions and data-driven approaches.

Our mission is to connect elite families and entrepreneurs globally with carefully vetted top-performing private market opportunities, leveraging our digital products to make the alternative investment market more accessible, efficient, and connected. Furthermore, we embrace the principles of ""skin in the game"" as we co-invest with our partners, and ""innovation"" as we work to create lasting value through continually advancing the investment sector.

Our team comprises of a diverse international group of individuals from leading organisations and with diverse backgrounds, including private equity, venture capital, banking, software development, law, and entrepreneurship. We are committed to attracting top-notch talent and providing opportunities for growth and development based on their individual strengths and interests

Your role

About

Are you passionate about leveraging technology to drive financial innovation? We’re on the hunt for energetic individuals to provide exceptional operational support and insight, helping propel our team to new heights. During your time at Heritage, you will gain exposure to a wide range of activities at the intersection of finance and technology:

  • Be a data expert – Use your analytical mindset to work with complex data sets. Analyze daily transactions and bank statements to build clear, compelling visualizations of client net worth—including both public and private assets.
  • Own the account aggregation tool – Take full ownership of the tool, ensuring the database remains accurate and efficient. Continuously identify areas for improvement and lead innovation initiatives.
  • Leverage Bloomberg – Use Bloomberg tools to conduct deep analysis of public securities and extract actionable insights.


Who We Are Looking For

  • A fast-paced, analytical, numerical thinker who thrives in a dynamic environment
  • Committed to excellence, with a proven track record of achieving results through data-driven decision-making
  • An exceptional problem-solver with strong analytical and critical thinking skills
  • Intellectually curious, constantly seeking new knowledge and skills in analytics and programming
  • Independent yet collaborative, ready to make a difference within our team
  • Ideally, you have experience working with Tableau, Power BI, Python or R
  • Fluency in English
  • Available for a 6-month internship starting in May 2025


What We Offer

A paid internship in the heart of Milan lasting six enriching months, will help shape you into a well-rounded professional. You will join an international team from 10+ nationalities whom you will interact with daily and at quarterly team-building events.

Join us for an experience that combines professional growth with a positive work environment. Your journey begins here!

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

We want to innovate the financial services offered by commercial/retail banks in Italy in the areas of wealth management, credit lending, risk management and compliance. Building on our consolidated expertise and product offering in the Capital Markets domain, we want to scale our solutions and frameworks to the commercial/retail banking industry. To do so, we start from the quantitative modelling and analysis of the current processes put in place by our customers, so that we can profile opportunities of automation and prioritize client needs on manual/painful workflows. The resource will be involved in business process analyses of Italian commercial/retail financial institutions and is expected to integrate structured information extracted from interviews with the analysis of literature and documentation to build a quantitative picture of the AS-IS. The analysis will then be complemented with a consequent implementation analysis and product roadmap definition to design the TO-BE and drive product evolutions and developments. The project entails modelling complex business contexts, extracting structured information from unstructured sources, performing quantitative analyses, presenting findings and recommendations to external clients and internal stakeholders, contributing to the definition of product backlogs.
What You Will Learn During Your Intern
Codification of customer requirements, needs, activities
Business intelligence with PowerBI/Excel - Packaging high-quality deliverables for external clients –
Data manipulation with Pandas or Spark/Hive
Hands-on experience with BI tools (Excel, PowerBI)
Experience with Python data science libraries (pandas, pyspark, sklearn) is nice to have
We Are Looking For Someone Who
is passionate about modelling unknown business contexts with a quantitative approach
can find a good trade-off between quality and speed of delivery
proactively contribute your insights and ideas in a way that fits existing frameworks of the firm
is fond of sharing knowledge with colleagues and documenting your work

At ION

We want to innovate the financial services offered by commercial/retail banks in Italy in the areas of wealth management, credit lending, risk management and compliance. Building on our consolidated expertise and product offering in the Capital Markets domain, we want to scale our solutions and frameworks to the commercial/retail banking industry. To do so, we start from the quantitative modelling and analysis of the current processes put in place by our customers, so that we can profile opportunities of automation and prioritize client needs on manual/painful workflows. The resource will be involved in business process analyses of Italian commercial/retail financial institutions and is expected to integrate structured information extracted from interviews with the analysis of literature and documentation to build a quantitative picture of the AS-IS. The analysis will then be complemented with a consequent implementation analysis and product roadmap definition to design the TO-BE and drive product evolutions and developments. The project entails modelling complex business contexts, extracting structured information from unstructured sources, performing quantitative analyses, presenting findings and recommendations to external clients and internal stakeholders, contributing to the definition of product backlogs.

What You Will Learn During Your Intern

  • Quantitative modelling of business processes
  • Codification of customer requirements, needs, activities
  • Business intelligence with PowerBI/Excel - Packaging high-quality deliverables for external clients –
  • Data manipulation with Pandas or Spark/Hive

What You Need To Know

  • Hands-on experience with BI tools (Excel, PowerBI)
  • Experience with Python data science libraries (pandas, pyspark, sklearn) is nice to have
  • Fluent English

We Are Looking For Someone Who

  • is passionate about modelling unknown business contexts with a quantitative approach
  • can find a good trade-off between quality and speed of delivery
  • proactively contribute your insights and ideas in a way that fits existing frameworks of the firm
  • is fond of sharing knowledge with colleagues and documenting your work

We're seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst with a strong emphasis on SharePoint administration. This role will also encompass some duties as a document controller and data protection clerk. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing and optimising our SharePoint environment, ensuring efficient data management, and maintaining compliance with data protection regulations.
Manage and optimise the SharePoint environment to ensure efficient data management and collaboration across the organisation
Analyse business requirements, design SharePoint solutions, and provide ongoing support and maintenance
Collaborate with IT operations and IT Security to align implementation with Group IT strategy, policies, and architecture
Manage a large volume of documentation contained in multiple SharePoint sites
Provide solutions for document management needs and ensure a highly customer-centric approach.
Ensure that all day-to-day operational activities related to document management are carried out in a timely and reliable manner
Respond to and action helpdesk issues related to document management
Maintain and update documentation based on business requirements and compliance needs
Interface with business stakeholders to fulfil various data requests and ensure the smooth running of the company's Information Technology department.
Advise on appropriate data protection measures for any new types of data
Ensure compliance with data protection regulations, including GDPR
Develop and maintain data access guidelines and data classification labels
Identify all systems that process personal data and ensure processes and procedures are in place to satisfy Subject Access Request (SAR) requirements
Maintain an asset management process and ensure all IT assets are identified, registered, and physically protected from threats.
To be successful in this role, you will demonstrate:
Time management & prioritisation skills - things can get a little hectic, so the ability to effectively manage yourself and your workload is critical.

Excellent communication skills (in English or/and other European languages) - you must be able to organise your thoughts in a way that others find clear and compelling. You will be expected to together well-written, grammatically correct emails and other communications. When communicating verbally – whether over the phone, on video calls, in person or in meetings – you will need to be articulate, warm and engaging.
Flexibility - being an effective team player means being flexible in your approach and open to getting involved with new things, even if they are not spelt out in your job description.
Intellectual Curiosity – We are looking for someone who is truly interested in our profession and has the intellectual curiosity to delve deep into topics and bring fresh ideas into the team.
IT Literacy - you need to be comfortable with IT systems and working with data (you should have at least intermediate-level Excel).
Delivery focus – it may sound obvious, but the ability to proactively churn through work at pace and deliver quality outputs really matters!
Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Passion for our mission ‘to generate a more sustainable future by leading the transition to clean energy.
Our values: be a leader, build trust, be responsible, be innovative and ‘bring your alpha’.
Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field
Proven experience in SharePoint administration and data management
Strong understanding of data protection regulations, including GDPR
Experience with document management systems and processes
Knowledge of data protection and privacy legislation
Familiarity with IT support and helpdesk systems.
A busy role in a supportive team, with plenty of opportunities to learn
International scope – we operate in over 8 countries
Competitive base salary and annual discretionary bonus.

If you are interested in this opportunity, please follow the link to apply or send your application to careers@nextenergygroup.com. If you have been shortlisted for the next stage, we will be in contact within 14 days.
By selecting “Apply” or sending us your CV, you indicate you have read and acknowledged NextEnergy Group’s Candidate Privacy Notice.

Our approach to diversity and inclusion is a natural extension of our values. Our entrepreneurial culture inspires us to try new things, be open to different viewpoints and be bold. Our Group is committed to cultivating and preserving a culture of connectedness that values difference and gives space for individual expression. The collective sum of our individual differences, life experiences, knowledge, innovation, self-expression, talent and hard work form the bedrock of who we are and who we aspire to be.

We are committed to equal employment and advancement opportunity irrespective of race, colour, ancestry, social background, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability and gender identity.

THE ROLE


We're seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst with a strong emphasis on SharePoint administration. This role will also encompass some duties as a document controller and data protection clerk. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing and optimising our SharePoint environment, ensuring efficient data management, and maintaining compliance with data protection regulations.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES


SharePoint Administration

  • Manage and optimise the SharePoint environment to ensure efficient data management and collaboration across the organisation
  • Analyse business requirements, design SharePoint solutions, and provide ongoing support and maintenance
  • Collaborate with IT operations and IT Security to align implementation with Group IT strategy, policies, and architecture
  • Manage a large volume of documentation contained in multiple SharePoint sites
  • Provide solutions for document management needs and ensure a highly customer-centric approach.


Document Controller Duties

  • Ensure that all day-to-day operational activities related to document management are carried out in a timely and reliable manner
  • Respond to and action helpdesk issues related to document management
  • Maintain and update documentation based on business requirements and compliance needs
  • Interface with business stakeholders to fulfil various data requests and ensure the smooth running of the company's Information Technology department.


Data Protection Clerk Duties

  • Advise on appropriate data protection measures for any new types of data
  • Ensure compliance with data protection regulations, including GDPR
  • Develop and maintain data access guidelines and data classification labels
  • Identify all systems that process personal data and ensure processes and procedures are in place to satisfy Subject Access Request (SAR) requirements
  • Maintain an asset management process and ensure all IT assets are identified, registered, and physically protected from threats.


SKILLS &

To be successful in this role, you will demonstrate:


  • Time management &

  • Delivery focus – it may sound obvious, but the ability to proactively churn through work at pace and deliver quality outputs really matters!

  • Passion for our mission ‘to generate a more sustainable future by leading the transition to clean energy.

column1: Are you ready to be part of something bigger? Satispay is the place for you! Come be part of our dynamic team and help us shape the future of payments in Europe.
🚀 Join us as Senior Data Analyst and let's make magic happen together.

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will join the Growth Intelligence team and collaborate closely with stakeholders from the Product Marketing, CRM, Business Development, and Engineering teams to identify business needs and uncover analytics opportunities.
Deliver real impact. Bring concrete impact to the Growth team and business line through analysis and implementation of rigorous data-driven solutions.
Analyze and drive. Analyze and interpret large datasets to derive actionable insights and support decision-making processes.
Design and optimize experiments. Develop and manage A/B tests to optimize and guide product and processes enhancements.
Create and maintain descriptive outcomes. Track key metrics and assist in the creation of visual representations (dashboards, maps) to communicate analytical insights effectively.
Manage analytic solutions. Modernize, standardize, troubleshoot, and maintain existing analytic solutions to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Cooperate. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data into broader business strategies.
Stay current with industry trends. Continuously evolve the organization by adopting best-in-class technologies and techniques.
Enhance data-driven culture. Support decision-making and promote a data-driven culture through ad-hoc analyses and insights.

Proven experience and analytical skills. You have 5+ years of working experience in Business Intelligence or Data Analytics and can apply high-level analytical, statistical, and quantitative problem-solving skills to various scenarios. If you have a passion for working with data and a deep understanding of marketing campaigns, attribution, and web analytics, this is the perfect opportunity for you.

Expertise in programming. You possess advanced knowledge of SQL and query optimization, as well as extensive knowledge of Python or R. Additionally, you have experience with Looker, Tableau, or similar technologies.

Detail-oriented and communicative. You have a maniacal attention to detail and enjoy executing complex projects. You can communicate in a structured and convincing manner, adapting your style to build trust in a positive and professional way with various stakeholders.
Passion for fintech or startup environments. You are enthusiastic about working in dynamic, innovative settings.
Language proficiency. You are fluent in Italian and English.

Don't let a checklist hold you back - at Satispay, we thrive on diverse perspectives and unique strengths. Your individuality could be the missing piece to our puzzle! Even if you don't meet every skill listed above, we encourage you to apply if you're passionate about the role and believe you can contribute to our team's success.

About Satispay

At Satispay, we're not just reimagining payments
column2:
we're pioneering a movement toward simplicity and accessibility. Picture yourself at the forefront of innovation, leading the way in revolutionizing payments - and beyond! - across Europe, alongside a vibrant community of like-minded individuals driven by a shared vision: simplifying payments to improve everyone’s life.

Are you ready to be part of something bigger? Satispay is the place for you! Come be part of our dynamic team and help us shape the future of payments in Europe.

🚀 Join us as Senior Data Analyst and let's make magic happen together.

Role Overview

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will join the Growth Intelligence team and collaborate closely with stakeholders from the Product Marketing, CRM, Business Development, and Engineering teams to identify business needs and uncover analytics opportunities.

Your Mission

  • Deliver real impact. Bring concrete impact to the Growth team and business line through analysis and implementation of rigorous data-driven solutions.
  • Analyze and drive. Analyze and interpret large datasets to derive actionable insights and support decision-making processes.
  • Design and optimize experiments. Develop and manage A/B tests to optimize and guide product and processes enhancements.
  • Create and maintain descriptive outcomes. Track key metrics and assist in the creation of visual representations (dashboards, maps) to communicate analytical insights effectively.
  • Manage analytic solutions. Modernize, standardize, troubleshoot, and maintain existing analytic solutions to ensure accuracy and reliability.
  • Cooperate. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data into broader business strategies.
  • Stay current with industry trends. Continuously evolve the organization by adopting best-in-class technologies and techniques.
  • Enhance data-driven culture. Support decision-making and promote a data-driven culture through ad-hoc analyses and insights.

Your Ideal Profile

  • Proven experience and analytical skills. You have 5+ years of working experience in Business Intelligence or Data Analytics and can apply high-level analytical, statistical, and quantitative problem-solving skills to various scenarios. If you have a passion for working with data and a deep understanding of marketing campaigns, attribution, and web analytics, this is the perfect opportunity for you.
  • Expertise in programming. You possess advanced knowledge of SQL and query optimization, as well as extensive knowledge of Python or R. Additionally, you have experience with Looker, Tableau, or similar technologies.
  • Detail-oriented and communicative. You have a maniacal attention to detail and enjoy executing complex projects. You can communicate in a structured and convincing manner, adapting your style to build trust in a positive and professional way with various stakeholders.
  • Passion for fintech or startup environments. You are enthusiastic about working in dynamic, innovative settings.
  • Language proficiency. You are fluent in Italian and English.

Don't let a checklist hold you back - at Satispay, we thrive on diverse perspectives and unique strengths. Your individuality could be the missing piece to our puzzle! Even if you don't meet every skill listed above, we encourage you to apply if you're passionate about the role and believe you can contribute to our team's success.

Your Perks as a Satisperson

🙆🏻 Join an international team to grow with

🏡 Hybrid working policy

🍽️ Fuel your day with our meal vouchers

🌐 Preply language platform access to expand your language skills

⭐ Benefit from our 1.2k company welfare budget

🚀 Own part of Satispay’s success with our Stock Option Plan

👩🏻‍💻 Gear up with our tech equipment

🥳 Join us in the fun with team-building events, parties, trips, and more!

4196509421,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/finance-data-analyst-apprendistato-at-siemens-healthineers-4196509421?position=54&pageNum=0&refId=Nz1L37jIF3FitVj25fkcDA%3D%3D&trackingId=dEDehlfy0zSR2q0IVr86iw%3D%3D,Finance Data Analyst - Apprendistato,Siemens Healthineers,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Join us in pioneering breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably.

Our inspiring and caring environment forms a global community that celebrates diversity and individuality. We encourage you to step beyond your comfort zone, offering resources and flexibility to foster your professional and personal growth, all while valuing your unique contributions.

Apply now for the position of Finance Analyst for the Southern Europe Business Performance Controlling Department in our Headquarter in Milan and you will carry out FP&A activities for the country and take part in the harmonization processes taking place on the 4 countries of the zone.
Data Collection and Analysis: gathering and analyzing financial data to support planning and decision-making.
Budget Preparation Support: assisting in the preparation of annual budgets and financial forecasts.
Performance Monitoring: tracking financial performance against budgets and forecasts, identifying variances.
Strategic Decision Support: providing analytical support for strategic decisions, such as investment evaluations.
Cross-functional Collaboration: working closely with other departments to ensure financial decisions align with overall business goals.
Master’s degree in economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Math or Engineering.
Good understanding of Office suite and Business Intelligence tools.
Interpersonal skills, result oriented, proactivity, autonomy, relational skills, team working.
Good knowledge of English and Italian language (spoken, written).
Knowledge of programming languages (i.e. SQL, Python, R, etc.)
Experience in applied Machine Learning and Predictive Analytics.
Deep knowledge of business intelligence tools.
To find out more about the specific business, have a look at www.siemens-healthineers.com.

We are a team of more than 71,000 highly dedicated Healthineers in more than 70 countries. As a leader in medical technology, we constantly push the boundaries to create better outcomes and experiences for patients, no matter where they live or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.

When you join Siemens Healthineers, you become one in a global team of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists, who believe in each individual’s potential to contribute with diverse ideas. We are from different backgrounds, cultures, religions, political and/or sexual orientations, and work together, to fight the world’s most threatening diseases and enable access to care, united by one purpose: to pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably. Check our Careers Site at https://jobs.siemens-healthineers.com/careers.
As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from individuals with disabilities.

We care about your data privacy and take compliance with GDPR as well as other data protection legislation seriously. For this reason, we ask you not to send us your CV or resume by email. Please create a profile within our talent community and subscribe to personalized job alert that will keep you posted about new opportunities.

Siemens Healthineers' recruitment is internally managed, with external support permitted only when a qualified supplier has established a formal contract with us. Unsolicited candidate submissions and referrals, absent a current supplier contract, do not establish consent and are ineligible for fees. We delete and destroy unsolicited information, thus, would recommend you refrain from any such practices. Your adherence to our policies is appreciated.

Join us in pioneering breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably.

Our inspiring and caring environment forms a global community that celebrates diversity and individuality. We encourage you to step beyond your comfort zone, offering resources and flexibility to foster your professional and personal growth, all while valuing your unique contributions.

Apply now for the position of Finance Analyst for the Southern Europe Business Performance Controlling Department in our Headquarter in Milan and you will carry out FP&
column2:
A activities for the country and take part in the harmonization processes taking place on the 4 countries of the zone.

Your role:

  • Data Collection and Analysis: gathering and analyzing financial data to support planning and decision-making.
  • Budget Preparation Support: assisting in the preparation of annual budgets and financial forecasts.
  • Performance Monitoring: tracking financial performance against budgets and forecasts, identifying variances.
  • Strategic Decision Support: providing analytical support for strategic decisions, such as investment evaluations.
  • Cross-functional Collaboration: working closely with other departments to ensure financial decisions align with overall business goals.

Your expertise:

  • You are under 29 years old.
  • Master’s degree in economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Math or Engineering.
  • Good understanding of Office suite and Business Intelligence tools.
  • Interpersonal skills, result oriented, proactivity, autonomy, relational skills, team working.
  • Good knowledge of English and Italian language (spoken, written).
  • Knowledge of programming languages (i.e. SQL, Python, R, etc.)
  • Experience in applied Machine Learning and Predictive Analytics.
  • Deep knowledge of business intelligence tools.

Will be a plus:

To find out more about the specific business, have a look at www.siemens-healthineers.com.

Who we are:

We are a team of more than 71,000 highly dedicated Healthineers in more than 70 countries. As a leader in medical technology, we constantly push the boundaries to create better outcomes and experiences for patients, no matter where they live or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.

How we work:

When you join Siemens Healthineers, you become one in a global team of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists, who believe in each individual’s potential to contribute with diverse ideas. We are from different backgrounds, cultures, religions, political and/or sexual orientations, and work together, to fight the world’s most threatening diseases and enable access to care, united by one purpose: to pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably. Check our Careers Site at https://jobs.siemens-healthineers.com/careers.

As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from individuals with disabilities.

We care about your data privacy and take compliance with GDPR as well as other data protection legislation seriously. For this reason, we ask you not to send us your CV or resume by email. Please create a profile within our talent community and subscribe to personalized job alert that will keep you posted about new opportunities.

To all recruitment agencies:

Siemens Healthineers' recruitment is internally managed, with external support permitted only when a qualified supplier has established a formal contract with us. Unsolicited candidate submissions and referrals, absent a current supplier contract, do not establish consent and are ineligible for fees. We delete and destroy unsolicited information, thus, would recommend you refrain from any such practices. Your adherence to our policies is appreciated.

stiamo cercando una risorsa da inserire nel team Digital Office, responsabile di trovare soluzioni basate sui data e sull’AI con l’obiettivo di potenziare il nostro business, nel ruolo di:
Collaborare con il nostro principale Data Scientist nel disegnare ed implementare Proof of Concepts(PoCs) end-to-end per le nuove iniziative
Analizzare Database complessi per estrarre informazioni utili alle decisioni del business
Partecipare allo sviluppo dell’AI e di modelli statistici
Rimanere aggiornati sui progressi del settore in ambito Data Science e Machine Learning
Attualmente studente e/o laurea in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistica e/o affini
Conoscenza ed esperienza nel lavoro con dati grezzi e database (ETL)
Comprensione degli algoritmi e delle tecniche di Machine Learning
Buona padronanza della lingua inglese (Livello B2)
Problem solving e forti capacità analitiche
Voglia di imparare e mettersi in gioco in un contesto dinamico e in forte cambiamento
Sede di Lavoro: San Giuliano Milanese (MI) + Smart Working (fino a 3 giorni a settimana)
Orario di Lavoro: 9:00-18:00 dal lunedì al venerdì

Digital,

stiamo cercando una risorsa da inserire nel team Digital Office, responsabile di trovare soluzioni basate sui data e sull’AI con l’obiettivo di potenziare il nostro business, nel ruolo di:


Intern Data Scientist


Principali Attività e Responsabilità:


  • Collaborare con il nostro principale Data Scientist nel disegnare ed implementare Proof of Concepts(PoCs) end-to-end per le nuove iniziative
  • Analizzare Database complessi per estrarre informazioni utili alle decisioni del business
  • Partecipare allo sviluppo dell’AI e di modelli statistici
  • Rimanere aggiornati sui progressi del settore in ambito Data Science e Machine Learning


Competenze e Requisiti:


  • Attualmente studente e/o laurea in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistica e/o affini
  • Conoscenza ed esperienza nel lavoro con dati grezzi e database (ETL)
  • Comprensione degli algoritmi e delle tecniche di Machine Learning
  • Buona padronanza della lingua inglese (Livello B2)
  • Conoscenza del pacchetto Office
  • Proattività e curiosità
  • Problem solving e forti capacità analitiche
  • Voglia di imparare e mettersi in gioco in un contesto dinamico e in forte cambiamento


Sede di Lavoro: San Giuliano Milanese (MI) + Smart Working (fino a 3 giorni a settimana)


Orario di Lavoro: 9:00-18:00 dal lunedì al venerdì

4202457980,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/docente-corsi-data-analyst-power-bi-full-remote-at-akg-italia-4202457980?position=59&pageNum=0&refId=Nz1L37jIF3FitVj25fkcDA%3D%3D&trackingId=y9lI%2B1PlqsAB2A64bHEkuQ%3D%3D,Docente Corsi Data Analyst\ Power BI -Full Remote,AKG Italia,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Chi siamo:

AKG Italia è parte del gruppo Angus Knight, una società Australiana co-fondata più di 30 anni fa da Duncan Angus, con la convinzione che compassione, esperienza e sviluppo delle competenze consentano alle persone di migliorare la propria vita e quella delle proprie comunità.

Forniamo soluzioni innovative per l'occupazione, la salute e l'istruzione in sei Paesi e più di 300 sedi in Australia, Canada, Italia, Singapore, Svezia e Regno Unito. Tra i nostri clienti ci sono persone in cerca di lavoro, studenti e studentesse, governi e amministrazioni locali, aziende e organizzazioni.

Oggi, AKG rimane fedele al suo scopo iniziale: valorizzare l’unicità delle persone aiutandole nei loro percorsi di occupazione e di istruzione, consentendogli di affermarsi all’interno delle loro comunità.
Raggiungiamo i nostri obiettivi attraverso la nostra rete globale, le competenze e l’esperienza della nostra squadra, e l’impegno che manteniamo per raggiungere il nostro scopo.

I Trainer che operano nell’ambito delle Politiche Attive del Lavoro e della formazione finanziata, hanno la responsabilità di supportare gli utenti in cerca di lavoro nello sviluppo delle proprie competenze attraverso la progettazione ed erogazione di servizi di formazione specifica, necessari per realizzare e/o raggiungere i loro obiettivi professionali.
Siamo alla ricerca di Docenti da inserire presso la nostra sede di Milano, per i corsi di:
Gestione di aule eterogenee, con persone di provenienza, età e trascorsi professionali differenti
Conoscenza di tecniche di apprendimento/insegnamento per adulti
Gestione del tempo e delle scadenze
Dimestichezza con portali gestionali per la formazione (es. SIUF)

Per questa posizione, è indispensabile esperienza e/o comprovate competenze nella progettazione ed erogazione di corsi in aula in relazione alla specifica materia richiesta ed è gradita, ma non strettamente necessaria, esperienza in ambito di Politiche Attive del Lavoro e formazione finanziata.
Monte ore settimanale garantito da definire in fase di colloquio
Possibilità di lavoro Full Remote (100% formazione a distanza)

Chi siamo:

AKG Italia è parte del gruppo Angus Knight, una società Australiana co-fondata più di 30 anni fa da Duncan Angus, con la convinzione che compassione, esperienza e sviluppo delle competenze consentano alle persone di migliorare la propria vita e quella delle proprie comunità.


Forniamo soluzioni innovative per l'occupazione, la salute e l'istruzione in sei Paesi e più di 300 sedi in Australia, Canada, Italia, Singapore, Svezia e Regno Unito. Tra i nostri clienti ci sono persone in cerca di lavoro, studenti e studentesse, governi e amministrazioni locali, aziende e organizzazioni.


Oggi, AKG rimane fedele al suo scopo iniziale: valorizzare l’unicità delle persone aiutandole nei loro percorsi di occupazione e di istruzione, consentendogli di affermarsi all’interno delle loro comunità.

Raggiungiamo i nostri obiettivi attraverso la nostra rete globale, le competenze e l’esperienza della nostra squadra, e l’impegno che manteniamo per raggiungere il nostro scopo.


Posizione:

I Trainer che operano nell’ambito delle Politiche Attive del Lavoro e della formazione finanziata, hanno la responsabilità di supportare gli utenti in cerca di lavoro nello sviluppo delle proprie competenze attraverso la progettazione ed erogazione di servizi di formazione specifica, necessari per realizzare e/o raggiungere i loro obiettivi professionali.


Siamo alla ricerca di Docenti da inserire presso la nostra sede di Milano, per i corsi di:


  • Intelligenza Artificiale
  • Data Analyst con Power BI


Competenze tecniche richieste:

  • Gestione di aule eterogenee, con persone di provenienza, età e trascorsi professionali differenti
  • Gestione corsi intensivi
  • Conoscenza di tecniche di apprendimento/insegnamento per adulti
  • Gestione del tempo e delle scadenze
  • Dimestichezza con portali gestionali per la formazione (es. SIUF)


Per questa posizione, è indispensabile esperienza e/o comprovate competenze nella progettazione ed erogazione di corsi in aula in relazione alla specifica materia richiesta ed è gradita, ma non strettamente necessaria, esperienza in ambito di Politiche Attive del Lavoro e formazione finanziata.


Cosa offriamo:

  • Collaborazione Continuativa in partita iva
  • Monte ore settimanale garantito da definire in fase di colloquio
  • Possibilità di lavoro Full Remote (100% formazione a distanza)

4184448402,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-platform-analyst-intern-at-italiaonline-4184448402?position=60&pageNum=0&refId=Nz1L37jIF3FitVj25fkcDA%3D%3D&trackingId=PrDYu9jhBAVkrcNOiyR48w%3D%3D,Data Platform Analyst Intern,Italiaonline,"Assago, Lombardy, Italy","Siamo Italiaonline, la più grande internet company italiana. La nostra mission è diffondere e accelerare la digitalizzazione del nostro Paese per garantire ai nostri Clienti la possibilità di ottenere risultati migliori nella loro vita digitale e nel loro business online attraverso servizi innovativi e di qualità.

La nostra direzione Information Technology ha il compito di supportare i processi dell’azienda attraverso la gestione dell’infrastruttura, lo sviluppo della Data Platform e dei sistemi di supporto al business e delle piattaforme dei nostri prodotti digitali. Garantisce inoltre la governance dei progetti di sviluppo e la sicurezza del nostro patrimonio di dati.
Entrerai a far parte del team IT Data Platform Development, nella nostra direzione Information Technology, come Data Platform Analyst Intern.
contribuire alla creazione, al collaudo e alla manutenzione di pipeline di dati scalabili per l'acquisizione, l'elaborazione e la trasformazione di dati provenienti da differenti fonti
collaborare con team interfunzionali per comprendere i requisiti dei dati e contribuire alla progettazione e all'ottimizzazione dei modelli e dell'architettura dei dati
contribuire all'implementazione della qualità dei dati e dei processi di governance per garantire l'accuratezza, la coerenza e l'affidabilità dei dati
collaborare a stretto contatto con colleghe e colleghi per supportare le loro esigenze e fornire competenze tecniche nell'analisi dei dati
contribuire alla creazione di report per la diffusione della Business Intelligence all'interno dell'azienda
rimanere aggiornati sulle tecnologie emergenti e sulle migliori pratiche di ingegneria dei dati e contribuire alle iniziative di miglioramento continuo all'interno del team.
diploma in informatica o laurea in sistemi informativi, ingegneria o affini
buone capacità di programmazione in linguaggi come Python, SQL
familiarità con i concetti di modellazione dei dati e con i sistemi di database (ad esempio, database relazionali, database NoSQL)
familiarità con le piattaforme cloud (ad esempio, AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform) e con tool di reportistica (come PowerBI, Tableu) è considerata un plus.
Cosa offriamo per la tua crescita professionale:
modalità di lavoro ibrida, per garantirti il giusto equilibrio tra lavoro e vita privata
possibilità di entrare in un’azienda italiana che si muove in un contesto digitale in continua trasformazione
percorso “Z Academy” pensato per la tua crescita professionale.
Z Academy: dove crescita e opportunità si incontrano!
Z Academy è un percorso formativo pensato e costruito per te.
Avrai la possibilità di confrontarti con il Leader e Manager del Gruppo Italiaonline, per stimolare idee creative ed innovative
column2: conoscere l’azienda, il business, i clienti e i trend del settore per diventare Italiaonline Brand Ambassador.

column1: L'obiettivo della Z Academy è trasferire un «metodo di lavoro» e sviluppare competenze chiave attraverso momenti dedicati a: project management, sviluppo personale, comunicazione efficace.
Grazie alla Z Academy avrai l’opportunità di iniziare a costruire il tuo futuro, esplorando insieme nuove prospettive e sfide.
Non lasciarti sfuggire questa occasione nel mondo digitale: candidati oggi e inizia un percorso unico in Italiaonline!

Siamo Italiaonline, la più grande internet company italiana. La nostra mission è diffondere e accelerare la digitalizzazione del nostro Paese per garantire ai nostri Clienti la possibilità di ottenere risultati migliori nella loro vita digitale e nel loro business online attraverso servizi innovativi e di qualità.


La nostra direzione Information Technology ha il compito di supportare i processi dell’azienda attraverso la gestione dell’infrastruttura, lo sviluppo della Data Platform e dei sistemi di supporto al business e delle piattaforme dei nostri prodotti digitali. Garantisce inoltre la governance dei progetti di sviluppo e la sicurezza del nostro patrimonio di dati.


Entrerai a far parte del team IT Data Platform Development, nella nostra direzione Information Technology, come Data Platform Analyst Intern.


Ti occuperai nello specifico di:


  • contribuire alla creazione, al collaudo e alla manutenzione di pipeline di dati scalabili per l'acquisizione, l'elaborazione e la trasformazione di dati provenienti da differenti fonti
column2: • collaborare con team interfunzionali per comprendere i requisiti dei dati e contribuire alla progettazione e all'ottimizzazione dei modelli e dell'architettura dei dati
column3: • contribuire all'implementazione della qualità dei dati e dei processi di governance per garantire l'accuratezza, la coerenza e l'affidabilità dei dati
column4: • collaborare a stretto contatto con colleghe e colleghi per supportare le loro esigenze e fornire competenze tecniche nell'analisi dei dati
column5: • contribuire alla creazione di report per la diffusione della Business Intelligence all'interno dell'azienda
column6:
• rimanere aggiornati sulle tecnologie emergenti e sulle migliori pratiche di ingegneria dei dati e contribuire alle iniziative di miglioramento continuo all'interno del team.


    • Caratteristiche richieste:


    • diploma in informatica o laurea in sistemi informativi, ingegneria o affini
column7: • buone capacità di programmazione in linguaggi come Python, SQL
column8: • familiarità con i concetti di modellazione dei dati e con i sistemi di database (ad esempio, database relazionali, database NoSQL)
column9:
• familiarità con le piattaforme cloud (ad esempio, AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform) e con tool di reportistica (come PowerBI, Tableu) è considerata un plus.


    • Cosa offriamo per la tua crescita professionale:



    • percorso di stage retribuito
column10: • ticket restaurant
column11: • modalità di lavoro ibrida, per garantirti il giusto equilibrio tra lavoro e vita privata
column12: • possibilità di entrare in un’azienda italiana che si muove in un contesto digitale in continua trasformazione
column13:
• percorso “Z Academy” pensato per la tua crescita professionale.



    • Z Academy: dove crescita e opportunità si incontrano!


    Z Academy è un percorso formativo pensato e costruito per te.


    Avrai la possibilità di confrontarti con il Leader e Manager del Gruppo Italiaonline, per stimolare idee creative ed innovative
column14:
conoscere l’azienda, il business, i clienti e i trend del settore per diventare Italiaonline Brand Ambassador.


L'obiettivo della Z Academy è trasferire un «metodo di lavoro» e sviluppare competenze chiave attraverso momenti dedicati a: project management, sviluppo personale, comunicazione efficace.


Grazie alla Z Academy avrai l’opportunità di iniziare a costruire il tuo futuro, esplorando insieme nuove prospettive e sfide.



Sede di lavoro: Assago (MI)



Non lasciarti sfuggire questa occasione nel mondo digitale: candidati oggi e inizia un percorso unico in Italiaonline!

4210583791,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/bottega-veneta-business-intelligence-assistant-at-bottega-veneta-4210583791?position=1&pageNum=2&refId=ny9uG%2FFTF7gemZ0goNx0lA%3D%3D&trackingId=o25sLuRBZVti5tlLXN629A%3D%3D,BOTTEGA VENETA Business Intelligence Assistant,Bottega Veneta,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","

Inspiring individuality with innovative craftmanship since 1966, creativity lies at the heart of Bottega Veneta. Born in Vicenza, the house is rooted in Italian culture yet maintains a truly global outlook. An inclusive brand with exclusive products, Bottega Veneta is as much of a feeling as it is an aesthetic.
We are currently seeking a Business Intelligence Assistant as part of our dynamic team in Milan, with a starting temporary agency contract.
Be a partner for the business users for every BI activity, to respond in the most effective and efficient way to the business needs of the Finance and Merchandising areas
Support users in the day-by-day activities and collect the internal requests, translating them into technical specifications and provide assistance
Foster a data culture by keeping documentation up to date and provide the right education to end-users
Cooperate with Kering group for specific projects rollout.
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Statistics or a related field
Excellent knowledge of the Office suite, especially Excel
Knowledge of Business Intelligence tools such as MicroStrategy, PowerBI and QlikSense
Experience in a similar position within international environment will be considered as a plus
PowerBI dashboard development will be considered a plus
Good knowledge of English both written and spoken
Attitude to problem solving combined with strong professional relational skills to be able to translate business needs into technical terms
Curious, open-minded and focus on team success, high attention to detail.

This is a fabulous opportunity to join the Kering adventure and to actively contribute to the development of the business by becoming part of a global Luxury Group that offers endless possibilities to learn and grow. Talent development is a managerial principle at Kering and we are committed to fostering internal mobility. Our common vision promotes leadership skills and helps every employee to reach their full potential in a stimulating and fulfilling workplace environment.

Kering is committed to building a diverse workforce. We believe diversity in all its forms – gender, age, nationality, culture, religious beliefs and sexual orientation – enriches the workplace. It opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to adapt to a changing world. As an Equal Opportunity Employer we welcome and consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their background.

4130498632,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-subito-4130498632?position=2&pageNum=2&refId=ny9uG%2FFTF7gemZ0goNx0lA%3D%3D&trackingId=QfEpC%2Ft6jj3Z5iir%2FQ06NQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Subito,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","We’re Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We’re all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.
What You’ll Do & Who You Are
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subito’s team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.
The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.
The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so it’s more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding
4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences
Prior experience in a digital company
Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
Hands on experience on Data Science projects
Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
‘Work from anywhere’ weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a €8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don’t meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don’t meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

We’re Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We’re all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.

What You’ll Do &
column2:
Who You Are

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subito’s team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.

The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.

The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Your Typical Day

  • Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so it’s more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
  • Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
  • Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
  • Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
  • Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
  • Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding

Skills Required

  • 4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
  • Highly proficient with SQL
  • Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
  • Applied knowledge of statistical techniques
  • Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences

Plus

  • Good English proficiency level
  • Prior experience in a digital company
  • Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
  • Hands on experience on Data Science projects

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation package
  • Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
  • Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
  • Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
  • Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
  • ‘Work from anywhere’ weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
  • Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a €8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don’t meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don’t meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

4190828605,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/specialista-processi-e-analisi-di-back-office-at-a2a-4190828605?position=3&pageNum=2&refId=ny9uG%2FFTF7gemZ0goNx0lA%3D%3D&trackingId=QWaE2x5LaG8k4eoKMKHn6w%3D%3D,SPECIALISTA PROCESSI E ANALISI DI BACK OFFICE,A2A,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","

Per la nostra sede di Milano o Brescia siamo alla ricerca di una persona da inserire come Specialista Processi e Analisi di Back Office all’interno del team Back Office Grandi Clienti Energia Elettrica. La struttura ha lo scopo di presidiare, per il segmento di competenza, i processi di acquisizione e gestione nei sistemi commerciali dei contratti a valle dell'accettazione delle offerte e gestire le richieste post vendita, interfacciandosi con altre Strutture di Back Office, Fatturazione e Vendite. La struttura utilizza e gestisce data base relazionali a supporto delle attività.

A2A Energia. Società del Gruppo A2A che fornisce energia a oltre 2,5 milioni di clienti, costantemente ai vertici delle rilevazioni nazionali per il livello di soddisfazione. Presenza costante per i cittadini, in casa e nella città, porta nel loro mondo comfort e servizi innovativi per favorire l’efficienza energetica e la mobilità elettrica. Si impegna ogni giorno per offrire un servizio di qualità, che risponda alle esigenze più diverse, dal singolo alla grande azienda.
Monitoraggio dei processi ed elaborazione/analisi della reportistica operativa e di controllo, verificandone la coerenza e consistenza nella filiera della mappa applicativa
Gestione dei flussi informativi legati alle movimentazioni del portafoglio clienti (nuove contrattualizzazioni, variazioni) interfacciandosi con altre funzioni
Analisi e gestione delle richieste cliente post-vendita
Manutenzione su database relazionali utilizzati a supporto delle analisi sull’anagrafica
Coinvolgimento nelle evoluzioni operative e normative per definire gli adeguamenti dei processi interni e le specifiche degli interventi sui sistemi
Sei la persona giusta se ti riconosci in questo profilo
Laurea in materie scientifiche o Diploma tecnico
Esperienza di almeno 2 anni in un ruolo analogo
Preferibile conoscenza di database relazionali Access e MSSQL con basi di programmazione in linguaggio VBA e SQL
Preferibile conoscenza del CRM Salesforce e SAP Billing
Completano il profilo: mente analitica e capacità di analisi dei dati, predisposizione all’attività informatica e alle sue logiche
Flessibilità: settimana lavorativa con venerdì a orario ridotto, flessibilità negli orari di entrata/uscita e pausa pranzo
column2: Smartworking sino al 60% dell’orario di lavoro su base bimestrale

column1: Salute e benessere: assistenza sanitaria integrativa, supporto psicologico attraverso counseling, webinar dedicati al benessere psicofisico e vaccino antinfluenzale

Famiglia: A2A Life Caring, iniziativa a supporto della genitorialità attraverso un mese aggiuntivo retribuito al 100% per maternità/paternità, rimborsi spese per figli, convenzioni con asili nido, team coaching per neogenitori
column2: spazio caregiver, offriamo webinar e uno spazio di ascolto dedicati a chi si prende cura di persone fragili o non autosufficienti

column1: Formazione e sviluppo: programma di induction dedicato ai nuovi assunti, gestione dei talenti, corsi di formazione e possibilità di crescita interna e job rotation tramite candidatura interna

Risparmio e tempo libero: oltre 300 convenzioni, tra cui trasporti pubblici, attività sportive, viaggi, eventi culturali, e offerte speciali per luce e gas. Opzioni per il car sharing e la conversione del premio di risultato in benefit di welfare
Ambiente di lavoro: promuoviamo una cultura che valorizza la diversità, l’equità e l'inclusione (DE&I)
column2: potrai inoltre avere la possibilità di unirti a un team dedicato allo sviluppo di iniziative e progetti su queste tematiche. Sosteniamo l'evoluzione tecnologica e offriamo strumenti e risorse per promuovere il lavoro digitale

La selezione è rivolta a candidati e candidate in linea con le competenze richieste. I dati personali raccolti verranno trattati nel rispetto del Regolamento Ue 2016/679 (GDPR).

4200113538,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/intern-data-scientist-at-gls-italy-4200113538?position=4&pageNum=2&refId=ny9uG%2FFTF7gemZ0goNx0lA%3D%3D&trackingId=GLxcvXfW%2FH%2F9ngSV%2BrMyZQ%3D%3D,Intern Data Scientist,GLS Italy,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","All'interno della direzione Strategy, Transformation & Digital,
stiamo cercando una risorsa da inserire nel team Digital Office, responsabile di trovare soluzioni basate sui data e sull’AI con l’obiettivo di potenziare il nostro business, nel ruolo di:
Collaborare con il nostro principale Data Scientist nel disegnare ed implementare Proof of Concepts(PoCs) end-to-end per le nuove iniziative
Analizzare Database complessi per estrarre informazioni utili alle decisioni del business
Partecipare allo sviluppo dell’AI e di modelli statistici
Rimanere aggiornati sui progressi del settore in ambito Data Science e Machine Learning
Attualmente studente e/o laurea in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistica e/o affini
Conoscenza ed esperienza nel lavoro con dati grezzi e database (ETL)
Comprensione degli algoritmi e delle tecniche di Machine Learning
Buona padronanza della lingua inglese (Livello B2)
Problem solving e forti capacità analitiche
Voglia di imparare e mettersi in gioco in un contesto dinamico e in forte cambiamento
Sede di Lavoro: San Giuliano Milanese (MI) + Smart Working (fino a 3 giorni a settimana)
Orario di Lavoro: 9:00-18:00 dal lunedì al venerdì

column2:
Digital,

stiamo cercando una risorsa da inserire nel team Digital Office, responsabile di trovare soluzioni basate sui data e sull’AI con l’obiettivo di potenziare il nostro business, nel ruolo di:


Intern Data Scientist


Principali Attività e Responsabilità:


  • Collaborare con il nostro principale Data Scientist nel disegnare ed implementare Proof of Concepts(PoCs) end-to-end per le nuove iniziative
  • Analizzare Database complessi per estrarre informazioni utili alle decisioni del business
  • Partecipare allo sviluppo dell’AI e di modelli statistici
  • Rimanere aggiornati sui progressi del settore in ambito Data Science e Machine Learning


Competenze e Requisiti:


  • Attualmente studente e/o laurea in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistica e/o affini
  • Conoscenza ed esperienza nel lavoro con dati grezzi e database (ETL)
  • Comprensione degli algoritmi e delle tecniche di Machine Learning
  • Buona padronanza della lingua inglese (Livello B2)
  • Conoscenza del pacchetto Office
  • Proattività e curiosità
  • Problem solving e forti capacità analitiche
  • Voglia di imparare e mettersi in gioco in un contesto dinamico e in forte cambiamento


Sede di Lavoro: San Giuliano Milanese (MI) + Smart Working (fino a 3 giorni a settimana)


Orario di Lavoro: 9:00-18:00 dal lunedì al venerdì

4199463044,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-mainstreaming-4199463044?position=5&pageNum=2&refId=ny9uG%2FFTF7gemZ0goNx0lA%3D%3D&trackingId=knS13EsB0IqXSQODag3ZYg%3D%3D,Data Analyst,MainStreaming,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","MainStreaming® is an intelligent media delivery company that empowers enterprises, media and gaming companies to ensure the best Quality of Experience to their audience, through its revolutionary AI-powered technology.

It optimizes the viewing experience with its Intelligent Media Deliver Platform (iMDP), the first platform designed to guarantee full governance over the streaming process, the highest Quality of Service and the best Return on Investment

We seek a results-driven Data Analyst to spearhead our company's performance management and analytical initiatives. In this key role, you will define KPIs across the organization, develop comprehensive performance frameworks, and deliver critical insights to our C-Level leadership team through data-driven analyses and quarterly business reviews.
Define and implement Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) across all departments to drive data-informed decision-making.
Develop and maintain a comprehensive performance management framework to monitor company objectives, analyze current operational performance metrics, and track progress against strategic goals.
Perform complex cross-functional analyses by extracting, combining, and interpreting data from multiple sources to uncover actionable insights.
Design and deliver quarterly business review presentations for C-Level executives, highlighting performance trends, identifying areas for improvement, and recommending data-driven solutions.

Extract, transform, and clean data from various sources and databases to ensure data integrity and consistency for analysis. Collaborate with stakeholders across departments to understand business requirements and translate them into analytical frameworks.
Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to visualize key metrics and facilitate data-driven discussions.
Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or related field
column2: Master's degree preferred.

column1: 3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or similar analytical roles.
Experience in conducting analyses and analyzing performance data within the Content Delivery Network (CDN) or ISP industry is a plus.
Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to transform complex data into actionable insights.
Proficient in SQL for data extraction and manipulation from various database systems.
Working knowledge of Python for data cleaning, analysis, and visualization (pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib).
Experience in designing and implementing KPIs and performance-tracking frameworks
Excellent data visualization skills and experience with BI tools (such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker).
Fluent English and outstanding written and verbal communication abilities are required.
Execution & Precision: Strong attention to detail, ability to meet deadlines, and accuracy in financial reporting.
Ownership & Accountability: Taking responsibility for work, following through on commitments, and delivering high-quality results.
Adaptability & Resilience: Thriving in a fast-paced environment, responding well to change, and maintaining professionalism under pressure.
Collaboration & Influence: Working effectively across teams, promoting knowledge sharing, and fostering a culture of transparency.
Continuous Learning: Proactively seeking opportunities to enhance financial expertise and industry knowledge.
A young, dynamic and entrepreneurial environment that promotes self-development and growth.
Breakfast, lunch and snacks in the office.
Salary and benefits will be assessed in relation to the candidate's experience and skills

In MainStreaming you will be part of a dynamic, flexible, young, tight-knit and international environment and will have the chance to work in a company that values innovation, out of the box thinking, its employees and is committed to making the world a better place.

MainStreaming is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

I candidati interessati possono inviare un curriculum vitae con l'autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali ai sensi del D.Lgs 196/03 e “Codice in materia di protezione dei dati personali” e dell’art. 13 GDPR 679/16 – “Regolamento europeo sulla protezione dei dati personali”.

MainStreaming® is an intelligent media delivery company that empowers enterprises, media and gaming companies to ensure the best Quality of Experience to their audience, through its revolutionary AI-powered technology.

It optimizes the viewing experience with its Intelligent Media Deliver Platform (iMDP), the first platform designed to guarantee full governance over the streaming process, the highest Quality of Service and the best Return on Investment


Data Analyst


Job Description:


We seek a results-driven Data Analyst to spearhead our company's performance management and analytical initiatives. In this key role, you will define KPIs across the organization, develop comprehensive performance frameworks, and deliver critical insights to our C-Level leadership team through data-driven analyses and quarterly business reviews.


Key Responsibilities:


  • Define and implement Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) across all departments to drive data-informed decision-making.
  • Develop and maintain a comprehensive performance management framework to monitor company objectives, analyze current operational performance metrics, and track progress against strategic goals.
  • Perform complex cross-functional analyses by extracting, combining, and interpreting data from multiple sources to uncover actionable insights.
  • Design and deliver quarterly business review presentations for C-Level executives, highlighting performance trends, identifying areas for improvement, and recommending data-driven solutions.
  • Extract, transform, and clean data from various sources and databases to ensure data integrity and consistency for analysis. Collaborate with stakeholders across departments to understand business requirements and translate them into analytical frameworks.
  • Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to visualize key metrics and facilitate data-driven discussions.


Qualifications:


  • Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or related field
column2:
