4152730331,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analyst-at-cream-consulting-4152730331?position=33&pageNum=0&refId=8gdNUx6Fxsnml3Lf0ENChQ%3D%3D&trackingId=fSI0Al%2BDNd4hdEXYqjMXRQ%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Analyst,Cream Consulting,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Permanent position only

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.
WHAT IS A BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Jean, Business Analyst Business Intelligence, translate the BI needs of the business teams in specifications for the IT department, for both small demands or as part of larger projects (contributions or BI project).
Act as person of contact between Business Engineering Teams and the Development Team
Define the business specifications for BI needs

Participation in (or management of) BI projects, or on the BI tracks of other projects for the engineering activities (requirement definition, impact analysis, process definition), while representing the BI vision (and BI target architecture) that has been defined
Collaboration with data delivery experts to deliver on projects
Understand business requirements and build a functional analysis which covers needs of the business according to our BI reference architecture
HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?
You have a Master degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent by experience
You have good knowledge in BI techniques and tools (BO, SAS, Cognos...)
You have a cultural openness and adaptability, you are rigorous, customer oriented, and you have high communication skills and analytical skills
You are polyvalent and can adapt easily to quickly changing environment
You are capable to think out of the box and maintain in the meantime a pragmatic approach
You are able to work with autonomy while being also a great team player
You are fluent in French and English
column2: a good knowledge of Dutch is also required

column1: You are committed to travelling abroad occasionally upon the client’s request
An experience in concepts: ETL, DWHSE, data & process mining, reporting… could be a real asset
WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?
A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day
We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!
THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,
CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY""

Permanent position only


WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business &
column2: Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical &amp
column3:
Transport.


CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

  • 1/3 of Personal development
  • 1/3 of Collective Intelligence
  • 1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues 😀


WHAT IS A BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Jean, Business Analyst Business Intelligence, translate the BI needs of the business teams in specifications for the IT department, for both small demands or as part of larger projects (contributions or BI project).


YOUR TASKS :

  • Act as person of contact between Business Engineering Teams and the Development Team
  • Define the business specifications for BI needs
  • Participation in (or management of) BI projects, or on the BI tracks of other projects for the engineering activities (requirement definition, impact analysis, process definition), while representing the BI vision (and BI target architecture) that has been defined
  • Collaboration with data delivery experts to deliver on projects
  • Understand business requirements and build a functional analysis which covers needs of the business according to our BI reference architecture
  • Collaborate with the development team


HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

  • You have a Master degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent by experience
  • You have good knowledge in BI techniques and tools (BO, SAS, Cognos...)
  • You have a cultural openness and adaptability, you are rigorous, customer oriented, and you have high communication skills and analytical skills
  • You are polyvalent and can adapt easily to quickly changing environment
  • You are capable to think out of the box and maintain in the meantime a pragmatic approach
  • You are able to work with autonomy while being also a great team player
  • You are fluent in French and English
column4:
a good knowledge of Dutch is also required
  • You are committed to travelling abroad occasionally upon the client’s request

    • Bonus

    • An experience in concepts: ETL, DWHSE, data &
column5:
process mining, reporting… could be a real asset


WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

  • A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
  • You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
  • You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
  • You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
  • We have values we share, live with, experiment every day
  • We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!


""THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY""

4200130695,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/commercial-data-analyst-at-luminus-4200130695?position=34&pageNum=0&refId=8gdNUx6Fxsnml3Lf0ENChQ%3D%3D&trackingId=Ep8af7ZONV3kixFcHHBF7w%3D%3D,Commercial Data Analyst,Luminus,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Publication date: April 3, 2025
Shape the Future of Retail with Data!

As a Commercial Data Analyst in the Retail & B2B department, you'll leverage SQL, SAS and Qlik to analyze data, uncover trends and enhance retail operations and customer experience. Your insights will be key in steering Luminus' vision.
You lead the development and maintenance of advanced data analytics models using SAS and Qlik to support business decision-making.
Gathering detailed knowledge of business processes, you maintain close relationships with business stakeholders.
You generate interactive dashboards and reports to visualize KPIs and other critical metrics.
Supporting day-to-day operations with timely data analysis, you respond to ad-hoc data requests.
You collaborate with stakeholders to translate data insights into actionable business strategies.
Through proactive data insights and innovations you drive continuous improvement in retail processes.
You hold an MSc Degree in a business/data/technology-related field or have equivalent experience.
You have expert knowledge of SQL, data processing tools such as SAS, Python, or R, and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Qlik.
You possess a strong analytical mindset with meticulous attention to detail.
You work with an agile and results-focused ethic.
You are a team player with a customer-centric approach and a proactive way of working.
You have excellent communication skills in English and proficiency in Dutch/French.
The energy sector is one of the most rewarding industries in Belgium with a highly rewarding compensation and benefits package:
Competitive compensation: Attractive salary with a performance-based bonus that can be optimized to your personal preferences, plus meal vouchers.
Insurance & social benefits: Group insurance and hospitalization coverage for the entire family. Additional reimbursement for healthcare and pharmaceutical costs.
Mobility: Full reimbursement for public transport, kilometer-based cycling reimbursement and flexible mobility choice: you can opt for a salay car.
Internet & communication: Home internet covered, reimbursement for a personal mobile device with a phone subscription.
Home Office: A fully-equipped home office, including an ergonomical ICT set-up.

Exclusive discounts: 30% off gas and electricity after six months, discounts on energy-saving services (e.g., solar panels, heat pumps) and reduced prices on top brands, amusement parks, festivals and more.
Curious about your benefits and more? Visit our jobsite.

Publication date: April 3, 2025

Brussels

Contract open-end

Shape the Future of Retail with Data!

As a Commercial Data Analyst in the Retail &
column2:
B2B department, you'll leverage SQL, SAS and Qlik to analyze data, uncover trends and enhance retail operations and customer experience. Your insights will be key in steering Luminus' vision.

What You’ll Do

  • You lead the development and maintenance of advanced data analytics models using SAS and Qlik to support business decision-making.
  • Gathering detailed knowledge of business processes, you maintain close relationships with business stakeholders.
  • You generate interactive dashboards and reports to visualize KPIs and other critical metrics.
  • Supporting day-to-day operations with timely data analysis, you respond to ad-hoc data requests.
  • You collaborate with stakeholders to translate data insights into actionable business strategies.
  • Through proactive data insights and innovations you drive continuous improvement in retail processes.

What You Bring

  • You hold an MSc Degree in a business/data/technology-related field or have equivalent experience.
  • You have expert knowledge of SQL, data processing tools such as SAS, Python, or R, and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Qlik.
  • You possess a strong analytical mindset with meticulous attention to detail.
  • You work with an agile and results-focused ethic.
  • You are a team player with a customer-centric approach and a proactive way of working.
  • You have excellent communication skills in English and proficiency in Dutch/French.

What you'll get in return ?

The energy sector is one of the most rewarding industries in Belgium with a highly rewarding compensation and benefits package:

  • Competitive compensation: Attractive salary with a performance-based bonus that can be optimized to your personal preferences, plus meal vouchers.
  • Insurance &

  • Mobility: Full reimbursement for public transport, kilometer-based cycling reimbursement and flexible mobility choice: you can opt for a salay car.

  • Home Office: A fully-equipped home office, including an ergonomical ICT set-up.

4207305536,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analist-at-geo-solutions-4207305536?position=36&pageNum=0&refId=8gdNUx6Fxsnml3Lf0ENChQ%3D%3D&trackingId=3MuQF1wDU04irOjJooYXRg%3D%3D,Data Analist,Geo Solutions,"Edegem, Flemish Region, Belgium","Vacature Ervaren Data Analist

Geo Solutions is een Belgisch bedrijf dat organisaties helpt om de kracht van locatiedata ten volle te benutten. Wij ontwerpen en ontwikkelen slimme GEO-ICT oplossingen op maat. Onze innovatieve en flexibele dienstverlening ondersteunt klanten in de overheid, nutsbedrijven, industrie en constructie bij strategische en operationele beslissingen.

Waar je ons terugvindt? Wel, ons hoofdkantoor is gelegen in Edegem, maar we bieden ook flexplekken aan in onze hubs in Gent, Leuven en Namen. Daarnaast zal je ook op wekelijkse basis ter plaatse op je toegewezen project bij je klant werken.
Zo ziet jouw rol als Data Analist eruit:
Werkplek: bij je klant, Geo-kantoor/hub, thuis

Als Data Analist bij Geo Solutions maak je locatiedata inzichtelijk voor onze klanten. Een achtergrond in de brede wereld van geo is niet noodzakelijk, maar je hart mag wel een slagje sneller slaan bij het zien van X, Y en Z’s.
Je vertaalt businessnoden naar datavereisten, en je kan daar helder over communiceren.
Je voert diepgaande en kwalitatieve analyses uit op complexe datasets en zet de bevindingen om naar heldere rapporten.
Je schat het potentieel van use cases in door een eerste exploratieve screening. Daarbij zet je zowel een sceptische als opportunistische bril op.
Je volgt technologische ontwikkelingen op en deelt actief je kennis met interne en externe collega’s.
Bachelor- of masterdiploma in IT of een wetenschappelijke richting
Minstens 5 jaar ervaring als data analist of een vergelijkbare rol
Sterk in Python met ervaring in (Geo)Pandas, NumPy, Folium, DuckDB, Polars, …
Vaardig met BI- tools (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, Superset) bij voorkeur met geografische data
Ervaring met big data (Hadoop, Spark, Databricks) en cloudplatformen (Azure, GCP, AWS)
Kennis van AI/ML (TensorFlow, Torch, Keras) is een plus
Vloeiend Nederlands en Engels zijn een evidentie
In ruil voor je inzet en leergierigheid bieden we je een boeiende job met toffe collega’s. En dat in een bedrijfscultuur die persoonlijke ontwikkeling en vernieuwing sterk aanmoedigt.
Bij Geo Solutions mag je rekenen op:

Een aantrekkelijk salarispakket: een brutoloon (rekening houden met je ervaring en diploma), aangevuld met bedrijfswagen en tankkaart (of laadkaart), maaltijdcheques, hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering, maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding.
Een gezonde werk-life balans: zo willen wij plezier binnen en buiten de werkuren motivering door flexibele werktijden aan te bieden
Aandacht voor nieuwe ideeën: hier ben je geen nummer, wel een belangrijke aanwinst voor het team. We horen graag hoe jij bepaalde projecten ziet en hoe jij het zou aanpakken

Doorgroeimogelijkheden: we juichen met veel plezier je leergierigheid toe en bieden je toegang tot onze Geo Academy. Wil je graag een extra training volgen, een certificaat behalen of een externe opleiding volgen, dat kan allemaal!
State of the art technologieën: je bouwt ze niet alleen, je werkt er ook mee!
Kan je niet wachten om ons team te versterken? Stuur je cv en een korte motivatie naar jobs@geosolutions.be

Bij ons draait het om mensen. We willen een plek zijn waar je jezelf kunt zijn, ongeacht wie je bent of hoe je in het leven staat. Verschillen maken ons sterker, en we geloven dat iedereen iets waardevols bijdraagt. Daarom zorgen we ervoor dat je je bij ons gerespecteerd voelt, en dat je met plezier je talenten kunt inzetten.

Vacature Ervaren Data Analist


Geo Solutions is een Belgisch bedrijf dat organisaties helpt om de kracht van locatiedata ten volle te benutten. Wij ontwerpen en ontwikkelen slimme GEO-ICT oplossingen op maat. Onze innovatieve en flexibele dienstverlening ondersteunt klanten in de overheid, nutsbedrijven, industrie en constructie bij strategische en operationele beslissingen.


Waar je ons terugvindt? Wel, ons hoofdkantoor is gelegen in Edegem, maar we bieden ook flexplekken aan in onze hubs in Gent, Leuven en Namen. Daarnaast zal je ook op wekelijkse basis ter plaatse op je toegewezen project bij je klant werken.


Zo ziet jouw rol als Data Analist eruit:

Werkplek: bij je klant, Geo-kantoor/hub, thuis


Als Data Analist bij Geo Solutions maak je locatiedata inzichtelijk voor onze klanten. Een achtergrond in de brede wereld van geo is niet noodzakelijk, maar je hart mag wel een slagje sneller slaan bij het zien van X, Y en Z’s.


Een greep uit je takenpakket:

  • Je vertaalt businessnoden naar datavereisten, en je kan daar helder over communiceren.
  • Je voert diepgaande en kwalitatieve analyses uit op complexe datasets en zet de bevindingen om naar heldere rapporten.
  • Je schat het potentieel van use cases in door een eerste exploratieve screening. Daarbij zet je zowel een sceptische als opportunistische bril op.
  • Je volgt technologische ontwikkelingen op en deelt actief je kennis met interne en externe collega’s.


Jouw profiel:

  • Bachelor- of masterdiploma in IT of een wetenschappelijke richting
  • Minstens 5 jaar ervaring als data analist of een vergelijkbare rol
  • Sterk in Python met ervaring in (Geo)Pandas, NumPy, Folium, DuckDB, Polars, …
  • Ervaren in SQL en ETL-processen
  • Vaardig met BI- tools (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, Superset) bij voorkeur met geografische data
  • Ervaring met big data (Hadoop, Spark, Databricks) en cloudplatformen (Azure, GCP, AWS)
  • Kennis van AI/ML (TensorFlow, Torch, Keras) is een plus
  • Vloeiend Nederlands en Engels zijn een evidentie


Dit krijg je van ons

In ruil voor je inzet en leergierigheid bieden we je een boeiende job met toffe collega’s. En dat in een bedrijfscultuur die persoonlijke ontwikkeling en vernieuwing sterk aanmoedigt.


Bij Geo Solutions mag je rekenen op:

  • Een aantrekkelijk salarispakket: een brutoloon (rekening houden met je ervaring en diploma), aangevuld met bedrijfswagen en tankkaart (of laadkaart), maaltijdcheques, hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering, maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding.
  • Een gezonde werk-life balans: zo willen wij plezier binnen en buiten de werkuren motivering door flexibele werktijden aan te bieden
  • Aandacht voor nieuwe ideeën: hier ben je geen nummer, wel een belangrijke aanwinst voor het team. We horen graag hoe jij bepaalde projecten ziet en hoe jij het zou aanpakken
  • Doorgroeimogelijkheden: we juichen met veel plezier je leergierigheid toe en bieden je toegang tot onze Geo Academy. Wil je graag een extra training volgen, een certificaat behalen of een externe opleiding volgen, dat kan allemaal!
  • State of the art technologieën: je bouwt ze niet alleen, je werkt er ook mee!


Kan je niet wachten om ons team te versterken? Stuur je cv en een korte motivatie naar jobs@geosolutions.be


Diversiteit, inclusie en gelijkheid

Bij ons draait het om mensen. We willen een plek zijn waar je jezelf kunt zijn, ongeacht wie je bent of hoe je in het leven staat. Verschillen maken ons sterker, en we geloven dat iedereen iets waardevols bijdraagt. Daarom zorgen we ervoor dat je je bij ons gerespecteerd voelt, en dat je met plezier je talenten kunt inzetten.

4200129785,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/commercial-data-analyst-at-luminus-4200129785?position=37&pageNum=0&refId=8gdNUx6Fxsnml3Lf0ENChQ%3D%3D&trackingId=ZC2qiJSgm6yVOXx0bXOgzQ%3D%3D,Commercial Data Analyst,Luminus,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Publication date: April 3, 2025

Become a key part of our Data Analysis team in the Retail & B2B department and help shape Luminus' vision with data-driven insights. Your skills in SQL, SAS, and Qlik will be essential for analyzing large datasets to reveal trends and patterns that enhance retail operations and improve the customer experience.
You develop and maintain advanced data analytics models using SAS and Qlik to support business decision-making.
You generate interactive dashboards and reports to visualize KPIs and other critical metrics.
You maintain close relationships with business stakeholders and acquire detailed knowledge of business processes.
You collaborate with stakeholders to translate data insights into actionable business strategies.
You respond to ad-hoc data requests and support day-to-day operations with timely data analysis.
You drive continuous improvement in retail processes through proactive data insights and innovations.
You present data-driven recommendations to management and aid in the decision-making process.
You hold an MSc degree in a business, data, or technology-related field, or have equivalent experience.
You have expert knowledge of SQL. You are highly skilled in data processing tools such as SAS, Python, or R.
You also have knowledge of data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Qlik.
You have a strong analytical mindset with a keen attention to detail.
You are agile and results-focused, with a work ethic that drives success.
You are a team player with a customer-centric approach and a proactive way of working.
You possess excellent communication skills in English and are proficient in Dutch or French.
Curious about your benefits and more? Visit our jobsite.

Publication date: April 3, 2025

Brussels

Contract open-end

Become a key part of our Data Analysis team in the Retail &
column2:
B2B department and help shape Luminus' vision with data-driven insights. Your skills in SQL, SAS, and Qlik will be essential for analyzing large datasets to reveal trends and patterns that enhance retail operations and improve the customer experience.

Your Daily Job

  • You develop and maintain advanced data analytics models using SAS and Qlik to support business decision-making.
  • You generate interactive dashboards and reports to visualize KPIs and other critical metrics.
  • You maintain close relationships with business stakeholders and acquire detailed knowledge of business processes.
  • You collaborate with stakeholders to translate data insights into actionable business strategies.
  • You respond to ad-hoc data requests and support day-to-day operations with timely data analysis.
  • You drive continuous improvement in retail processes through proactive data insights and innovations.
  • You present data-driven recommendations to management and aid in the decision-making process.

Your Profile

  • You hold an MSc degree in a business, data, or technology-related field, or have equivalent experience.
  • You have expert knowledge of SQL. You are highly skilled in data processing tools such as SAS, Python, or R.
  • You also have knowledge of data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Qlik.
  • You have a strong analytical mindset with a keen attention to detail.
  • You are agile and results-focused, with a work ethic that drives success.
  • You are a team player with a customer-centric approach and a proactive way of working.
  • You possess excellent communication skills in English and are proficient in Dutch or French.

Curious about your benefits and more? Visit our jobsite.

4202747264,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/impact-analyzer-at-nissan-motor-corporation-4202747264?position=40&pageNum=0&refId=8gdNUx6Fxsnml3Lf0ENChQ%3D%3D&trackingId=h5u7Vo6v7Q24MfU0l05eAA%3D%3D,Impact Analyzer,Nissan Motor Corporation,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fuelled by a force of over 160,000 dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of ""Defy Ordinary"".
We are now looking for an Impact Analyser to join our newly created RBU. In this role, you will join the Analytics & Innovation team and report to the Analytics & Innovation Director.
How you can contribute and have an impact?
Follow and measure the impact of the incubators work and ensure the sustainability aspect within the projects and activities and to record/share learnings.
Impact Measurement: Develop and implement metrics and methodologies to measure the impact of incubator projects and activities.
Sustainability Assurance: Ensure that all projects and activities within the incubator are designed and executed with sustainability in mind.
Data Collection and Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret data to assess the effectiveness and sustainability of incubator initiatives.
Reporting: Prepare detailed reports on the impact and sustainability of projects, providing insights and recommendations for improvement.
Knowledge Sharing: Record and share learnings from incubator projects with internal teams and external stakeholders to promote best practices and continuous improvement.
Stakeholder Engagement: Work closely with project teams, mentors, and external partners to gather feedback and ensure alignment with sustainability goals.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for enhancing the impact and sustainability of incubator activities and implement necessary changes.
Proven experience in impact measurement, sustainability management, or a related role.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Sustainability, Innovation Management, or a related field. A Master's degree is preferred.
Fluency in English, other local languages are considered as an advantage.
New business model design, Pricing, Market sizing.
Strong analytical, project management, and communication skills.
Ability to work with diverse stakeholders and drive continuous improvement.
Detail-oriented, proactive, and passionate about sustainability and innovation.

Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.
Our future vision and ambition is ""Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond"" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.

column2: Innovation team and report to the Analytics &amp

Innovation Director.

  • Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for enhancing the impact and sustainability of incubator activities and implement necessary changes.

What we look for:

  • Proven experience in impact measurement, sustainability management, or a related role.
  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Sustainability, Innovation Management, or a related field. A Master's degree is preferred.
  • Fluency in English, other local languages are considered as an advantage.
  • Business viability mindset.
  • New business model experience
  • Customer journey understanding.
  • Lifecycle management.
  • New business model design, Pricing, Market sizing.
  • Workshop animation.
  • Strong analytical, project management, and communication skills.
  • Ability to work with diverse stakeholders and drive continuous improvement.
  • Detail-oriented, proactive, and passionate about sustainability and innovation.

Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.

Our future vision and ambition is ""Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond"" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.

4213183350,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-church-international-limited-4213183350?position=43&pageNum=0&refId=8gdNUx6Fxsnml3Lf0ENChQ%3D%3D&trackingId=S6ejabCeRYr%2FHyGroJ63GA%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Church International Limited,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","MUST BE BASED IN BELGIUM
Fluency in English and either French or Dutch

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will support our client in upgrading their current data setup and developing new data analytics methods. Your role will involve both strategic and operational tasks, contributing to the overall vision of data management and performing detailed data analysis.
Upgrade data sourcing, modelling, and analysis methods.
Develop data analytics methods to meet current and future needs
Deliver high-quality data sets and analytics outputs
Contribute to the strategic vision of OPC data management.
Perform data exploration, extraction, and data crunching for BI purposes
Utilise diverse data analytical methodologies, including machine learning and forecasting
Technical Proficiency: SQL, Python, interaction with Oracle DBs, predictive modelling (machine learning), and data visualisation (Tableau, Power BI).
Preferable: Knowledge of AB Initio and familiarity with the SAS universe.
Mandatory: At least 3 years of relevant experience in data analytics, proven data management background, and management consulting experience

Excellent communication and influencing skills, proactive attitude, strong analytical and synthesis skills, autonomy, commitment, perseverance, and the ability to work in a dynamic, multicultural environment.
educational Background: A master’s degree in data analysis, data science, or a business degree with proven experience in data analytics.

This role is perfect for a proactive and skilled Data Analyst ready to take on new challenges and drive significant changes within the data management landscape. Apply now or email Lydia.wills@church-int.com

MUST BE BASED IN BELGIUM

50% on-site in brussels, 50% remote working

Fluency in English and either French or Dutch


As a Senior Data Analyst, you will support our client in upgrading their current data setup and developing new data analytics methods. Your role will involve both strategic and operational tasks, contributing to the overall vision of data management and performing detailed data analysis.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Upgrade data sourcing, modelling, and analysis methods.
  • Develop data analytics methods to meet current and future needs
  • Deliver high-quality data sets and analytics outputs
  • Contribute to the strategic vision of OPC data management.
  • Perform data exploration, extraction, and data crunching for BI purposes
  • Utilise diverse data analytical methodologies, including machine learning and forecasting
  • Create compelling data visualisations.


Skills and Experience:

  • Technical Proficiency: SQL, Python, interaction with Oracle DBs, predictive modelling (machine learning), and data visualisation (Tableau, Power BI).
  • Preferable: Knowledge of AB Initio and familiarity with the SAS universe.
  • Mandatory: At least 3 years of relevant experience in data analytics, proven data management background, and management consulting experience
  • Excellent communication and influencing skills, proactive attitude, strong analytical and synthesis skills, autonomy, commitment, perseverance, and the ability to work in a dynamic, multicultural environment.
  • educational Background: A master’s degree in data analysis, data science, or a business degree with proven experience in data analytics.


Language Requirements:

  • Fluent in Dutch or French
  • Fluent in English


This role is perfect for a proactive and skilled Data Analyst ready to take on new challenges and drive significant changes within the data management landscape. Apply now or email Lydia.wills@church-int.com

4195833974,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-research-analyst-at-mmgy-tci-research-4195833974?position=45&pageNum=0&refId=8gdNUx6Fxsnml3Lf0ENChQ%3D%3D&trackingId=hvD7Sejfis6F4t4kEU1Nug%3D%3D,Junior Research Analyst,MMGY TCI Research,"Brussels Region, Belgium","MMGY Global is the largest and most integrated travel marketing firm in the world specialising in travel, tourism, hospitality, culinary experiences, and entertainment. To ensure we invest our clients’ budgets in ways that maximise their success, we work hard to provide the best innovative proprietary research across all destination marketing and management channels and disciplines. The MMGY Travel Intelligence division is vital to creating and sustaining the company’s sustainable competitive advantage in the travel and tourism industry.

The Junior Research Analyst role will be based in Brussels and report to a Senior Analyst. This position will also have the opportunity to work with other team members of the Travel Intelligence Group based in other locations (France, UK, US). MMGY Travel Intelligence in Brussels (TCI Research) focuses on destination intelligence and works for the most prestigious tourism destinations and travel brands in and outside Europe, using a combination of surveys and big data.
Duties and Responsibilities of the Junior Research Analyst:

Will serve as an analyst for all research projects within their assigned portfolio, including data analytics, critical thinking, and the translation of data into true insights. The Junior Research Analyst will also work closely with MMGY channel leaders to help translate insights into strategic solutions, ideas and recommendations
Will serve as the primary member for collecting, processing and controlling data, using in-house data solutions, including surveys and big data sources.
Will work closely with other data operations teams on project methodology design, data collection strategies, data tabulation quality control, and report design
Will be responsible for survey design, development, and the structure, layout, and content of client reports and deliverables using agency report templates and design standards
Will be responsible for the data visualisation in reports and dashboards.
Will provide excellent client service under a Key Account Manager’s supervision when it comes to the day-to-day communication within projects.
Will collaborate on a cross-functional basis with other MMGY teams, including tasks such as improving strategies for data collection, quality and analysis.

At MMGY Global we believe that in order to go places as a company, we must give others the opportunity to shine. We strive to create a vibrant, open, and collaborative work environment where people can be and bring their best selves to work. We are looking for an ambitious candidate with relevant experience in a similar role, or somebody looking for the next step in their career. The requirements for the role are:
A first relevant experience in market research, data analysis and reporting, trend-based tracking and analysis, or similar
Experience in statistical modelling, data analytics, and data management tools, including SPSS or similar, BI solutions (Tableau, Power BI..) and Microsoft Excel, strongly preferred
Experience in the creation, scripting, fielding, and analysis of questionnaires and survey data
Must be comfortable working autonomously – albeit within a defined structure and with appropriate support – and possess excellent attention to detail
Fast learner and interest in new modes of data and BI technology (social listening, dataviz, dashboards...)
Must be proactive, innovation-driven, self-motivated, adept at dealing with ambiguity, possess strong time management skills, and have excellent written and oral communication skills
Must have strong computer skills, including proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite.
Interest in the travel and/or tourism industries is a must, and experience in them is a plus
English is your native working language, and knowledge of other languages is a plus.
Benefits of working at MMGY Travel Intelligence:
A permanent contract within an attractive working environment in an international, culturally diverse, professional and motivated team.
A role with challenging assignments and responsibilities that holds real growth opportunities.
An attractive base salary in relation to your degree and competencies, as well as extra-legal benefits.

MMGY Global is the largest and most integrated travel marketing firm in the world specialising in travel, tourism, hospitality, culinary experiences, and entertainment. To ensure we invest our clients’ budgets in ways that maximise their success, we work hard to provide the best innovative proprietary research across all destination marketing and management channels and disciplines. The MMGY Travel Intelligence division is vital to creating and sustaining the company’s sustainable competitive advantage in the travel and tourism industry.


The Junior Research Analyst role will be based in Brussels and report to a Senior Analyst. This position will also have the opportunity to work with other team members of the Travel Intelligence Group based in other locations (France, UK, US). Mon Client Est Une Foodtech En Pleine Expansion Située à Bruxelles Et Rosière. Ils Ont Des Clients à L'international Et Pour Soutenir Leur Croissance, Il Cherche Un·e


Data Analyst


Ce poste est fait pour toi si tu adores le traitement de data et que tu souhaites te développer vers des compétences de Product Owner.


Ce Qu’on Attend De Toi

  • Etre 4/5 data analyst, pour garantir des données fiables, documentées, claires
  • Etre 1/5 product owner, pour transformer les besoins utilisateurs en specs bien ficelées, aligner l’équipe dev et piloter la roadmap.
  • Un bon mix entre analyse rigoureuse, communication claire, logique produit et envie d’apprendre et de faire bouger les choses.


Ton Background

  • Tu as 4 ans d'expérience en tant que Data Analyst dans une société Tech.
  • Tu adores les chiffres autant que l’expérience utilisateur.
  • Tu veux un job à fort impact, dans une équipe soudée.
  • Tu maîtrises le français ou l’anglais pro (ou idéalement les deux !).


Ce Qu’il T'offre

  • Un job ultra-varié, utile et engageant dans une start-up en pleine croissance
  • Un salaire compétitif avec un large éventail d’avantages
  • Travailler dans un environnement avec un impact positif sur l’alimentation durable
  • Une team bienveillante et passionnée.
  • De vrais défis tech &
column2:
produit sur un logiciel unique (nutrition, empreinte carbone, food cost, allergènes…).
  • Et du fun, parce que c’est comme ça qu’on avance

  • Prêt à relever le défi ? Postulez ici!

column1: <icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 9l5.93-4L15 6.54l-6.15 4.2a1.5 1.5 0 01-1.69 0L1 6.54 2.07 5z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>
Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital transformation. We help our clients leverage technology to achieve their business goals.

Our longstanding partnerships with leaders like AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft, and ServiceNow amplify our capabilities, allowing us to deliver top-tier expertise and award-winning services. We complement these partnerships with in-depth Cyber, Data & AI, Software development and multi cloud expertise.
For 30 years, we have always been guiding our customers on the next tech wave. Devoteam has guided organizations through the Internet and cloud. The next revolution? AI.
With 11,000 tech natives working in 25+ countries, we bring you highly skilled IT experts across Europe
At Devoteam, tech is in our DNA, and it’s the people we empower with tech. Now, with responsible AI, we’re ready to unlock a future where technology drives positive change.
If you like these keywords, you’ll love this role:

Dreaming about exploring the data understanding how the business works? Do you enjoy telling a story around data? Do you enjoy figuring out how to calculate the needed KPI? We are currently looking for an Azure Data Analyst who can support our customers by telling a story around data by creating reports and dashboards.

Do you have experience with Power BI or with a similar reporting tool? Are you also interested in supporting our Azure Data Engineer team computing the right data set? Are you attracted by new technologies and new methodologies? You’re a good candidate to be our future colleague!

As an Azure Data Analyst, you will be a crucial part of our key projects for our data solutions. You will be in front of the customer understanding their need, creating the correct report and guiding our Azure Data Engineer to prepare properly the needed data.
For this position, we’re looking for all seniority levels.
[Must-have] Hands-on experience with Power BI, SQL Server Reporting Services or Tableau
[Must-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL querying language (T-SQL)
[Must-have] Hands-on experience modeling a datawarehouse/datamart in Star Schema
[Must-have] Knowledge about modeling techniques like data vault, Merise/3NF
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience creating Azure resources for a data cloud solution.
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience building data pipeline with some Azure data tools (Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Azure Data Lake…)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with the DataBricks environment (Delta Live Table, Workflows, SQL Warehouse)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL Server suite (SSIS, SSAS)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with Python and PySpark
[Nice-to-have] You’re ready to drive change and bring creative tech ideas to life.
[Nice-to-have] You’re either proficient in Dutch or French (or you want to learn) and fluent in English.
[Bonus-points] Azure certified (or willing to obtain). Certifications in scope: PL-300, DP-203

If you do not feel fully confident that you meet the requirements above, please don’t worry. Just apply. Together we’ll discover what you can bring to the table, in which role you would fit best and how you could potentially grow at Devoteam.
As a digital native you will have a positive impact at top organizations in Belgium.
Direct access to the Microsoft organization and programs thanks to our global partnership.
Prepare to inspire and be inspired by other Devoteamers in tech communities.
We enable local and international collaboration and exchange with other tech leaders and specialists, knowledge sharing, peer-to-peer coaching.
A personalized career plan with training offers in soft- & hard skills and certifications aligned to your needs & expertise.
Our servant leadership supports opportunities to grow your personal brand through blogs, keynote sessions, and more.
#techies in our minds, #creatives in our hearts, #change in our DNA.

Cutting-edge Technology: Embrace the latest advancements in IT and digital technologies as we constantly innovate to stay ahead of the competition. Our commitment to adopting state-of-the-art tools and methodologies ensures that you'll work on projects at the forefront of the industry.

Entrepreneur mindset: We value our people over processes. You will develop and grow in an agile and ambitious company where it’s okay to take risks, make mistakes and change plans to find transformative solutions. At the same time, you will learn from the best, building relationships and skills that will last your entire career.

Endless Learning Opportunities: We value personal and professional growth. Through workshops, conferences, and certifications, we offer the resources needed to expand your skill set and reach new heights in your career.
Connect with amazing people: You will become part of a network of +10,000 Devoteamers spread over 20 countries.

Collaborative Culture: Teamwork is at the heart of our organisation. You'll be working side by side with a diverse group of IT experts who share your passion for excellence and will inspire you to think outside the box.

Impactful Projects: Tackle real-world challenges that matter! From revolutionising business processes to developing innovative solutions, you'll have the chance to make a genuine and positive impact on our clients and the community.
Work-Life Balance: We believe in a healthy work-life balance, ensuring that you have time to unwind, pursue your hobbies, and spend quality time with loved ones.

Inspiring and eco-friendly workplace: We just moved to an amazing new building. We believe an inspiring workspace fuels creativity and fosters a positive work culture, allowing our employees to reach their full potential. The Wings building is also designed with eco-friendly features and energy-efficient systems. By reducing our ecological footprint, we are contributing to a greener future and aligning our business practices with our environmental values. The building is also very easily accessible by public transportation.

Competitive package: We offer a competitive salary package with additional benefits like a company car, smartphone, medical insurance, pension plan, net allowance, laptop, meal vouchers, etc. We review our salary grid twice a year to ensure we are in line with the market.
At Devoteam, we combine strong values – respect, frankness, ambition, entrepreneurship & collaboration - with a fun environment that empowers you to innovate and succeed.
>>> Does all this sound compelling to you? Go for it and click that apply button!

Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital transformation. We help our clients leverage technology to achieve their business goals.

Our

4198789186,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/internship-data-science-at-technopolis-consulting-group-belgium-sprl-4198789186?position=48&pageNum=0&refId=8gdNUx6Fxsnml3Lf0ENChQ%3D%3D&trackingId=ZSoFEAyNYAY3S6aqTzj3cw%3D%3D,Internship - Data Science,Technopolis Consulting Group Belgium SPRL,Antwerp Metropolitan Area,"Introduction
Technopolis is offering a 5-6 months paid internship at our Brussels office.

We seek to appoint an enthusiastic intern to gain first-hand insights in applying data science techniques for policy analysis. It is an exciting time to join the growing data science work at Technopolis Group, where we are deploying new tools across our practice to enhance our policy analysis capacity, from generative AI to reproduceable analytical pipelines. You will mainly focus on developing cross-cutting tools and techniques that can be applied across the company, as well as contribute to specific projects.
Applicants Suitable For This Position Should Have

Recently finalised university education (master) or a student currently in the last year of a Master programme, preferably in data science, applied statistics, or related fields. Priority will be given to applicants that combine data science with economics or public policy, either in your studies or in past professional experience.
Experience of programming languages for data manipulation, especially Python, R and SQL.
Some knowledge of modern data science tools and concepts such as git, Github, Visual Studio, environment variables.
Experience and interest in data science techniques such as generative AI and other machine learning techniques.
Interest in widening your skillset beyond data science: we develop fully-rounded analysts who are also capable of applying data science techniques – not just programmers.
Interest in European Commission policies, in particular in science, technology and innovation
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Willingness to learn about new topics, methods, and skills.
The Following Will Be Considered As a Plus
Applying supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques to mainly text data
Assist in other tasks such as literature reviews, case studies and other tasks where needed.

The successful candidate will work as a paid intern in our Brussels office. The role provides the opportunity to gain experience in working at the forefront of European policymaking, to develop analytical skills, and to experience a multinational, friendly business environment. Our package includes:
Monthly allowance for the transportation card
Working in an international company with 12 offices and more than 290 colleagues
Applicants need to have either EU citizenship or a valid work permit.
For any questions on the recruitment, please contact recruitment_be@technopolis-group.com (reference DSU_INT2025).
Only the short-listed candidates will be contacted.

Technopolis Group started as a consultancy firm for the evaluation of science, technology and innovation. While evaluation is still at the core of our company, we have over the years built up the know-how to support decision making on a broad range of topics. Our experts provide strategy and foresight, manage networks and provide project management support for even the most complex projects. We are acquainted with a wide range of quantitative methods and deliver advanced data analytics that is ahead of the curve. We evaluate policies, evaluate their impact and communicate them effectively to experts and the broader public. We never settle for out-of-the-box solutions but work with our clients to find the approach that best fits their needs.

We work with decision-makers in different levels and fields, from international institutions, such as the European Commission and multilateral development banks, to regional and local authorities. Our clients include universities and R&D centres, network organisations such as business associations, clusters and incubators as well as governments.

Introduction

Technopolis is offering a 5-6 months paid internship at our Brussels office.

About This Job

We seek to appoint an enthusiastic intern to gain first-hand insights in applying data science techniques for policy analysis. It is an exciting time to join the growing data science work at Technopolis Group, where we are deploying new tools across our practice to enhance our policy analysis capacity, from generative AI to reproduceable analytical pipelines. You will mainly focus on developing cross-cutting tools and techniques that can be applied across the company, as well as contribute to specific projects.

Your profile

Applicants Suitable For This Position Should Have

  • Recently finalised university education (master) or a student currently in the last year of a Master programme, preferably in data science, applied statistics, or related fields. Priority will be given to applicants that combine data science with economics or public policy, either in your studies or in past professional experience.
  • Experience of programming languages for data manipulation, especially Python, R and SQL.
  • Some knowledge of modern data science tools and concepts such as git, Github, Visual Studio, environment variables.
  • Experience and interest in data science techniques such as generative AI and other machine learning techniques.
  • Interest in widening your skillset beyond data science: we develop fully-rounded analysts who are also capable of applying data science techniques – not just programmers.
  • Interest in European Commission policies, in particular in science, technology and innovation
column2: • Excellent communication skills in English
column3: • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
column4:
• Willingness to learn about new topics, methods, and skills.

    • The Following Will Be Considered As a Plus

    • Proficiency in other languages.

    Your responsibilities

    Typical Tasks May Include

    • Developing data analysis pipelines

column8: • Reporting results of analysis

• Assist in other tasks such as literature reviews, case studies and other tasks where needed.

    The successful candidate will work as a paid intern in our Brussels office. The role provides the opportunity to gain experience in working at the forefront of European policymaking, to develop analytical skills, and to experience a multinational, friendly business environment. Our package includes:

    • Paid internship
    • Belgian phone subscription
    • Monthly allowance for the transportation card
    • Training and mentoring possibilities

    Interested? Apply directly

    Applicants need to have either EU citizenship or a valid work permit.

    For any questions on the recruitment, please contact recruitment_be@technopolis-group.com (reference DSU_INT2025).

    Only the short-listed candidates will be contacted.

    Apply for this job

    About Us

    Technopolis Group started as a consultancy firm for the evaluation of science, technology and innovation. While evaluation is still at the core of our company, we have over the years built up the know-how to support decision making on a broad range of topics. Our experts provide strategy and foresight, manage networks and provide project management support for even the most complex projects. We are acquainted with a wide range of quantitative methods and deliver advanced data analytics that is ahead of the curve. We evaluate policies, evaluate their impact and communicate them effectively to experts and the broader public. We never settle for out-of-the-box solutions but work with our clients to find the approach that best fits their needs.

    We work with decision-makers in different levels and fields, from international institutions, such as the European Commission and multilateral development banks, to regional and local authorities. Our clients include universities and R&
column10: D centres, network organisations such as business associations, clusters and incubators as well as governments.

4204360822,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/clinical-data-analyst-at-intuition-it-%E2%80%93-intuitive-technology-recruitment-4204360822?position=51&pageNum=0&refId=8gdNUx6Fxsnml3Lf0ENChQ%3D%3D&trackingId=pVhB5EOT%2FeTd7iAkCWHuBA%3D%3D,Clinical Data Analyst,Intuition IT – Intuitive Technology Recruitment,European Union,"Title: Clinical Data Management
Must have good experience in Veeva CDM.
• Performs data review of clinical trial data, including query management. Communicates with study team members and CRO (Contract Research Organization) to resolve queries.
• Performs detailed review of eCOA/external data per the Date Review Plan and works closely with the vendor and CRO to resolve eCOA/external data related issues. May include the following:
• Acts as liaison between Customer, CRO and eCOA vendor/external data vendor.
• Ensures accessibility of eCOA/external data to all relevant Customer and CRO team.
• QCs a sample of data clarification requests processed by the eCOA/external data vendor.
• Maintains eCOA/external data issues within the centralized study data issues log.
• Ensures appropriate and timely communication of eCOA/external data related issues and resolutions to relevant Customer and CRO team.
• Performs reconciliation review of eCOA/external data against EDC data and works with applicable parties to resolve queries.
• Performs SAE (Serious Adverse Event) reconciliation and communicates with applicable safety team members to resolve issues.
• May prepare and distribute performance metrics (e.g. site completion of data entry and resolution of queries) to applicable stakeholders. Escalates to CDM Lead and study team as needed.

• Contributes to the creation and maintenance of study data cleaning plan components, including edit checks (data validation plan), listing review checks, data integration specifications, data transfer specifications, external data reconciliation plan(s), coding guidelines, SAE reconciliation guidelines, database lock plans.
• Performs additional review activities for interim and final database locks as needed.
• Files study documentation in electronic Trial Master File (eTMF) and department project files.
• Performs periodic quality review of eTMF documents.
• Assists with taking meeting minutes and documenting/tracking study data management activities.
• Performs inspection readiness activities and supports CDM team during internal and regulatory inspections

• Supports the set-up and testing of study data collection tools such as EDC (electronic data capture), IRT (interactive response technology), eCOA (electronic clinical outcome assessment), ePRO (electronic patient reported outcomes), and creation/maintenance of associated documentation.
• May contribute to the creation and maintenance of study eCRF Completion Guidelines and other data collection tool guidelines.
• May assist with management of account access and training materials for data collection tools
• Assists with quality review of above activities performed by the CRO, as needed.
• Coordinates and oversees the work of other data coordinators.
• Ensure compliance with own Learning Curricula, corporate and/or GXP requirements.

Title: Clinical Data Management

Location: Anywhere in Europe

Type: Contract

Notice period: Immediate – 2 weeks

Must have good experience in Veeva CDM.


Job Description:


Data Review

• Performs data review of clinical trial data, including query management. Communicates with study team members and CRO (Contract Research Organization) to resolve queries.

• Performs detailed review of eCOA/external data per the Date Review Plan and works closely with the vendor and CRO to resolve eCOA/external data related issues. May include the following:

• Acts as liaison between Customer, CRO and eCOA vendor/external data vendor.

• Ensures accessibility of eCOA/external data to all relevant Customer and CRO team.

• QCs a sample of data clarification requests processed by the eCOA/external data vendor.

• Maintains eCOA/external data issues within the centralized study data issues log.

• Ensures appropriate and timely communication of eCOA/external data related issues and resolutions to relevant Customer and CRO team.

• Performs reconciliation review of eCOA/external data against EDC data and works with applicable parties to resolve queries.

• Performs SAE (Serious Adverse Event) reconciliation and communicates with applicable safety team members to resolve issues.

• May prepare and distribute performance metrics (e.g. site completion of data entry and resolution of queries) to applicable stakeholders. Escalates to CDM Lead and study team as needed.

• Contributes to the creation and maintenance of study data cleaning plan components, including edit checks (data validation plan), listing review checks, data integration specifications, data transfer specifications, external data reconciliation plan(s), coding guidelines, SAE reconciliation guidelines, database lock plans.

• Performs additional review activities for interim and final database locks as needed.


Documentation &
column2:
Filing

• Files study documentation in electronic Trial Master File (eTMF) and department project files.

• Performs periodic quality review of eTMF documents.

• Assists with taking meeting minutes and documenting/tracking study data management activities.

• Performs data archival activities.

• Performs inspection readiness activities and supports CDM team during internal and regulatory inspections


Data Collection Systems

• Supports the set-up and testing of study data collection tools such as EDC (electronic data capture), IRT (interactive response technology), eCOA (electronic clinical outcome assessment), ePRO (electronic patient reported outcomes), and creation/maintenance of associated documentation.

• May contribute to the creation and maintenance of study eCRF Completion Guidelines and other data collection tool guidelines.

• May assist with management of account access and training materials for data collection tools


Additional Activities

• Assists with quality review of above activities performed by the CRO, as needed.

• Coordinates and oversees the work of other data coordinators.

• Mentors other data coordinators.

• Ensure compliance with own Learning Curricula, corporate and/or GXP requirements.

4204643972,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/sales-data-analyst-m-f-at-3m-4204643972?position=52&pageNum=0&refId=8gdNUx6Fxsnml3Lf0ENChQ%3D%3D&trackingId=XbSD%2FekVTPS1oeUBLGNbXA%3D%3D,Sales Data Analyst (m/f/*),3M,"Diegem, Flemish Region, Belgium","Job Description
Collaborate with Innovative 3Mers Around the World

Choosing where to start and grow your career has a major impact on your professional and personal life, so it’s equally important you know that the company that you choose to work at, and its leaders, will support and guide you. With a diversity of people, global locations, technologies and products, 3M is a place where you can collaborate with curious, creative 3Mers.
The Impact You’ll Make in this Role

As a Business Analyst, you will be part of the Consumer Business Group, responsible for the commercialization of worldwide leading brands including Scotch®, Scotch Blue™, Command™, Scotch-Brite™, Post-it®, 3M, Futuro™, Nexcare™, among others and you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world.
Here, You Will Make An Impact By
Determining Advanced Analysis and Insight Generation: Leveraging retailers and distributors' point of sales (POS) data, syndicated data, and shopper data to generate actionable insights.

Driving POS Growth and Mitigating Declines: Utilize your analytical expertise to develop strategies that enhance POS growth, while identifying and addressing potential declines through effective category management.

Playing a pivotal role in executing category management strategies. This involves deep dives into category performance, identifying growth opportunities, optimizing product assortment, and providing guidance on pricing and promotional strategies.

Influencing Partnership with Key Accounts: Build and maintain strong relationships with retailer/distributor key accounts within EMEA, influencing decision-making through data-driven insights and category management expertise.
Collaborating with all business analysts to implement Consumer Business Group global analytic strategies and tactics, ensuring alignment with overall business objectives.
To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M is looking for candidates who must have the following qualifications:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree or higher from an accredited institution preferably in Business, Economics, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.
Expert Experience in business analytics or a related relevant customer market with a preference for experience in the FMCG industry.
Category Management demonstrated expertise and data-driven decision making.
Language Proficiency: Fluent in French AND English is a must
Communication Skills: Excellent storytelling and presentation skills, capable of translating complex data into actionable insights. Proficiency in presenting to clients.
Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and data interpretation skills, with proficiency in Microsoft Power BI.
Technical Proficiency: Familiarity with planogramming software (e.g., JDA Space Planner), and an understanding of data modeling techniques.
Leadership Qualities: Proven leadership skills with the ability to influence key stakeholders and drive implementation of strategic initiatives.

3M offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.

For more details on what happens before, during and after the interview process, check out the Insights for Candidates page at 3M.com/careers. If you have further questions please reach out to Max (our AI Virtual Assistant) via our Career Page.

At 3M, diversity & inclusion are essential to innovation. We seek and value differences in people! This Job ad is addressed to all potential candidates. As an equal opportunity employer 3M will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability. If you want to discover more about D&I at 3M, please visit http://go.3M.com/4i9C

At 3M, we believe diversity & inclusion are essential to innovation. We seek and value differences in people! This Job ad is addressed to all potential candidates. As an equal opportunity employer 3M will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of race/ethnicity, nationality, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy/maternity-related matters, age or disability, or any other relevant characteristic protected under applicable local law.

Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.

Job Description

Collaborate with Innovative 3Mers Around the World

Choosing where to start and grow your career has a major impact on your professional and personal life, so it’s equally important you know that the company that you choose to work at, and its leaders, will support and guide you. With a diversity of people, global locations, technologies and products, 3M is a place where you can collaborate with curious, creative 3Mers.

The Impact You’ll Make in this Role

As a Business Analyst, you will be part of the Consumer Business Group, responsible for the commercialization of worldwide leading brands including Scotch®, Scotch Blue™, Command™, Scotch-Brite™, Post-it®, 3M, Futuro™, Nexcare™, among others and you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world.

Here, You Will Make An Impact By


  • Determining Advanced Analysis and Insight Generation: Leveraging retailers and distributors' point of sales (POS) data, syndicated data, and shopper data to generate actionable insights.
  • Driving POS Growth and Mitigating Declines: Utilize your analytical expertise to develop strategies that enhance POS growth, while identifying and addressing potential declines through effective category management.
  • Playing a pivotal role in executing category management strategies. This involves deep dives into category performance, identifying growth opportunities, optimizing product assortment, and providing guidance on pricing and promotional strategies.
  • Influencing Partnership with Key Accounts: Build and maintain strong relationships with retailer/distributor key accounts within EMEA, influencing decision-making through data-driven insights and category management expertise.
  • Collaborating with all business analysts to implement Consumer Business Group global analytic strategies and tactics, ensuring alignment with overall business objectives.


Your Skills And Expertise

To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M is looking for candidates who must have the following qualifications:


  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree or higher from an accredited institution preferably in Business, Economics, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.
  • Expert Experience in business analytics or a related relevant customer market with a preference for experience in the FMCG industry.
  • Category Management demonstrated expertise and data-driven decision making.
  • Language Proficiency: Fluent in French AND English is a must
  • Communication Skills: Excellent storytelling and presentation skills, capable of translating complex data into actionable insights. Proficiency in presenting to clients.


Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:


  • Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and data interpretation skills, with proficiency in Microsoft Power BI.
  • Technical Proficiency: Familiarity with planogramming software (e.g., JDA Space Planner), and an understanding of data modeling techniques.
  • Leadership Qualities: Proven leadership skills with the ability to influence key stakeholders and drive implementation of strategic initiatives.


Supporting Your Well-being

3M offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.

Resources for You

For more details on what happens before, during and after the interview process, check out the Insights for Candidates page at 3M.com/careers. If you have further questions please reach out to Max (our AI Virtual Assistant) via our Career Page.

4215359862,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-jems-belgium-anais-digital-4215359862?position=53&pageNum=0&refId=8gdNUx6Fxsnml3Lf0ENChQ%3D%3D&trackingId=fu6CueMJrw0F1c2IhNkIvQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Jems Belgium / Anais Digital,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"A propos de JEMS
Nous sommes le seul industriel de la donnée en Europe. Notre métier est de créer, manager et exploiter le patrimoine data de nos clients.

Nous avons la conviction que chaque entreprise peut adopter une démarche innovante de gestion de la donnée et créer des cas d’usage disruptifs en réduisant l'impact écologique et en diminuant la dette technique.

Nous comptons plus de 840 collaborateurs en mission chez nos clients grands comptes dans tout secteur d’activité : banque, assurance, santé, énergie, e-commerce, automobile, luxe, retail, transport, agritech…
Nous recherchons un(e) Data Analyst confirmé(e) capable d'accompagner les métiers dans l'aide à la décision.
Guider / recommander le Métier dans l’exploitation et la valorisation des multiples sources de données et identifier des leviers d’optimisation et d’amélioration des processus Business
Être l‘intermédiaire entre le Métier et la DSI
Accroître la connaissance de la clientèle d’une entreprise, conduire des études sur les bases de données, suivre les outils datamining pour analyser l’impact des actions marketing
Spécificité en ServiceNow, SAP & Azure, ainsi que l'environnement google.
En tant que Data Analyst vous maitrisez :
Des outils BI Fonction Expertise sur les données du Métier
Des solutions Analytiques (Data Science ou Data Mining / BI)
Vous êtes diplômé(e) d’une école d’ingénieur ou d’un parcours universitaire technique. Vous justifiez d’au minimum 5 ans d’expérience professionnelle dans la DATA.
Vous êtes trilingue, ou au minimum vous savez vous exprimer correctement dans les langues nationales.
Une JEMS Académie au service de votre montée en compétences (formations et certifications sur les technologies de pointe)
Un accompagnement personnalisé et un management de proximité pour vous proposer des évolutions de carrière
Une intégration dans des communautés techniques et de pratiques JEMS (encadrement par des experts, échanges sur les bonnes pratiques, favoriser l'innovation...)
Une entreprise reconnue ""Great Place To Work""
Des évènements et séminaires inoubliables, des soirées d'agence conviviales
Belgique, bruxelles. (we don't do full remote, sorry !)
Le Groupe JEMS porte fièrement sa valeur ""Diversité"" en se mobilisant pour l'inclusion et l'égalité des chances et en luttant contre toutes formes de discrimination.
Tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap.

A propos de JEMS


Nous sommes le seul industriel de la donnée en Europe. Notre métier est de créer, manager et exploiter le patrimoine data de nos clients.


Nous avons la conviction que chaque entreprise peut adopter une démarche innovante de gestion de la donnée et créer des cas d’usage disruptifs en réduisant l'impact écologique et en diminuant la dette technique.


Nous comptons plus de 840 collaborateurs en mission chez nos clients grands comptes dans tout secteur d’activité : banque, assurance, santé, énergie, e-commerce, automobile, luxe, retail, transport, agritech…


Vos missions


Nous recherchons un(e) Data Analyst confirmé(e) capable d'accompagner les métiers dans l'aide à la décision.

  • Guider / recommander le Métier dans l’exploitation et la valorisation des multiples sources de données et identifier des leviers d’optimisation et d’amélioration des processus Business
  • Être l‘intermédiaire entre le Métier et la DSI

  • Spécificité en ServiceNow, SAP &
column2:
Azure, ainsi que l'environnement google.

MS Office

Votre profil

Diversité

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

Voor een langdurig project bij onze klant in Antwerpen (2 dagen onsite) zoeken wij een ervaren Data Analist die een sleutelrol speelt in het vertalen van businessbehoeften naar functionele en technische oplossingen. Deze rol biedt de mogelijkheid om op locatie te werken, vlakbij het station van Antwerpen, met de extra optie van parkeergelegenheid aangeboden door Cegeka.
Verzamelen, challengen en documenteren van de behoeften van eindgebruikers.
Vertalen van business requirements naar functionele vereisten en het beheren van de requirements gedurende het project.
Begrijpen van de bedrijfsprocessen en gebruik van applicaties om werkbare oplossingen te ontwikkelen.
Impactanalyse uitvoeren en nauw samenwerken met de Product Owner en het team om de klantuitdagingen te begrijpen.
Bewaken van de eind-tot-eind (E2E) oplossing voor een optimale businessimpact.
Analyseren van klantbehoeften en het voorstellen van de beste mogelijke oplossing.
Evalueren van IT-voordelen en kosten van voorgestelde oplossingen (bijv. licentiekosten, effort).
Organiseren van workshops en presentaties om de oplossing met de business te valideren.
Toepassen van richtlijnen en standaarden om de oplossing te waarborgen en te testen.
Opstellen van een gedetailleerde functionele analyse volgens de afgesproken standaarden.
Het waarborgen van de functionele architectuur van applicaties (bijv. datamodel).
Beheren van de applicatie-informatie en definiëren van de autorisatiematrix in samenwerking met andere teams.
Ontwikkelen van functionele designs en interfacespecificaties.
Vastleggen van rollen en verantwoordelijkheden binnen het applicatielandschap.
Opstellen en onderhouden van documentatie over de gekozen oplossingen en processen.
Actief deelnemen aan teamwerking en collega’s ondersteunen.
Bijdragen aan de eigen ontwikkeling en professionalisering, en die van het team.
Faciliteren van acceptatietesten en het creëren van bewustwording rond kwaliteit.
Identificeren en uitvoeren van verbeteracties om processen te optimaliseren en de kwaliteit van het product of de dienst te verbeteren.
Automatiseren van testscenario's en het up-to-date houden van systeemdocumentatie.
Deelnemen aan Agile ceremonies zoals dagelijkse scrums en PI planning.
Actief bijdragen aan de teamperformance door feedback te geven en ontvangen.
Signaleren van risico’s en het naleven van het security- en risicobeheerbeleid.
Ervaring: Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring als Business of Functioneel Analist, bij voorkeur met een sterke focus op data en ETL-processen.
Technische Vaardigheden: Ervaring met 3NF, Data Vault, Stermodel ontwikkeling en SQL.
Communicatieve Vaardigheden: Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels.
Onafhankelijk Werken: In staat om het eigen werk te organiseren en collega’s te coachen.
Probleemoplossend: Proactief in het identificeren van oplossingen en risico’s.
Agile Mindset: Ervaring met Agile/Lean principes is een plus.
Een langdurig project bij een toonaangevende klant in Antwerpen.
Flexibiliteit om te werken in een dynamische en uitdagende werkomgeving, vlakbij het station.
Parkeergelegenheid kan verzorgd worden door Cegeka.
Aantrekkelijke voorwaarden en ruimte voor professionele groei.

Vacature: Data Analist (Freelancer)


Voor een langdurig project bij onze klant in Antwerpen (2 dagen onsite) zoeken wij een ervaren Data Analist die een sleutelrol speelt in het vertalen van businessbehoeften naar functionele en technische oplossingen. Deze rol biedt de mogelijkheid om op locatie te werken, vlakbij het station van Antwerpen, met de extra optie van parkeergelegenheid aangeboden door Cegeka.


Verantwoordelijkheden:


🔍 Business Analyse:

  • Verzamelen, challengen en documenteren van de behoeften van eindgebruikers.
  • Vertalen van business requirements naar functionele vereisten en het beheren van de requirements gedurende het project.
  • Begrijpen van de bedrijfsprocessen en gebruik van applicaties om werkbare oplossingen te ontwikkelen.
  • Impactanalyse uitvoeren en nauw samenwerken met de Product Owner en het team om de klantuitdagingen te begrijpen.
  • Bewaken van de eind-tot-eind (E2E) oplossing voor een optimale businessimpact.


💡 Oplossingsvoorstel:

  • Analyseren van klantbehoeften en het voorstellen van de beste mogelijke oplossing.
  • Evalueren van IT-voordelen en kosten van voorgestelde oplossingen (bijv. licentiekosten, effort).
  • Organiseren van workshops en presentaties om de oplossing met de business te valideren.
  • Toepassen van richtlijnen en standaarden om de oplossing te waarborgen en te testen.


📊 Functionele Analyse:

  • Opstellen van een gedetailleerde functionele analyse volgens de afgesproken standaarden.
  • Het waarborgen van de functionele architectuur van applicaties (bijv. datamodel).
  • Beheren van de applicatie-informatie en definiëren van de autorisatiematrix in samenwerking met andere teams.


📑 Functioneel Design:

  • Ontwikkelen van functionele designs en interfacespecificaties.
  • Vastleggen van rollen en verantwoordelijkheden binnen het applicatielandschap.


📚 Documentatie:

  • Opstellen en onderhouden van documentatie over de gekozen oplossingen en processen.


🧑‍🏫 Kennisontwikkeling:

  • Actief deelnemen aan teamwerking en collega’s ondersteunen.
  • Bijdragen aan de eigen ontwikkeling en professionalisering, en die van het team.


✅ Kwaliteitsbewaking:

  • Faciliteren van acceptatietesten en het creëren van bewustwording rond kwaliteit.
  • Testplannen reviewen en gebruikersacceptatietests opvolgen.


🔧 Continuous Improvement:

  • Identificeren en uitvoeren van verbeteracties om processen te optimaliseren en de kwaliteit van het product of de dienst te verbeteren.
  • Automatiseren van testscenario's en het up-to-date houden van systeemdocumentatie.


🤝 Zelforganiserende Teams:

  • Deelnemen aan Agile ceremonies zoals dagelijkse scrums en PI planning.
  • Actief bijdragen aan de teamperformance door feedback te geven en ontvangen.


⚠️ Risico's Beheren:

  • Signaleren van risico’s en het naleven van het security- en risicobeheerbeleid.


Profiel:

  • Ervaring: Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring als Business of Functioneel Analist, bij voorkeur met een sterke focus op data en ETL-processen.
  • Technische Vaardigheden: Ervaring met 3NF, Data Vault, Stermodel ontwikkeling en SQL.
  • Communicatieve Vaardigheden: Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels.
  • Onafhankelijk Werken: In staat om het eigen werk te organiseren en collega’s te coachen.
  • Probleemoplossend: Proactief in het identificeren van oplossingen en risico’s.
  • Agile Mindset: Ervaring met Agile/Lean principes is een plus.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een langdurig project bij een toonaangevende klant in Antwerpen.
  • Flexibiliteit om te werken in een dynamische en uitdagende werkomgeving, vlakbij het station.
  • Parkeergelegenheid kan verzorgd worden door Cegeka.
  • Aantrekkelijke voorwaarden en ruimte voor professionele groei.
