4215388302,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/solver-data-science-machine-learning-specialist-at-exsolv%C3%A6-4215388302?position=5&pageNum=5&refId=tAIdxX1NjQqbRvTJYfRfsA%3D%3D&trackingId=V%2Fc7MLMqI8cZUv3u8BSAKg%3D%3D,Solver - Data Science & Machine Learning Specialist,Exsolvæ,"Brussels Region, Belgium","About Exsolvæ:

Exsolvæ is a Brussels-based consultancy at the forefront of Data and Artificial Intelligence innovation. We specialize in providing expert Consultancy, Audit, and Solution Development services to empower our partners in overcoming unique challenges. Our holistic approach fosters collaboration across diverse domains, including Data Science, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.
At Exsolvæ, our ""Solvers"" are passionate professionals equipped with cutting-edge tools, a culture of continuous learning, and an unwavering commitment to delivering high-impact solutions.
We are seeking a Data Science & Machine Learning Specialist with a proven ability to design, develop, and deploy transformative AI and machine learning solutions.

As a Data Science & Machine Learning Specialist, you will work alongside multidisciplinary teams to unlock the full potential of data assets for clients. You will design state-of-the-art ML models, develop data-driven insights, and deploy production-grade AI solutions. Leveraging your expertise, you will help clients overcome their most pressing challenges and create sustainable value using AI and ML.
Educational Background: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, or a related field.
Languages: Written & Spoken Fluency in English AND French or Dutch
Programming Skills: Expertise in Python and SQL, with experience in big data tools like Apache Spark or Databricks.
Machine Learning Mastery: Proficiency in TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn for designing, training, and deploying ML models.
Cloud Expertise: Hands-on experience with Azure Machine Learning, AWS SageMaker, or GCP Vertex AI for scalable AI deployments.
Data Visualization: Proficiency in tools like Tableau, Power BI, and Python-based libraries such as Matplotlib, Seaborn, and Plotly.
Statistics and Mathematics: Deep understanding of linear algebra, calculus, probability, and advanced statistical techniques.
Soft Skills: Exceptional communication, critical thinking, and stakeholder management skills.
Familiarity with advanced ML techniques, such as reinforcement learning, graph ML, and large language models (LLMs).
Experience with MLOps tools like MLflow, Kubeflow, and Docker/Kubernetes.
Knowledge of causal inference frameworks (e.g., DoWhy, EconML) and time-series forecasting methods.
Certifications such as Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate, AWS Certified Machine Learning, or Google Professional ML Engineer.
Client Engagement: Collaborate with clients to identify data challenges, define objectives, and recommend AI/ML solutions that align with business goals.
Model Development: Design and train advanced machine learning models using frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
Insight Generation: Transform complex datasets into actionable insights using statistical analysis and advanced visualization tools like Power BI or Tableau.
Machine Learning Solutions: Develop models for classification, regression, clustering, and NLP using modern techniques, including deep learning and reinforcement learning.
Data Engineering: Collaborate with Data Engineers to build robust data pipelines and optimize data for ML applications using platforms like Azure, AWS, or GCP.
MLOps: Deploy and maintain models in production environments using MLOps pipelines with tools like MLflow or Kubeflow.
Cloud Deployment: Implement AI workflows on cloud platforms such as Azure Machine Learning, AWS SageMaker, or GCP Vertex AI with scalability and performance in mind.
Stay updated on advancements in AI/ML technologies and incorporate state-of-the-art practices into client projects.
Explore innovative methodologies like transfer learning, Vision Transformers, and graph neural networks to enhance solutions.
Lead end-to-end ML projects, from problem definition to model deployment, ensuring alignment with client objectives and deadlines.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Data Engineers and Solution Architects, to deliver comprehensive solutions.
Conduct workshops and training sessions to empower client teams in adopting and managing AI/ML solutions.
Provide ongoing support to ensure the scalability and performance of deployed AI systems.
Impactful Projects: Work on transformative AI/ML initiatives across industries like finance, healthcare, retail, and energy.
Continuous Learning: Access to the latest tools, certifications, and training opportunities to remain at the cutting edge of AI and ML.
Collaborative Culture: Be part of a team that values knowledge sharing and collective growth.
Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model with opportunities for remote and in-office collaboration.
Competitive Compensation: Benefit from an attractive salary, performance-based bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.
If you are a driven professional with a passion for Artificial Intelligence and a proven ability to design and deploy impactful AI/ML solutions, we’d love to hear from you!

About Exsolvæ:

Exsolvæ is a Brussels-based consultancy at the forefront of Data and Artificial Intelligence innovation. We specialize in providing expert Consultancy, Audit, and Solution Development services to empower our partners in overcoming unique challenges. Our holistic approach fosters collaboration across diverse domains, including Data Science, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.


At Exsolvæ, our ""Solvers"" are passionate professionals equipped with cutting-edge tools, a culture of continuous learning, and an unwavering commitment to delivering high-impact solutions.


We are seeking a Data Science &
column2:
Machine Learning Specialist with a proven ability to design, develop, and deploy transformative AI and machine learning solutions.


Your Role:

As a Data Science &
column3:
Machine Learning Specialist, you will work alongside multidisciplinary teams to unlock the full potential of data assets for clients. You will design state-of-the-art ML models, develop data-driven insights, and deploy production-grade AI solutions. Leveraging your expertise, you will help clients overcome their most pressing challenges and create sustainable value using AI and ML.


What We’re Looking For:


Required Skills and Qualifications

  • Educational Background: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, or a related field.
  • Languages: Written &
column4:
Spoken Fluency in English AND French or Dutch
  • Seniority: 3-7 years of work experience
  • Programming Skills: Expertise in Python and SQL, with experience in big data tools like Apache Spark or Databricks.
  • Machine Learning Mastery: Proficiency in TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn for designing, training, and deploying ML models.
  • Cloud Expertise: Hands-on experience with Azure Machine Learning, AWS SageMaker, or GCP Vertex AI for scalable AI deployments.
  • Data Visualization: Proficiency in tools like Tableau, Power BI, and Python-based libraries such as Matplotlib, Seaborn, and Plotly.
  • Statistics and Mathematics: Deep understanding of linear algebra, calculus, probability, and advanced statistical techniques.
  • Soft Skills: Exceptional communication, critical thinking, and stakeholder management skills.


    • Preferred Skills

    • Familiarity with advanced ML techniques, such as reinforcement learning, graph ML, and large language models (LLMs).
    • Experience with MLOps tools like MLflow, Kubeflow, and Docker/Kubernetes.
    • Knowledge of causal inference frameworks (e.g., DoWhy, EconML) and time-series forecasting methods.
    • Certifications such as Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate, AWS Certified Machine Learning, or Google Professional ML Engineer.


    What You’ll Do:


    Core Expertise

    • Client Engagement: Collaborate with clients to identify data challenges, define objectives, and recommend AI/ML solutions that align with business goals.
    • Model Development: Design and train advanced machine learning models using frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
    • Insight Generation: Transform complex datasets into actionable insights using statistical analysis and advanced visualization tools like Power BI or Tableau.


    Technical Implementation

    • Machine Learning Solutions: Develop models for classification, regression, clustering, and NLP using modern techniques, including deep learning and reinforcement learning.
    • Data Engineering: Collaborate with Data Engineers to build robust data pipelines and optimize data for ML applications using platforms like Azure, AWS, or GCP.
    • MLOps: Deploy and maintain models in production environments using MLOps pipelines with tools like MLflow or Kubeflow.
    • Cloud Deployment: Implement AI workflows on cloud platforms such as Azure Machine Learning, AWS SageMaker, or GCP Vertex AI with scalability and performance in mind.


    Research and Innovation

    • Stay updated on advancements in AI/ML technologies and incorporate state-of-the-art practices into client projects.
    • Explore innovative methodologies like transfer learning, Vision Transformers, and graph neural networks to enhance solutions.


    Project Management

    • Lead end-to-end ML projects, from problem definition to model deployment, ensuring alignment with client objectives and deadlines.
    • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Data Engineers and Solution Architects, to deliver comprehensive solutions.


    Training and Support

    • Conduct workshops and training sessions to empower client teams in adopting and managing AI/ML solutions.
    • Provide ongoing support to ensure the scalability and performance of deployed AI systems.


    Why Join Us?

    • Impactful Projects: Work on transformative AI/ML initiatives across industries like finance, healthcare, retail, and energy.
    • Continuous Learning: Access to the latest tools, certifications, and training opportunities to remain at the cutting edge of AI and ML.
    • Collaborative Culture: Be part of a team that values knowledge sharing and collective growth.
    • Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model with opportunities for remote and in-office collaboration.
    • Competitive Compensation: Benefit from an attractive salary, performance-based bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.


    If you are a driven professional with a passion for Artificial Intelligence and a proven ability to design and deploy impactful AI/ML solutions, we’d love to hear from you!

4204454730,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/vie-data-analyst-bruxelles-h-f-at-bnp-paribas-4204454730?position=6&pageNum=5&refId=tAIdxX1NjQqbRvTJYfRfsA%3D%3D&trackingId=pSjI7Is9zFgaPgiydTCMdg%3D%3D,VIE - Data Analyst - Bruxelles H/F,BNP Paribas,"Uccle, Brussels Region, Belgium","Concrètement votre quotidien ?

En tant que data analyst, vous êtes responsable de la conversion de grandes quantités de données en informations analytiques qui aident la direction et les différentes lignes métier à prendre des décisions stratégiques.
Vous utilisez des outils analytiques et développez des modèles statistiques pour :

analyser et mesurer les performances des campagnes commerciales, pour lesquelles vous développez des scores statistiques et prédictifs (scores de réponse, scores d'uplift...) afin d'optimiser la personnalisation, le taux de réponse et la rentabilité des communications
analyser la performance et accompagner les équipes métier dans la mise en place d'outils analytiques pour mesurer et améliorer l'efficacité opérationnelle (analyses de prix, segmentation clients...)
développer des tableaux de bord et proposer des indicateurs clés, qui permettent à la direction de prendre des décisions stratégiques
participer à des études statistiques et utiliser les données à disposition afin de répondre à des problématiques métier
Vous travaillez également en collaboration avec les équipes marketing et êtes responsable de la mise en place de plans de test et des envois des communications vers nos clients finaux.

En résumé, vous transformez les données d'AlphaCrédit en informations à destination de nos collègues des différents départements, afin de les accompagner dans leurs prises de décisions. La communication est donc également une part importante du poste car vous serez en contact avec différents interlocuteurs et devez d'une part échanger afin de bien comprendre les besoins et d'autre part restituer vos travaux et vos conclusions.
Le département Data d’AlphaCredit se compose de quatre services : Predictive & performance analytics, Data preparation & visualization, Data governance et Data hub.

L’équipe predictive & performance analytics, ce sont six collaborateurs qui, grâce à des opérations innovantes de gestion des données et d'analyses statistiques, contribuent à la rentabilité des différents portefeuilles d’activités, à la rentabilité des actions marketing et à l’optimisation des processus opérationnels d'AlphaCredit.
Les locaux sont situés dans le centre de Bruxelles, à deux pas de la Gare Centrale.

Cette expérience au sein de l'équipe analytique de Alpha Crédit vous permettra de mettre en pratique et d'appliquer vos connaissances en programmation et en statistiques sur une grande quantité de données, à la fois internes et externes, et d'apporter votre contribution dans la chaîne de création de valeur.

La diversité des sujets (gestion des campagnes marketing, segmentation clients...) et des interlocuteurs (départements marketing, opération, auto...) développera votre capacité d'analyse et de compréhension des enjeux, ainsi que votre relationnel et vos capacités de communication.

Notre monde change : notre manière de nous informer, de consommer… et de travailler aussi ! Aujourd’hui, ce qui compte dans un job, c’est de vivre de véritables expériences, d’apprendre, de partager objectifs et résultats avec ses collègues. Bref, de tracer son propre chemin, différent, responsable et durable. Chez BNP Paribas, nous recrutons nos collaborateurs avec l’idée qu’ils nous aideront à concevoir le monde et la banque de demain.
Vous voulez connaître toutes les raisons de nous rejoindre ? Rendez-vous sur https://group.bnpparibas
Elle est fixée par Business France et consultable directement sur leur site.
Vous êtes titulaire d’un Master obtenu en université ou en école d’ingénieur avec une spécialisation en Data.
Vous disposez de connaissances en matière d’analyse de données et justifiez d’une expérience (stage et alternance inclus) d’au moins 1 an.
Vous parlez couramment anglais. Vous maîtrisez Excel, Python, R, Power BI et SQL.

De plus, votre adaptabilité et votre capacité à décider seront des atouts essentiels. Ajoutez à cela vos compétences analytiques, votre capacité à synthétiser et votre communication pour finir de nous convaincre.

Dans un monde qui change, la diversité, l’équité et l’inclusion sont des valeurs clés pour le bien-être et la performance des équipes. Chez BNP Paribas, nous souhaitons accueillir et retenir tous les talents sans distinction : c’est ainsi que nous construirons, ensemble, la finance de demain, innovante, responsable et durable.
Enfin, nous attachons une importance particulière à ce que nos futurs collaborateurs agissent au quotidien avec responsabilité éthique et professionnelle.
À tout moment pendant le processus de recrutement, les informations figurant sur votre CV, vos données d’identification et vos antécédents pourront être vérifiées.
Ce poste est à pourvoir dès que possible pour une durée de 12 mois.

Avant de postuler, veillez à vérifier les conditions d’éligibilité pour cette destination : Faire son V.I.E en Belgique (businessfrance.fr) et ajouter à votre espace candidat un CV et une lettre de motivation en anglais.

4183121362,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/consultant-bi-h-f-at-davidson-consulting-4183121362?position=9&pageNum=5&refId=tAIdxX1NjQqbRvTJYfRfsA%3D%3D&trackingId=NCAsQ9vgshnvvmK7YwfmHQ%3D%3D,Consultant BI (H/F),Davidson consulting,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Rejoindre Davidson, ce n’est pas seulement intégrer un groupe de 3000 consultants dans 6 pays et 2 continents, c’est intégrer LA société qui a été élue par ses salariés Great Place To Work France et Europe pendant 4 ans mais aussi une des plus grandes B Corp de France, nommée Best of the World dans la catégorie “collaborateurs” en 2022 ! (Les “B Corp” formant une communauté de sociétés qui ont décidé d’être non pas les meilleures du monde mais les meilleures POUR le monde).
Parce que notre développement repose sur des principes forts :

Un profond respect de l’ensemble de nos parties prenantes : consultant(e)s, clients et fournisseurs. Car si le travail “ne fait pas le bonheur”, il peut cependant “faire le malheur”. Nous nous engageons donc à écouter et agir avec honnêteté.

Une égalité des chances dans le traitement de nos candidatures et dans la gestion de carrière de nos salarié(e)s. Nous croyons en un milieu de travail où équité F/H, inclusion et diversité sont la norme.

Une empreinte environnementale minimale, et sociétale maximale. C’est pourquoi, au-delà des missions que vous réaliserez, vous pourrez également contribuer à des projets que Davidson soutient : missions de solidarité internationale (avec Planète Urgence), bénévolat auprès d’associations (chaque Davidsonien(ne) dispose de 3 jours par an pour intervenir à leurs côtés), accompagnement d’étudiant(e)s issus de milieux peu favorisés (avec Article 1), investissement dans des startups développant des solutions innovantes, actions collectives et individuelles pour la réduction de notre impact carbone…

Un Management adhocratique basé sur la mise en œuvre des principes de “l’entreprise horizontale” et du “management tribal”. Sur ce dernier point une précision d’importance : le bien-être au travail est un luxe qu’il faut pouvoir s’offrir en étant une entreprise “solide”. Ceci induit pour les Davidsonien(ne)s d’allier prises d’initiative, engagement et professionnalisme. Car “sans travail, le talent n’est qu’une sale manie”. Et cela nous incite à chercher à recruter des personnes… meilleures que nous…
Nous encourageons les candidatures de personnes en situation de handicap, et nous nous engageons à répondre au mieux à leurs besoins spécifiques.

Tu interviendras au sein du pôle Big Data & Data Science de Davidson. Cette équipe a pour but de construire des architectures permettant de collecter et faire parler les données ! Ceci dans des secteurs et clients très divers : de la startup de l’IoT au grand groupe audiovisuel…
Mener les analyses fonctionnelles destinées à traduire les besoins du client
Aider les équipes projet dans la conception de modèles de données
Identifier les pistes de création de valeur, au-delà des attentes du client
Concevoir les solutions (Data Integration, ETL, Datawarehouses), les indicateurs et les tableaux de bord
Organiser et préparer les travaux de recette utilisateurs
Mettre en place les processus d’industrialisation
De formation BAC + 5, tu as déjà une première expérience réussie dans le domaine de la BI
Tu sais que SQL ne s’écrit pas escuelle
Tu maîtrises parfaitement un ETL (SSIS, Talend, Datastage, Informatica) et un outil de restitution (PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik …) ou à défaut un outil de reporting (BO, Cognos, Microstrategy)
Et soyons fous : tu as des connaissances en archi Big Data

Tu interviendras au sein du pôle Big Data &

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

The role of a Data Engineer is highly technical and demands extensive expertise across various software development and programming domains. These professionals possess a deep understanding of data analysis, end-user requirements analysis, and business requirements analysis. This knowledge enables them to grasp business needs clearly and translate them into technical solutions. They are well-versed in physical database design principles and the system development life cycle. Additionally, they thrive in team environments.
Data Pipelines: Design, develop, construct, test, and maintain comprehensive data management and processing systems.
Data Transformation: Aggregate and transform raw data from diverse sources to meet both functional and non-functional business requirements.
Data Ingestion: Identify opportunities for data acquisition and explore innovative ways to utilize existing data.
Data Architecture & Models: Create data models to simplify system complexity, enhance efficiency, and reduce costs.
Performance Optimization & Monitoring: Automate processes, optimize data delivery, and redesign the entire architecture to boost performance.
Data Quality: Suggest improvements to enhance the quality, reliability, and efficiency of the entire system.
Data Value: Develop solutions by integrating various programming languages and tools.
Team Collaboration: As a senior member, communicate effectively and support team members by providing technical and architectural solutions.
Big Data Framework / Hadoop: HDFS, Squid, Spark, Conda, Yarn, and MapReduce
Big Data Framework / Hadoop: Flume & Sqoop, Yarn, Zookeeper
Big Data Framework / Hadoop: PIG, Hive
Machine learning (nice to have): Python & algorithms

Data Engineer

The role of a Data Engineer is highly technical and demands extensive expertise across various software development and programming domains. These professionals possess a deep understanding of data analysis, end-user requirements analysis, and business requirements analysis. This knowledge enables them to grasp business needs clearly and translate them into technical solutions. They are well-versed in physical database design principles and the system development life cycle. Additionally, they thrive in team environments.

  • Data Transformation: Aggregate and transform raw data from diverse sources to meet both functional and non-functional business requirements.
  • Data Ingestion: Identify opportunities for data acquisition and explore innovative ways to utilize existing data.

Rejoignez une mission freelance à fort impact stratégique, dans le secteur des transports et de la mobilité !


Nous recherchons activement un Data Engineer pour une mission freelance auprès d’un acteur clé du secteur de la mobilité, reconnu pour son engagement dans la durabilité, l’innovation et l'excellence de ses services.


Basé(e) dans la Région Bruxelloise, vous participerez à la structuration et à l’optimisation des flux de données opérationnels pour améliorer l’analyse des performances et appuyer la prise de décision.


Vos responsabilités

  • Intégrer et structurer des bases de données issues de différents domaines opérationnels.
  • Analyser les écarts entre les données disponibles et les besoins métier afin de proposer des solutions adaptées.
  • Développer et optimiser les pipelines de données pour faciliter la transformation et l’exploitation des informations.
  • Améliorer la qualité des données et garantir leur cohérence pour permettre des analyses précises et fiables.
  • Automatiser et industrialiser les processus de traitement et de gestion des données.
  • Participer à la gouvernance des données, en mettant en place des règles et des standards d’utilisation.
  • Collaborer avec les Data Analysts et Data Scientists pour assurer la disponibilité des données nécessaires aux analyses et reportings.
  • Assurer la maintenance, l’optimisation et l’évolution de l’architecture des données, en mettant en œuvre les meilleures pratiques du domaine.


Votre profil

  • Diplômé(e) d’un Bachelier ou d’un Master en informatique, sciences des données, mathématiques, ou équivalent.
  • Minimum 5 ans d’expérience en ingénierie des données.
  • Expertise en architecture et modélisation des données, ainsi qu’en développement de pipelines de données et en traitement ETL.
  • Solides compétences en gestion de bases de données SQL et NoSQL, ainsi qu'en utilisation de Data Warehouses et de Data Lakes.
  • Maîtrise de la programmation en Python.
  • Familiarité avec les outils cloud (AWS, Azure ou Google Cloud), de monitoring et d’alerte, et d’automatisation et d’orchestration.
  • Connaissance des meilleures pratiques en gouvernance des données.
  • Maîtrise du français et du néerlandais, avec un bon niveau en anglais souhaité.
  • Capacité à analyser et challenger les données, avec une forte volonté d'améliorer continuellement la gestion des données.
  • Curiosité technique, proactivité et capacité à collaborer avec différents départements de l’entreprise.


Notre offre

  • Une mission freelance de longue durée, avec un fort impact stratégique sur la modernisation des systèmes de données.
  • Une opportunité de travailler sur des projets innovants dans le domaine des transports et de la mobilité.
  • Une rémunération compétitive, adaptée à l’expertise et à la durée de la mission.
  • Un travail en mode hybride, avec des possibilités de télétravail.


Cette mission vous intéresse ? N'hésitez plus à postuler car cette annonce ne tardera pas à disparaître ! Notre recherche est urgente.

3937794154,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/power-bi-senior-consultant-at-reply-3937794154?position=4&pageNum=7&refId=lqC9P0HyThfm9pXwhcSV4w%3D%3D&trackingId=bjE2cGZZ5FH3eRasK2EAYw%3D%3D,Power BI Senior Consultant,Reply,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Start a new adventure in the beating heart of the data driven services of Business Elements, where we raise the standards of our industry. We keep an eye out for talent, ambition and eagerness to learn. We’ll coach you, train you and make you part of our story.
Advanced Dax (writing dax, optimizing dax, calculation groups, …)
Delivers work with high quality & precision

In this role, your primary activity will be to develop Power BI reports making use of your extensive knowledge & experience to deliver insights to customers in a UX-friendly way. We expect an advanced skillset in Power BI, not just providing solutions for customers, but also optimizing them where possible. You know how to translate business requirements in terms of analytics to lean reports and have a willingness to share your knowledge with colleagues to drive success at our customers.
Structured career progression - at Reply we encourage career growth and will give you the tools and guidance to achieve subject matter expertise and management capabilities
Paid certification programs for your career evolution
Diverse and vibrant work environment - you'll be surrounded by peers who share your passion for technology
Opportunities to get involved in Hackathons, Code Challenges and Lab Camps
Your education doesn’t need to stop here! We are proud of our continuously learning culture about emerging technologies
Opportunity to work on projects with some of the world’s leading brands

Business Elements is market leader in providing solutions on Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement, Microsoft AI, and Microsoft Power Platform in the Belgium and Luxembourg Area. With 70+ experienced consultants, we offer a broad range of expertise in Customer Engagement, Artificial Intelligence and Digital Marketing.
As a Microsoft Tier 1 Cloud Solution Partner, we also offer dedicated support services to Microsoft customers.

The Microsoft digital transformation framework is designed to enable a cloud data-centric model which is based on 4 pillars: empower people, transform products, optimize operations and engage customers. Business applications are making the bridge between the power of the MS cloud and customer's business processes. The glue which makes the magic for such strategic projects is the way a partner can map this vision to the customer reality. It is all about excellence in delivery, industry knowledge, customer care and technology expertise: the assets that Business Elements has developed during years, and that we will continue to reinforce together with the Microsoft team and our customers.

Start a new adventure in the beating heart of the data driven services of Business Elements, where we raise the standards of our industry. We keep an eye out for talent, ambition and eagerness to learn. We’ll coach you, train you and make you part of our story.


Your skills

  • Advanced Dax (writing dax, optimizing dax, calculation groups, …)
  • M-language (write own functions)
  • SQL
  • Dax Studio
  • Tabular Editor
  • Power BI Rest api

Will be a plus:

  • Powershell (powerbi api)
  • R-language
  • Azure Data Factory
  • Azure Synapse Analytics
  • Develop Connectors
  • Develop Custom Visuals
  • Takes ownership of projects
  • Delivers work with high quality &

4208600849,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-application-analyst-at-euroclear-4208600849?position=5&pageNum=7&refId=lqC9P0HyThfm9pXwhcSV4w%3D%3D&trackingId=Dk9WeWML6TyP76mVpMoTFQ%3D%3D,Junior Application Analyst,Euroclear,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Are you a natural problem-solver? Are you eager to kick-start a career in IT? Would you like to play a key role in ensuring the stability and efficiency of global financial markets?

At Euroclear, we are the financial industry's leading provider of post-trade services, headquartered in Brussels with offices in over 15 countries worldwide. We facilitate the settlement, custody, and servicing of national and cross-border securities transactions—including bonds, shares, derivatives, and investment funds. Simply put, we are a bank for banks, providing critical infrastructure that minimizes risk and enhances efficiency in financial transactions.

To help you make the most of your career launch, we created the IT Newbies Graduate Programme - a unique opportunity for ambitious young talents to join our dynamic international teams with dedicated support and guidance at every step.
No prior experience? No problem! We will equip you with the technical skills you need from scratch and introduce you to the exciting world of financial markets.
Ready to embark on this journey? Join us and shape the future of finance with Euroclear!

As an IT Newbie, you will join the Group Business Solutions (GBS) division, where you will undergo an intensive 3-month training program. Throughout this journey, you will be closely guided by a mentor and supported by a buddy - someone with hands-on experience in a similar role ensuring a smooth transition into your new career.

The GBS division ensures the competitiveness of Euroclear by delivering reliable and sustainable IT solutions for the financial securities markets. Our technical teams deliver new IT solutions and improve existing applications for both our internal and external clients. We deploy changes into the production environment in a controlled and structured way that doesn't compromise production stability, and we ensure applicative production support.

We are looking for Junior Mainframe Application Analysts to join our growing teams. In this role, we will equip you with a highly sought-after niche skillset, allowing you to develop and support applications on a time-critical infrastructure.

Rarely taught at universities, Mainframe technology is the backbone of global enterprises, renowned for its speed, resiliency, and security. Handling massive workloads and mission-critical applications, mainframes can process millions of transactions simultaneously while ensuring unmatched reliability and data integrity.

The best part? Skills learned on Mainframe are transferable across various technologies, opening doors to diverse career opportunities in IT. The pillars underlying the critical importance of mainframes for financial institutions and banks are the following:
High reliability and availability: Mainframes are designed to run continuously for years with minimal downtime, ensuring that financial transactions are processed promptly and securely.
Security: Mainframes have robust security features that help protect sensitive financial information from cyber threats and unauthorized access.
Scalability: Mainframes can handle heavy workloads, including large amounts of data processing and storage, making them ideal for financial transactions that require large computing resources.
Compliance: Financial institutions are subject to strict regulations and standards, and mainframes are equipped with features that help ensure compliance with these regulations.
Performance: Mainframes are optimized for high performance and can process a large number of transactions quickly, which is essential for financial organizations that handle large amounts of data.

Typically, Application Analysts join our company in the role of Software Developer. In this role, they get intensive training and support, allowing them to build up their technical, functional, and business expertise required for the Application Analyst role. After a positive evaluation, they then evolve into the role of a Junior Application Analyst.
As a Software Developer, your main tasks are:
To code, test and document the most important programs for financial markets and ensure their successful launch
Provide support to our testing and operational teams in regards to the code under your responsibility
Ensure production stability being part of the defect management and hotline
Start to produce design documentation with coaching of a senior designer
As an Application Analyst, your main tasks are:
Understand specific client needs or technical requirements. Liaise with the internal clients to better understand existing or new business processes and needs
Based on these needs, perform and document design analysis
Supervise and assess the work of programmers implementing and testing design changes
As you grow in maturity, you will take ownership of the evolution of one or more Applications in your domain
a Mathematics, Engineering, IT or Science-related degree (Bachelor, Master, PhD)
strong curiosity about IT and new technologies
ability to quickly adapt to an international and diverse company
self-learning ability (you're ready to dive into new technologies and extend your own expertise)
proficient in English (both written and spoken)
eager to work with exciting business, functional and technical concepts
customer focused and delivery oriented, with attention to details
a problem solver (you recognize underlying issues and problems, you analyse root causes and define solutions accordingly)
at ease in a fast-changing environment
What is in it for you?
Job security & career growth - A permanent employment contract with diverse opportunities to boost and expand your career through internal mobility.
Work-life balance - A flexible hybrid work setup, allowing you to split your time between home and the office.
Global & dynamic environment - Collaborate closely with inspiring colleagues from 80+ countries in an international and fast-paced setting.
Continuous learning & development - A learning-driven culture that supports your professional and personal growth through knowledge sharing, training, and reskilling.
Comprehensive support & coaching - Benefit from ongoing technical training and hands-on coaching to help you evolve in different career directions.
Attractive rewards - Enjoy a competitive compensation package, including numerous benefits, incentives, and bonus schemes.
A vibrant social experience - Beyond work, our onboarding team will help you build strong friendships and feel part of the Euroclear family through exciting community events.
At Euroclear, we believe in an ideal balance between office and remote work toward business, team and individual needs, enhancing more flexibility, trust and individual accountability.
The Euroclear group is at the heart of the global capital markets providing post-trade and related services to 90% of the world’s top banks. As a proven and resilient capital market infrastructure we

have been offering vital financial services for over 50 years. Join us and help us serve our global customer franchise as we support their settlement and asset servicing of a variety of instruments, from domestic and international bonds to equities, investment funds and more.
Great Place to Work for All

We believe that our people are our strength. The diverse talents that our employees bring to the table, are directly linked to our global success. We are committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates diversity, and strive to be a Great Place to Work for All. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment, regardless of their race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, pregnancy, neuro-diversity, disability, or any other aspect that makes them unique. If you need any specific accommodation due to disability or any other reason, you can let the recruiter know during your application process.
Join the live Q&A session on 24 April 2025 @ 12:00 CEST to find out more about Euroclear and the opportunities available.

Are you a natural problem-solver? Are you eager to kick-start a career in IT? Would you like to play a key role in ensuring the stability and efficiency of global financial markets?


At Euroclear, we are the financial industry's leading provider of post-trade services, headquartered in Brussels with offices in over 15 countries worldwide. We facilitate the settlement, custody, and servicing of national and cross-border securities transactions—including bonds, shares, derivatives, and investment funds. Simply put, we are a bank for banks, providing critical infrastructure that minimizes risk and enhances efficiency in financial transactions.


To help you make the most of your career launch, we created the IT Newbies Graduate Programme - a unique opportunity for ambitious young talents to join our dynamic international teams with dedicated support and guidance at every step.


No prior experience? No problem! We will equip you with the technical skills you need from scratch and introduce you to the exciting world of financial markets.


Ready to embark on this journey? Join us and shape the future of finance with Euroclear!


Division


As an IT Newbie, you will join the Group Business Solutions (GBS) division, where you will undergo an intensive 3-month training program. Throughout this journey, you will be closely guided by a mentor and supported by a buddy - someone with hands-on experience in a similar role ensuring a smooth transition into your new career.


The GBS division ensures the competitiveness of Euroclear by delivering reliable and sustainable IT solutions for the financial securities markets. Our technical teams deliver new IT solutions and improve existing applications for both our internal and external clients. We deploy changes into the production environment in a controlled and structured way that doesn't compromise production stability, and we ensure applicative production support.


We are looking for Junior Mainframe Application Analysts to join our growing teams. In this role, we will equip you with a highly sought-after niche skillset, allowing you to develop and support applications on a time-critical infrastructure.


Rarely taught at universities, Mainframe technology is the backbone of global enterprises, renowned for its speed, resiliency, and security. Handling massive workloads and mission-critical applications, mainframes can process millions of transactions simultaneously while ensuring unmatched reliability and data integrity.


The best part? Skills learned on Mainframe are transferable across various technologies, opening doors to diverse career opportunities in IT. The pillars underlying the critical importance of mainframes for financial institutions and banks are the following:


  • High reliability and availability: Mainframes are designed to run continuously for years with minimal downtime, ensuring that financial transactions are processed promptly and securely.
  • Security: Mainframes have robust security features that help protect sensitive financial information from cyber threats and unauthorized access.
  • Scalability: Mainframes can handle heavy workloads, including large amounts of data processing and storage, making them ideal for financial transactions that require large computing resources.
  • Compliance: Financial institutions are subject to strict regulations and standards, and mainframes are equipped with features that help ensure compliance with these regulations.
  • Performance: Mainframes are optimized for high performance and can process a large number of transactions quickly, which is essential for financial organizations that handle large amounts of data.


Typically, Application Analysts join our company in the role of Software Developer. In this role, they get intensive training and support, allowing them to build up their technical, functional, and business expertise required for the Application Analyst role. After a positive evaluation, they then evolve into the role of a Junior Application Analyst.


As a Software Developer, your main tasks are:


  • To code, test and document the most important programs for financial markets and ensure their successful launch
  • Provide support to our testing and operational teams in regards to the code under your responsibility
  • Ensure production stability being part of the defect management and hotline
  • Start to produce design documentation with coaching of a senior designer


As an Application Analyst, your main tasks are:


  • Understand specific client needs or technical requirements. Liaise with the internal clients to better understand existing or new business processes and needs
  • Based on these needs, perform and document design analysis
  • Supervise and assess the work of programmers implementing and testing design changes
  • As you grow in maturity, you will take ownership of the evolution of one or more Applications in your domain


Required skills


You have:


  • a Mathematics, Engineering, IT or Science-related degree (Bachelor, Master, PhD)
  • strong analytical skills
  • strong curiosity about IT and new technologies
  • interest in Finance, capital markets
  • ability to quickly adapt to an international and diverse company
  • self-learning ability (you're ready to dive into new technologies and extend your own expertise)


You are:


  • proficient in English (both written and spoken)
  • eager to work with exciting business, functional and technical concepts
  • customer focused and delivery oriented, with attention to details
  • a great teammate
  • a problem solver (you recognize underlying issues and problems, you analyse root causes and define solutions accordingly)
  • at ease in a fast-changing environment


What is in it for you?


  • Job security &

4211958959,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-medior-data-engineer-at-cgi-4211958959?position=6&pageNum=7&refId=lqC9P0HyThfm9pXwhcSV4w%3D%3D&trackingId=EDJEcsIeUFT7lvcDaviT8w%3D%3D,Junior - Medior Data Engineer,CGI,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Position Description

Are you passionate about turning raw data into valuable insights? Do you want to grow your skills in a dynamic, tech-driven environment where innovation is key? We’re looking for a motivated Data Engineer with 1 to 3 years of experience to join our team and help shape the future of data-driven solutions.
Design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines.
Work with a variety of data sources and formats (structured & unstructured).
Collaborate with analysts, data scientists, and developers to ensure data accessibility and quality.
Support data warehousing, ETL processes, and integration of new data sources.
Implement best practices for data modeling, version control, and testing.
1–3 years of experience in data engineering or a similar field.
Proficiency in SQL and at least one programming language (Python preferred).
Familiarity with data pipeline tools and frameworks (e.g., Airflow, dbt, Spark).
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS or GCP) is a plus.
A degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering or a related field.
Curiosity, a problem-solving mindset, and eagerness to grow.
Native Dutch or French with a good English level
A pre-employment screening is part of the application process

CGI is one of the world's largest IT consultancy companies. Our people keep Belgium running. Government institutions, banks, infrastructure organization's, energy and utilities, manufacturing and life sciences companies are CGI's clients . We work on interesting projects that touch the everyday lives of millions of people. We have a regional presence, reinforced with global domain expertise, our ecosystem and colleagues spread across the globe.
We are proud of the impactful projects we make a success together with our colleagues.
At CGI, we value diversity and inclusion as it not only promotes collaboration, but also often leads to better results. We look forward to your contribution to our team!
Working in small self-managing teams consisting of experts in your field.
Directing your own career with the space to keep developing yourself.
You work with the latest technologies.
An excellent salary and attractive fringe benefits
And the opportunity to become a CGI shareholder
Join our team of experts and apply now!
Questions about the position? Ask them to Gregory Depasse, Director, Head of AI , via gregory.depasse@cgi.com.
For more information about the application procedure, please contact recruiter Fabienne Philips fabienne.philips@cgi.com
We do not collaborate with external recruitment agencies. Therefore, unsolicited acquisition is not appreciated.
Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role
Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.
Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.

Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.

You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.
Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

Picarro is transforming gas utility operations with innovative solutions for methane emissions management, risk-informed leak prioritization, and pipeline asset optimization. As a Data Analyst in Picarro's Gas Business Unit, you will play a critical role in developing analytical tools, generating insights from complex datasets, and driving operational improvements.

Reporting to the Sr. Director of Climate and Safety Solutions, you will work with cross-functional teams to develop ETL pipelines, automate data processing, and create reports that enhance internal decision-making and customer outcomes. The role is ideal for candidates with 1-2 years of experience or a recent Master's or Ph.D. graduate with strong data analysis skills.
Data Processing and ETL Development – Build and optimize automation tools and ETL pipelines for cleaning, normalizing, and structuring large-scale sensor and operational data.
Analysis and Insights – Conduct data analysis on time-series, sensor, and geospatial datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and operational improvements.
Collaboration – Work with product management, engineering, and customer success teams to ensure data workflows meet business needs.
Automation – Develop scripts and processes in Python and SQL to improve data ingestion, processing, and reporting.
Documentation and Reporting – Maintain clear documentation of methodologies, workflows, and results to support internal teams and customers.
Customer Support – Assist in generating analytical deliverables and visualizations to support customer projects and business objectives.
Technical Proficiency – Strong Python and SQL skills for data automation and analysis.
Statistical and Analytical Skills – Solid foundation in statistics, including hypothesis testing and uncertainty quantification.
Data Engineering Exposure – Experience with ETL, data cleaning, and automation techniques.
GIS (Preferred but Not Required) – Familiarity with GIS tools (e.g., ESRI ArcGIS, QGIS) for geospatial analysis is a plus.
Communication – Ability to translate technical findings into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Problem-Solving – Proactive approach to improving data processes and solving data quality challenges.
Master's or Ph.D. in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field (or Bachelor's with 1-2 years of experience in a relevant role).
Experience in Python, SQL, and data automation workflows.
Exposure to geospatial, time-series, or measurement data.
Industry experience in natural gas, utilities, or infrastructure is a plus.
Experience with ETL development, reporting automation, or cloud-based data processing is preferred.

Senior Data Analyst

Job Location: Geneva, Switzerland

Job Term: Full-Time

The Opportunity

Picarro is transforming gas utility operations with innovative solutions for methane emissions management, risk-informed leak prioritization, and pipeline asset optimization. As a Data Analyst in Picarro's Gas Business Unit, you will play a critical role in developing analytical tools, generating insights from complex datasets, and driving operational improvements.

Reporting to the Sr. Director of Climate and Safety Solutions, you will work with cross-functional teams to develop ETL pipelines, automate data processing, and create reports that enhance internal decision-making and customer outcomes. The role is ideal for candidates with 1-2 years of experience or a recent Master's or Ph.D. graduate with strong data analysis skills.



Roles and Responsibilities

  • Data Processing and ETL Development – Build and optimize automation tools and ETL pipelines for cleaning, normalizing, and structuring large-scale sensor and operational data.
  • Analysis and Insights – Conduct data analysis on time-series, sensor, and geospatial datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and operational improvements.
  • Collaboration – Work with product management, engineering, and customer success teams to ensure data workflows meet business needs.
  • Automation – Develop scripts and processes in Python and SQL to improve data ingestion, processing, and reporting.
  • Documentation and Reporting – Maintain clear documentation of methodologies, workflows, and results to support internal teams and customers.
  • Customer Support – Assist in generating analytical deliverables and visualizations to support customer projects and business objectives.



Skills and Abilities

  • Technical Proficiency – Strong Python and SQL skills for data automation and analysis.
  • Statistical and Analytical Skills – Solid foundation in statistics, including hypothesis testing and uncertainty quantification.
  • Data Engineering Exposure – Experience with ETL, data cleaning, and automation techniques.
  • GIS (Preferred but Not Required) – Familiarity with GIS tools (e.g., ESRI ArcGIS, QGIS) for geospatial analysis is a plus.
  • Communication – Ability to translate technical findings into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Problem-Solving – Proactive approach to improving data processes and solving data quality challenges.

Qualifications

  • Master's or Ph.D. in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field (or Bachelor's with 1-2 years of experience in a relevant role).
  • Experience in Python, SQL, and data automation workflows.
  • Exposure to geospatial, time-series, or measurement data.
  • Industry experience in natural gas, utilities, or infrastructure is a plus.
  • Experience with ETL development, reporting automation, or cloud-based data processing is preferred.

4201046270,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-f-m-d-80-100%25-zurich-hybrid-work-at-smg-swiss-marketplace-group-4201046270?position=3&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=TIO%2FJY5x3IsnrhyLDDkK8Q%3D%3D,Data Analyst (f|m|d) (80-100%) - Zurich - Hybrid Work,SMG Swiss Marketplace Group,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Company Description
Welcome to SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG
We are a pioneering network of online marketplaces and an innovative European digital company that simplifies people's lives with future-oriented products.
Join our General Marketplaces team as our new Data Analyst and become a part of SMG!

We are currently looking for a Data Analyst who will actively contribute to improving our business analytics capabilities, ensure tracking and data consistency, define and spot optimization potential in our buying and selling conversion funnels across our different platforms, and work as a data evangelist across our company by facilitating knowledge sharing sessions and training. As a member of our Data Team, you will spend time gathering insights and recommendations about our users' behavior, democratizing data access at the company, and promoting the correct use of data and analytics.
Perform business and feature analysis and deep dives for management and product stakeholders
Own the Tableau self-service platform and main reports
Creation and maintenance of the different user conversion funnels on Google Analytics for the brands within General Marketplaces
Define GA tracking together with our front-end engineers, including testing the implementation and maintaining an events track book
Carrying reporting and analytics onboarding training for other employees of the company (especially PMs) to allow them to become self-sufficient and build their own, more specific reports and funnels
Performing internal data quality audits and reviews on internal tools
3-5 years of experience in data analysis, storytelling, visualization, and effectively presenting insights about (complex) topics to stakeholders
3+ years of experience working with Google Analytics: building funnels and reports on the analytical side, and tracking implementation on the tech side
Experience with the GA4 and Firebase apps tracking and GA events tracking test tools such as XTag or GTM
Knowledge of Tableau and SQL is a big plus
Analytical and problem solving mindset, ability to dig into potential issues and propose solutions for optimization
Ability to quickly onboard and understand our business model, including how various events and transactions are captured in our data structures
Proactive approach to learn and find solutions outside direct area of competence

At SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG, you’ll be part of an international and diverse team of friendly and supportive colleagues. We embrace a hybrid work model, giving you the flexibility to work from our modern office in Zurich Oerlikon and your own home office.
Flexible working hours and a culture of trust
40-hour week (flexitime with a cap at 45 hours)
6 weeks of vacation (with the possibility to buy 10 additional days)
Great office facilities with opportunities for plenty of social interactions, after-work-apéros, and regular company-wide events
Free SBB half-fare card and you travel 1st class between SMG locations in Switzerland
18 weeks maternity and 6 weeks paternity leave (also in case of adoption)
Choose your hardware (Mac or Windows + Monitor for home) and cell phone (iPhone, Samsung or Google Pixel)
Then apply now with your current CV, and feel free to submit any additional documents you find helpful to boost your application.
We are looking forward to getting to know you!
SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. is a pioneering network of online marketplaces and cutting-edge European digital company that simplifies people’s lives with innovative products.

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. provides customers the best tools to meet their life decision needs. The portfolio includes Real Estate (ImmoScout24, Homegate, Flatfox, alle-immobilien.ch, Immostreet.ch, home.ch, Publimmo, Acheter-Louer.ch, CASASOFT, IAZI), Automotive (AutoScout24, MotoScout24), General Marketplaces (anibis.ch, tutti.ch, Ricardo) and Finance & Insurance (FinanceScout24, moneyland.ch).
The company was founded in November 2021 by TX Group AG, Ringier AG, La Mobilière and General Atlantic.

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG primarily engages directly with candidates. We do not accept unsolicited resumes or candidate profiles from recruitment agencies unless we have specifically requested their assistance for particular roles. Any submissions made without a prior request from our Talent Acquisition team will not be acknowledged or considered. We appreciate the understanding and cooperation of recruitment agencies in respecting this policy.

Company Description

Welcome to SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG

We are a pioneering network of online marketplaces and an innovative European digital company that simplifies people's lives with future-oriented products.

Job Description

Join our General Marketplaces team as our new Data Analyst and become a part of SMG!

We are currently looking for a Data Analyst who will actively contribute to improving our business analytics capabilities, ensure tracking and data consistency, define and spot optimization potential in our buying and selling conversion funnels across our different platforms, and work as a data evangelist across our company by facilitating knowledge sharing sessions and training. As a member of our Data Team, you will spend time gathering insights and recommendations about our users' behavior, democratizing data access at the company, and promoting the correct use of data and analytics.

About The Position

  • Perform business and feature analysis and deep dives for management and product stakeholders
  • Own the Tableau self-service platform and main reports
  • Creation and maintenance of the different user conversion funnels on Google Analytics for the brands within General Marketplaces
  • Define GA tracking together with our front-end engineers, including testing the implementation and maintaining an events track book
  • Carrying reporting and analytics onboarding training for other employees of the company (especially PMs) to allow them to become self-sufficient and build their own, more specific reports and funnels
  • Performing internal data quality audits and reviews on internal tools

Qualifications

What we are looking for

  • 3-5 years of experience in data analysis, storytelling, visualization, and effectively presenting insights about (complex) topics to stakeholders
  • 3+ years of experience working with Google Analytics: building funnels and reports on the analytical side, and tracking implementation on the tech side
  • Experience with the GA4 and Firebase apps tracking and GA events tracking test tools such as XTag or GTM
  • Knowledge of A/B testing frameworks
  • Knowledge of Tableau and SQL is a big plus
  • Analytical and problem solving mindset, ability to dig into potential issues and propose solutions for optimization
  • Ability to quickly onboard and understand our business model, including how various events and transactions are captured in our data structures
  • Proactive approach to learn and find solutions outside direct area of competence
  • Fluency in English mandatory
  • German is a plus

Additional Information

Why you should join us

At SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG, you’ll be part of an international and diverse team of friendly and supportive colleagues. We embrace a hybrid work model, giving you the flexibility to work from our modern office in Zurich Oerlikon and your own home office.

Benefits You’ll Love

  • Flexible working hours and a culture of trust
  • Hybrid work set-up
  • 40-hour week (flexitime with a cap at 45 hours)
  • 6 weeks of vacation (with the possibility to buy 10 additional days)
  • Great office facilities with opportunities for plenty of social interactions, after-work-apéros, and regular company-wide events
  • Free SBB half-fare card and you travel 1st class between SMG locations in Switzerland
  • Gender-neutral fair-pay
  • 18 weeks maternity and 6 weeks paternity leave (also in case of adoption)
  • Choose your hardware (Mac or Windows + Monitor for home) and cell phone (iPhone, Samsung or Google Pixel)

Ready to make an impact?

Then apply now with your current CV, and feel free to submit any additional documents you find helpful to boost your application.

We are looking forward to getting to know you!

About Us

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. is a pioneering network of online marketplaces and cutting-edge European digital company that simplifies people’s lives with innovative products.

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. provides customers the best tools to meet their life decision needs. The portfolio includes Real Estate (ImmoScout24, Homegate, Flatfox, alle-immobilien.ch, Immostreet.ch, home.ch, Publimmo, Acheter-Louer.ch, CASASOFT, IAZI), Automotive (AutoScout24, MotoScout24), General Marketplaces (anibis.ch, tutti.ch, Ricardo) and Finance &
column2:
Insurance (FinanceScout24, moneyland.ch).

The company was founded in November 2021 by TX Group AG, Ringier AG, La Mobilière and General Atlantic.

4208126674,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-and-reporting-analyst-at-lombard-odier-group-4208126674?position=5&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=6IV7CxZMj2N6GXItEmJwnA%3D%3D,Data and Reporting Analyst,Lombard Odier Group,"Geneva, Switzerland","A career at Lombard Odier means working for a renowned global wealth and asset manager, with a strong focus on sustainable investing. An innovative bank of choice for private and institutional clients, our independently owned Firm is one of the best-capitalised banking groups in the world, managing close to CHF 300 billion and operating from over 25 offices across 4 continents.

With a history spanning over 225 years, Lombard Odier is an investment house providing a comprehensive offering of discretionary and advisory portfolio management, wealth services and custody. We also offer asset management services and investment strategies through Lombard Odier Investment Managers and provide advanced banking technology to other financial institutions.

“Rethink Everything” is our philosophy – it is at the heart of everything we do. We have grown stronger through more than 40 financial crises by rethinking the world around us to provide a fresh investment perspective for our clients.

We report on the evolution of LOIM’s Financials (Assets under Management, Revenues and Costs) to various internal and external stakeholders. We manage LOIM’s revenue processes and implement LOIM’s transfer pricing policies. We provide Financial Planning and Analysis to LOIM’s business lines and to the Lombard Odier Group.
Develop, maintain and run workflows that prepare data and ensure data quality for facts and dimensions feeding our dashboards and reports
Collaborate with our internal data providers (IT, Operations, Business Dev) in projects, production and troubleshooting
Produce, maintain and upgrade dashboards, reports and ad-hoc analysis intended for Senior Management, Investment teams, Business Development
Participate to the preparation of Revenue forecasts
Drive various projects, e.g. improvement of existing data management processes, design dashboards that address new business requirements, integrate new data sources
3-5 years of experience in a similar role
Experience working with large datasets and building reports for various stakeholders
Strong technical skills, including experience with Alteryx and Tableau, Microsoft office (Excel/Access, VBA), Cognos ReportNet a plus
Genuine interest for the financial industry and investment products
Technically minded and detail oriented with strong conceptual and problem solving skills
Organized, ability to progress on multiple concurrent tasks with autonomy
Team player with good communication skills
Very good written and spoken English and French

Our Maison’s DNA is defined by five core values. Excellence drives us to be the best at what we do, while Innovation fuels our progress. Respect underpins every interaction, and Integrity shapes our actions. Together, we are One Team, united in serving our clients with unwavering dedication.

As a responsible and supportive employer, we promote a diverse and inclusive work environment for our employees and candidates. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are woven into the fabric of our Maison’s DNA, and we strive to ensure that our employees can fulfill both their personal and professional aspirations by encouraging internal mobility and individual upskilling programs. We firmly believe that building Diverse Teams contributes to our successes and to deliver on this, we actively embed Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in our business strategy.
It is an exciting time to join our Teams. All applications will be handled in the strictest confidence.

A career at Lombard Odier means working for a renowned global wealth and asset manager, with a strong focus on sustainable investing. An innovative bank of choice for private and institutional clients, our independently owned Firm is one of the best-capitalised banking groups in the world, managing close to CHF 300 billion and operating from over 25 offices across 4 continents.

With a history spanning over 225 years, Lombard Odier is an investment house providing a comprehensive offering of discretionary and advisory portfolio management, wealth services and custody. We also offer asset management services and investment strategies through Lombard Odier Investment Managers and provide advanced banking technology to other financial institutions.

“Rethink Everything” is our philosophy – it is at the heart of everything we do. We have grown stronger through more than 40 financial crises by rethinking the world around us to provide a fresh investment perspective for our clients.



Data and Reporting Analyst


We report on the evolution of LOIM’s Financials (Assets under Management, Revenues and Costs) to various internal and external stakeholders. We manage LOIM’s revenue processes and implement LOIM’s transfer pricing policies. We provide Financial Planning and Analysis to LOIM’s business lines and to the Lombard Odier Group.


YOUR ROLE

  • Develop, maintain and run workflows that prepare data and ensure data quality for facts and dimensions feeding our dashboards and reports
column2: • Collaborate with our internal data providers (IT, Operations, Business Dev) in projects, production and troubleshooting
column3: • Produce, maintain and upgrade dashboards, reports and ad-hoc analysis intended for Senior Management, Investment teams, Business Development
column4: • Participate to the preparation of Revenue forecasts
column5: • Drive various projects, e.g. improvement of existing data management processes, design dashboards that address new business requirements, integrate new data sources
column6:
YOUR PROFILE

  • 3-5 years of experience in a similar role
column7:
• Experience working with large datasets and building reports for various stakeholders
  • Strong technical skills, including experience with Alteryx and Tableau, Microsoft office (Excel/Access, VBA), Cognos ReportNet a plus
column8: • Genuine interest for the financial industry and investment products
column9: • Technically minded and detail oriented with strong conceptual and problem solving skills
column10: • Organized, ability to progress on multiple concurrent tasks with autonomy
column11: • Team player with good communication skills
column12: • Very good written and spoken English and French
column13:
• Residence in Switzerland.



    • Our Maison’s DNA is defined by five core values. Excellence drives us to be the best at what we do, while Innovation fuels our progress. Respect underpins every interaction, and Integrity shapes our actions. Together, we are One Team, united in serving our clients with unwavering dedication.


    As a responsible and supportive employer, we promote a diverse and inclusive work environment for our employees and candidates. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are woven into the fabric of our Maison’s DNA, and we strive to ensure that our employees can fulfill both their personal and professional aspirations by encouraging internal mobility and individual upskilling programs. We firmly believe that building Diverse Teams contributes to our successes and to deliver on this, we actively embed Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in our business strategy.


    It is an exciting time to join our Teams. All applications will be handled in the strictest confidence.

7+ years of experience in ERP data analysis, with hands-on exposure to end-to-end business processes across finance (Record-to-Report), procurement (Procure-to-Pay), and sales (Order-to-Cash)​
Demonstrated history of analyzing and optimizing data in these functional areas is expected.
Experience working in large enterprises or industries with complex worldwide financial operations (e.g. manufacturing, retail, or consumer goods) is preferred.
Candidates should be familiar with multi-department ERP environments and high transaction volumes, as this role spans P2P, O2C, and R2R processes.
Strong expertise in enterprise ERP systems (SAP ECC experience is strongly preferred)​.
Deep knowledge of key ERP modules in Finance, Procurement, and Sales and how data flows through these processes.
Proficiency in SAP data analytics and querying tools: SAP Query, SAP ABAP Query, SAP Data Browser.
Ability to generate reports and perform data validation across P2P, O2C, and R2R data.

Skilled in process mapping and analysis – capable of documenting end-to-end process flows (e.g. mapping how purchase orders to payments, or orders to cash receipts flow through the system) and identifying data dependencies/improvement opportunities.
Familiarity with business intelligence and reporting tools (such as SAP BW, Power BI) for building dashboards and visualizing ERP data insights.​
Strong interpersonal communication skills in English
column2: other languages are an advantage.

column1: Excellent stakeholder engagement and communication skills – able to collaborate with finance, procurement, IT, and sales stakeholders and translate data findings into business insights​
A problem-solving, analytical mindset is critical for investigating data issues and identifying root causes or trends​

The candidate should be detail-oriented yet able to see the big picture, and adept at troubleshooting process/data problems. Additionally, strong organizational skills and the ability to work under deadlines in cross-functional teams (often acting as a bridge between technical teams and business users) are important​

We are a Brazilian company with over 35 years of experience in delivering IT services worldwide, ranging from IT outsourcing to application development or IT staffing. We have a direct presence in 41 countries, through our 70 offices located throughout the world. We have managed to become the preferred partner of many small-to-midsize local and regional companies as well. Most of our clients come from industries such as financial services, manufacturing, telecommunications, chemical, services, technology, public sector and utilities.

Stefanini has career opportunities locally and around the world for professionals interested in a vibrant, passionate, team-oriented workplace. If you are a customer-centric person with a ""get it done"" attitude, come over for coffee and a talk on your future career with us! Learn more about us on www.stefanini.com and join us on LinkedIn , Facebook and Instagram where we regularly post insights from our colleagues.

Position: Senior ERP Data Analyst

Location: Geneva, Switzerland (Hybrid)


Job Description

Experience Level:

  • 7+ years of experience in ERP data analysis, with hands-on exposure to end-to-end business processes across finance (Record-to-Report), procurement (Procure-to-Pay), and sales (Order-to-Cash)​
  • Demonstrated history of analyzing and optimizing data in these functional areas is expected.


Preferred Industry Background:

  • Experience working in large enterprises or industries with complex worldwide financial operations (e.g. manufacturing, retail, or consumer goods) is preferred.
  • Candidates should be familiar with multi-department ERP environments and high transaction volumes, as this role spans P2P, O2C, and R2R processes.


Certifications:

  • ERP certification(s) preferred


Technical Skills:

  • Strong expertise in enterprise ERP systems (SAP ECC experience is strongly preferred)​.
  • Deep knowledge of key ERP modules in Finance, Procurement, and Sales and how data flows through these processes.
  • Proficiency in SAP data analytics and querying tools: SAP Query, SAP ABAP Query, SAP Data Browser.
  • Ability to generate reports and perform data validation across P2P, O2C, and R2R data.
  • Skilled in process mapping and analysis – capable of documenting end-to-end process flows (e.g. mapping how purchase orders to payments, or orders to cash receipts flow through the system) and identifying data dependencies/improvement opportunities.
  • Familiarity with business intelligence and reporting tools (such as SAP BW, Power BI) for building dashboards and visualizing ERP data insights.​


Soft Skills:

  • Strong interpersonal communication skills in English
column2:
other languages are an advantage.
  • Excellent stakeholder engagement and communication skills – able to collaborate with finance, procurement, IT, and sales stakeholders and translate data findings into business insights​
  • A problem-solving, analytical mindset is critical for investigating data issues and identifying root causes or trends​
  • The candidate should be detail-oriented yet able to see the big picture, and adept at troubleshooting process/data problems. Additionally, strong organizational skills and the ability to work under deadlines in cross-functional teams (often acting as a bridge between technical teams and business users) are important​





    • About Us

    We are a Brazilian company with over 35 years of experience in delivering IT services worldwide, ranging from IT outsourcing to application development or IT staffing. We have a direct presence in 41 countries, through our 70 offices located throughout the world. We have managed to become the preferred partner of many small-to-midsize local and regional companies as well. Most of our clients come from industries such as financial services, manufacturing, telecommunications, chemical, services, technology, public sector and utilities.

    Stefanini has career opportunities locally and around the world for professionals interested in a vibrant, passionate, team-oriented workplace. If you are a customer-centric person with a ""get it done"" attitude, come over for coffee and a talk on your future career with us! Learn more about us on www.stefanini.com and join us on LinkedIn , Facebook and Instagram where we regularly post insights from our colleagues.
