4203769113,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-power-bi-looker-at-bechtle-schweiz-ag-4203769113?position=7&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=%2Bk4qVUAit1pqtvHoldJ50Q%3D%3D,Data Analyst Power BI / Looker,Bechtle Schweiz AG,"Neuchâtel, Neuchâtel, Switzerland","Be your best with bechtle
Avec plus de 14 000 employés, nous sommes l'une des entreprises informatiques les plus prospères et les leaders du marché dans notre secteur.

L’association de la vente directe de produits informatiques et d'une gamme complète de prestations de services proposée par les différentes sociétés de services informatiques fait de nous un partenaire informatique fort et porteur d’avenir (« zukunftsstark ») pour les entreprises moyennes, les grands groupes et le secteur public. Nous sommes chez nous dans toute l’Europe et toujours près de chez vous.
Pour le compte de notre client du canton de Neuchâtel, nous recherchons un Ingénieur Power BI / Looker.
Concevoir et faire évoluer des rapports Power BI complexes : modélisation, DAX, performance
Assurer la fiabilité des modèles de données tabulaires et optimiser les requêtes
Participer à la documentation, l’industrialisation et la gouvernance des rapports BI
Travailler en lien étroit avec les équipes métiers pour comprendre et répondre aux besoins
Accompagner progressivement la migration vers Looker pour les rapports identifiés comme éligibles
Expérience confirmée avec Power BI (modèle de données, mesures DAX, Power Query)
Une bonne expérience de Looker / LookML est un réel atout
Maîtrise du SQL pour l’extraction et la transformation de données
Bonne compréhension des architectures BI (data warehouse, modèles tabulaires)
Capacité à évoluer dans un environnement structuré, exigeant et collaboratif
Diversité : des tâches intéressantes et changeantes dans un secteur tourné vers l’avenir
Conditions de travail avantageuses : 6 semaines de vacances par an et un plan de prévoyance attractif
Développement et mise en valeur du potentiel : vaste gamme de formations professionnelles et personnelles proposées par l'Académie Bechtle

Be your best with bechtle

Avec plus de 14 000 employés, nous sommes l'une des entreprises informatiques les plus prospères et les leaders du marché dans notre secteur.

L’association de la vente directe de produits informatiques et d'une gamme complète de prestations de services proposée par les différentes sociétés de services informatiques fait de nous un partenaire informatique fort et porteur d’avenir (« zukunftsstark ») pour les entreprises moyennes, les grands groupes et le secteur public. Nous sommes chez nous dans toute l’Europe et toujours près de chez vous.


Data Analyst Power BI / Looker (f/m/d)


Pour le compte de notre client du canton de Neuchâtel, nous recherchons un Ingénieur Power BI / Looker.



Ta mission


  • Concevoir et faire évoluer des rapports Power BI complexes : modélisation, DAX, performance
  • Assurer la fiabilité des modèles de données tabulaires et optimiser les requêtes
  • Participer à la documentation, l’industrialisation et la gouvernance des rapports BI
  • Travailler en lien étroit avec les équipes métiers pour comprendre et répondre aux besoins
  • Accompagner progressivement la migration vers Looker pour les rapports identifiés comme éligibles



Ton profil

  • Expérience confirmée avec Power BI (modèle de données, mesures DAX, Power Query)
  • Une bonne expérience de Looker / LookML est un réel atout
  • Maîtrise du SQL pour l’extraction et la transformation de données
  • Bonne compréhension des architectures BI (data warehouse, modèles tabulaires)
  • Capacité à évoluer dans un environnement structuré, exigeant et collaboratif


Notre proposition

  • Diversité : des tâches intéressantes et changeantes dans un secteur tourné vers l’avenir
  • Conditions de travail avantageuses : 6 semaines de vacances par an et un plan de prévoyance attractif
  • Développement et mise en valeur du potentiel : vaste gamme de formations professionnelles et personnelles proposées par l'Académie Bechtle

4202461702,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/internship-r-d-engineer-data-science-at-sulzer-services-4202461702?position=9&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=g8Ut5t%2Bt%2Fpqc%2BRhUrL7tsA%3D%3D,Internship R&D Engineer (Data Science),Sulzer Services,"Oberwinterthur, Zurich, Switzerland","CT_Technology & Innovation-E122
Internship R&D Engineer (Data Science) - Full Time - Oberwinterthur, Switzerland

Sulzer is a leading engineering company with a proud heritage of innovation. Join our global team to grow your expertise and develop innovative solutions that enable a prosperous and more sustainable society.
We are looking for an R&D Engineer, Data Science Intern to join our Chemtech, Technology and Innovation, team in Oberwinterthur.

Join our R&D team for six months and develop innovative solutions for the chemical industry and sustainable technologies, including carbon capture and emission control. Focused on digitalization, you will help drive data-driven product development from ideation to market-ready solutions within our Separation Technology business unit.
Collaborate in Contribute to data-driven product development within the Separation Technology business unit.
Collect, organize, and analyze experimental data from our pilot plants and production facilities.
Identify opportunities to enhance our experimental design and critical parameters for product optimization.
Play an active role in implementing new analytical technologies to support digital transformation.
To Succeed In This Role, You Will Need
Student or recent graduate in Chemical, Process, or Mechanical Engineering (related disciplines welcome).
Experience in data evaluation, modeling, visualization, and data-driven analysis.
Previous experience with programming languages such as Python or R.
Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office is expected.
Curious, motivated team player with a knack for problem-solving and a desire to advance your career in a dynamic, fast-paced, and innovative environment.
Access to a wide range of discounts
No visa or work permit support can be provided for this role.
Do you have a question about the role?
Reach out to Alexi Donadoni at Alexi.Donadoni@sulzer.com . Our team is looking forward hearing from you!
Sulzer is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in the strength of a diverse workforce and are committed to offering an inclusive work environment.
We are proud to be recognized as a Top Employer 2025 in Brazil, China, Finland, Germany, Ireland, Switzerland, South Africa, the UK and the USA.

We are the European Travel-Tech leader in Dynamic Holiday Packages. With technology, we turn spontaneous thoughts into meaningful experiences, helping people travel the world.

We are looking for a Business Insight Analyst to join our Ancillaries & Strategy team in Chiasso. This is a great opportunity to apply your analytical skills and contribute to improving business performance through data-driven insights.

The candidate will be primarily involved in the Ancillaries area, focusing on pricing strategies, customer segmentation, and market behavior analysis. The role involves supporting development teams with data and insights, helping to shape product roadmaps and enhance the group’s digital assets.
The candidate will also have the opportunity to present findings to senior management, gaining valuable exposure to strategic decision-making and C-level stakeholders.
Team - you will join the Ancillaries & Strategy team within the Operations - Platform department.
Analyzing big data, determining customer trends and delivering insight to drive business performance
Closely partner with Product team, driving decision making and strategy with data and analytical insight
Executing multiple projects across teams to successfully achieve specific goals and objectives
Implementing strategies and defining models to accelerate and optimize revenue growth
1-3 years of experience in Data/Business analyst role in a fast-paced environment
Proven experience of delivering value thanks to data-driven analysis
Excellent knowledge of Excel and SQL programming language
Fluency in English both written and verbal
Ability to influence decision-makers through presentation of analysis
Familiarity with digital and e-commerce business
Previous experience in the travel industry
- An inclusive, friendly, and international environment (you’ll be working with colleagues from +10 countries and over 48 nationalities)
- Shorter working week (36h as full time), with a half working day on Fridays
- Flexible start and end of the working day
- Possibility to work from anywhere for a period of time per year defined according to local regulations
- Fri-Yays: half a day on Friday morning with a no-meeting mandate and dedicated to deep work, personal growth, learning and training and/or focus time.

- Professional and managerial skills development training paths, access to e-learning platforms such as O’reilly, Udemy, Coursera (depending on the department), and to our internal platform offering bespoke training content.
- 2 paid days off per year for volunteering purposes
- Occasional social events to foster connections among colleagues
- Travel industry discounts and flash exclusive staff fares
- We support our employees through life's significant moments with leave options (e.g. parental responsibilities, marriages, bereavements, relocations, etc.)
Wish you were here? We do, too!
(*Please note the process can slightly vary. The recruiter in charge will share more details when setting up the interview)
Our commitment to celebrate diversity and generate belonging

At the heart of our culture is a commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, sexual orientation, religion, gender identity or expression, and accessibility. We strongly believe in an equal opportunity space, which is welcoming and celebrates the uniqueness of everyone who works here. We value different lived experiences and respect viewpoints, as we know unicity drives innovation. We want to make sure our people reflect the communities across the world we help travel.

By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you are legally authorised to work in the country of employment and that you do not require visa sponsorship to obtain employment visa status.

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>
In the context of the Luxury New Retail, Richemont Group is accelerating its logistics transformation reshaping our logistics network across all Regions.
Agility, Flexibility, Speed and Customer-centricity are the key drivers for a successful logistics transformation across our Maisons.

By joining our Group Logistics Business Performance team, you will contribute to the development, standardization, and optimization of our end-to-end logistics reporting and performance KPIs across all regions.
HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

As a Logistics Data Analyst intern, you will play a key role in modernizing our data analytics ecosystem. You will support the migration of logistics databases to our new data lake in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) BigQuery and help transition all Power BI dashboards to Looker, ensuring seamless data visualization and reporting.
Assist in migrating of logistics databases to the new data lake in GCP BigQuery.
Rebuild and optimize Power BI dashboards in Looker, ensuring accuracy and performance.
Process, clean, and validate data integrity for analytics.
Collaborate with logistics teams to identify and resolve data discrepancies in dashboards.
Document standard logistics performance metrics and best practices for reporting.
Participate in cross-functional logistics projects, contributing to data-driven decision-making.
HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

You are a student or recent graduate in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field. You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an interest in data visualization and business intelligence.
You have experience in data processing, cleaning and validation to ensure data integrity.
You are autonomous, organized, with a proactive mindset to drive improvements and the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders.
You speak English fluently (French is a plus).
You are proficient in SQL and familiar with Power BI, Looker. Experience with Python and knowledge of GCP BigQuery is a plus.
HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?
This is a unique opportunity to gain deep insights into luxury logistics operations and luxury markets.
Exposure to cutting-edge BI technologies in a dynamic, international work environment
Hands-on experience in cloud data management, business intelligence, and cross-functional logistics teams collaboration.

CONTEXT

In the context of the Luxury New Retail, Richemont Group is accelerating its logistics transformation reshaping our logistics network across all Regions.

Agility, Flexibility, Speed and Customer-centricity are the key drivers for a successful logistics transformation across our Maisons.

By joining our Group Logistics Business Performance team, you will contribute to the development, standardization, and optimization of our end-to-end logistics reporting and performance KPIs across all regions.

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

As a Logistics Data Analyst intern, you will play a key role in modernizing our data analytics ecosystem. You will support the migration of logistics databases to our new data lake in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) BigQuery and help transition all Power BI dashboards to Looker, ensuring seamless data visualization and reporting.

Key Responsibilities

  • Assist in migrating of logistics databases to the new data lake in GCP BigQuery.
  • Rebuild and optimize Power BI dashboards in Looker, ensuring accuracy and performance.
  • Process, clean, and validate data integrity for analytics.
  • Collaborate with logistics teams to identify and resolve data discrepancies in dashboards.
  • Document standard logistics performance metrics and best practices for reporting.
  • Participate in cross-functional logistics projects, contributing to data-driven decision-making.

HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

You are a student or recent graduate in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field. You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an interest in data visualization and business intelligence.

You have experience in data processing, cleaning and validation to ensure data integrity.

You are autonomous, organized, with a proactive mindset to drive improvements and the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders.

You speak English fluently (French is a plus).

You are proficient in SQL and familiar with Power BI, Looker. Experience with Python and knowledge of GCP BigQuery is a plus.

HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?

This is a unique opportunity to gain deep insights into luxury logistics operations and luxury markets.

Exposure to cutting-edge BI technologies in a dynamic, international work environment

Hands-on experience in cloud data management, business intelligence, and cross-functional logistics teams collaboration.

4204922609,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analytics-insights-paid-internship-m-f-x-at-procter-gamble-4204922609?position=13&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=bHM70MtZArOE0vnM2G182g%3D%3D,Analytics & Insights - Paid Internship (m/f/x),Procter & Gamble,"Petit Lancy, Geneva, Switzerland","Job Location

Do you have passion to influence business strategy, product design, commercial vision, media landscape? Passion to drive the change, through deep consumer understanding and front-edge advanced analytics? And finally, are you available for a 6-months internship?
Then, this role is perfect for you!
In Analytics & Insights (A&I), we use our boundless curiosity to discover what consumers want, why they want it & how we can we influence them, through immersive exploration and data analytics.
We uncover unexpected insights and innovate the way P&G runs business.
A career in A&I will build your ability to influence and think strategically, across a breadth of experiences on multiple P&G business.
Your role as an Analytics & Insights Intern :
You will act as a business strategy consultant, guiding decisions of P&G management in several business domains (consumer, costumer, digital, …)
You will be part of a multi-functional business team, working closely with Marketing, Finance, Sales, R&D and others, constantly exploring new opportunities for business growth
You will combine analytical expertise and deep consumer understanding, to anticipate opportunities and answer critical business questions

You will grow your skills day-in, day-out, improving your mastery in data analytics as well as immersive in-depth research. You will have the opportunity to explore new ways to learn and to connect with internal & external guides worldwide.
Responsibilities as of Day 1 – You will be given concrete projects and feel the ownership for them from the beginning

Continuous Growth through working on real business challenges and mentoring– you will work with a team and receive both formal training as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager, ensuring your skillset will grown day in-day out.

Opportunity to work in a dynamic and respectful work environment – We live our Purpose, Values, and Principles daily. We value every individual and encourage initiatives promoting agility and work/life balance.
Strong analytical skills and Integrative thinking
Proven leadership and teamwork skills, with a “can-do” approach and an unusual skew to innovate
Ability to play a key role and influence across levels and functions.
Boundless curiosity and un-sane passion to generate results
Additional expertise/certifications on the following areas will be valued but not required:
Work experience or certification in Market Research Techniques (Quantitative or Qualitative methods)
Work experience or certification in Visualization, Data transformation tools and/or programming (Tableau, Spotfire, PowerBI , JMP, SQL, R or Python, Alteryx, KNIME, RapidMiner)
P&G is one of the world’s largest consumer goods companies and home to iconic, loved and trusted brands, such as Dash®, Gillette®, Pantene®, Oral-B®, Swiffer®, Head & Shoulders®, Braun®, Fairy®.

For over 180 years, Procter & Gamble has grown in the market and changed the way business is done, thanks to Talents. We value leadership as well as mastery and offer fulfilling career opportunities that make us an unbeatable force in our industry.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

Due to legal restrictions, immigration sponsorship is available only for EU/EFTA nationalities. All candidates with nonEU/EFTA nationalities are encouraged to check out opportunities in countries where they can obtain a work permit.

Data Scientistinternwill be in contact with each company department and consultants' teams to follow a growth path in the advanced analytics projects and become, month after month, more independent on several tasks.

Don't miss your chance to join a progressive and sustainable global company, which is constantly looking for new challenges and opportunities to grow in a competitive and tough market.
Guess promotes a people-first workspace, where their well-being and their development are part of the history and the success of the brand.
Do you think we're a good match for you? Apply now to be part of our family!

Reporting directly to the Data Office Advanced Analytic Manager, Guess sees the application of Advanced Analytic as a core source of competitive advantage in the data drive approach to different business areas, providing insights and efficiency to all the stakeholders.

Data Scientistinternwill be in contact with each company department and consultants' teams to follow a growth path in the advanced analytics projects and become, month after month, more independent on several tasks.

Core Job Responsibilities

  • Be aware of all the models currently in production after the knowledge transfer on each one
  • Data exploratory analysis to identify the best features to explain and describe a business need for a first internal discussion
  • Create a first draft of a prototype model to investigate the feasibility of a specific business request for a first internal discussion
  • Gap analysis on evolutive maintenance of an existing model in production to address change requests
  • Model tuning of an existing model in production to potentially enhance the results
  • Stay up to date on the data science field topics
  • Be autonomous in the preliminary analysis after the right training on the specific task


Requirements

TECH REQUIREMENTS

  • Student in Quantitative Sciences (Master Degree in computer science, mathematics, physics, statistics or engineering)
  • Good proficiency in Python, at least NumPy, Pandas, scikit-learn
  • Experience with database languages (e.g., SQL, NoSQL)
  • Familiarity in the following areas: Applied Data Science, Statistical and Machine / Deep Learning,
  • Skills in selecting the proper statistical/ML/AI tools given a problem is a plus
  • Good presentation and report writing skills is a plus
  • Familiarity with cloud environments and machine learning models is a plus


Soft Requirements

  • Curiosity and enthusiasm
  • Critical sensibility on the daily basis activity
  • Fluent in Italian and English
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills to share complex technical concepts to broad audiences in simplified format
  • Strong delivery focus


Benefits

  • An International, fresh and dynamic working environment
  • Balance between work and personal life: Smart Working (Hybrid work model) and Time flexibility

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

Talan est un groupe international de conseil et d’expertises technologiques qui accélère la transformation de ses clients par les leviers de l'innovation, la technologie et la data. Depuis plus de 20 ans, Talan conseille et accompagne les entreprises et les institutions publiques dans la mise en œuvre de leurs projets de transformation et d'innovation en France et à l'international.

Présent sur cinq continents, dans 18 pays, le Groupe, certifié Great Place To Work, qui comptera plus de 7200 collaborateurs fin 2024, ambitionne de réaliser un chiffre d'affaires de 850 millions d'euros cette même année et de dépasser la barre du milliard d'euros à horizon 2025.

Doté d'un Centre de recherche et d'innovation, Talan met l'innovation au cœur de son développement et intervient dans les domaines des mutations technologiques telles que l'Intelligence Artificielle, la Data Intelligence, la Blockchain, pour servir la croissance des grands groupes et des ETI dans une démarche engagée et responsable. www.talan.com
En plaçant au cœur de sa stratégie « L’innovation Positive » le Groupe Talan est convaincu que c’est en étant au service de l’humain que la technologie démultiplie son potentiel pour la société.
Concevoir et développer des rapports et dashboards dynamiques avec Looker et Power BI, adaptés aux besoins métiers
Participer à la modélisation de données, notamment à partir de modèles SAP, pour garantir la fiabilité et la cohérence des analyses
Collaborer avec des équipes pluridisciplinaires dans un environnement data-driven utilisant des technologies modernes comme Fivetran, GCP, et SAP
Assurer le suivi, la documentation et l’optimisation continue des solutions déployées
Expertise confirmée de Looker (min. 2 ans d’expérience), et très bonne maîtrise de Power BI
Connaissance des modèles de données SAP et des environnements industriels
À l’aise dans un écosystème moderne intégrant GCP, Fivetran, et des pipelines de données complexes
Esprit analytique, rigueur, et sens du travail en équipe

Talan est un groupe international de conseil et d’expertises technologiques qui accélère la transformation de ses clients par les leviers de l'innovation, la technologie et la data. Depuis plus de 20 ans, Talan conseille et accompagne les entreprises et les institutions publiques dans la mise en œuvre de leurs projets de transformation et d'innovation en France et à l'international.

Présent sur cinq continents, dans 18 pays, le Groupe, certifié Great Place To Work, qui comptera plus de 7200 collaborateurs fin 2024, ambitionne de réaliser un chiffre d'affaires de 850 millions d'euros cette même année et de dépasser la barre du milliard d'euros à horizon 2025.

Doté d'un Centre de recherche et d'innovation, Talan met l'innovation au cœur de son développement et intervient dans les domaines des mutations technologiques telles que l'Intelligence Artificielle, la Data Intelligence, la Blockchain, pour servir la croissance des grands groupes et des ETI dans une démarche engagée et responsable. www.talan.com

En plaçant au cœur de sa stratégie « L’innovation Positive » le Groupe Talan est convaincu que c’est en étant au service de l’humain que la technologie démultiplie son potentiel pour la société.

Job Description

Vos missions :


  • Concevoir et développer des rapports et dashboards dynamiques avec Looker et Power BI, adaptés aux besoins métiers



  • Participer à la modélisation de données, notamment à partir de modèles SAP, pour garantir la fiabilité et la cohérence des analyses



  • Collaborer avec des équipes pluridisciplinaires dans un environnement data-driven utilisant des technologies modernes comme Fivetran, GCP, et SAP



  • Assurer le suivi, la documentation et l’optimisation continue des solutions déployées





Qualifications

  • Expertise confirmée de Looker (min. 2 ans d’expérience), et très bonne maîtrise de Power BI



  • Connaissance des modèles de données SAP et des environnements industriels



  • À l’aise dans un écosystème moderne intégrant GCP, Fivetran, et des pipelines de données complexes



  • Esprit analytique, rigueur, et sens du travail en équipe

4208453700,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/power-bi-consultant-at-power-partners-4208453700?position=18&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=pazSRtNUVtA3vJEBVhFT5g%3D%3D,Power BI Consultant,Power Partners,"Männedorf, Zurich, Switzerland","Power Partners sucht Verstärkung – bist du dabei?
Weil wir Schweizer KMUs helfen, mehr aus ihren Daten rauszuholen – und das richtig gut.
Mit tiefem Unternehmensverständnis, klar strukturierten Power BI-Dashboards und solidem Data Engineering machen wir aus Zahlen echte Aha-Momente.
Über 50 KMUs vertrauen schon auf uns – und es werden laufend mehr.
Du wirst zum echten Sparringspartner für unsere Kunden – direkt im Gespräch mit den Entscheidern.
Dein Alltag ist abwechslungsreich, hands-on und datengetrieben:
Du analysierst Kundenbedürfnisse und bringst Struktur ins Datendickicht
Du designst und entwickelst Power BI-Dashboards & Reports – und testest sie gemeinsam mit den Kunden
Du arbeitest parallel an mehreren Projekten (10+ pro Jahr – langweilig wird dir sicher nie)
Bei kleineren Projekten übernimmst du direkt die Projektleitung
Mind. 2 Jahre Erfahrung im Daten- oder BI-Consulting (Power BI und Fabric sind ein Plus)
Du arbeitest eigenständig, denkst mit und hast Lust, dazuzulernen
Du kennst den Spagat zwischen mehreren Projekten und bleibst dabei cool
Grundlegendes BWL-Verständnis – oder zumindest Lust darauf
Erfahrung mit Azure, SQL oder Python
Kenntnisse von ERP-Systemen (z. B. Abacus, Dynamics, SAP, Odoo, etc.)
Ein faires Gehalt – ganz ohne Bullshit
Modernes Büro mit allem Drum und Dran
Viel Verantwortung, viel Freiheit, viel Raum zum Wachsen
Du bist mehr als nur „Consultant“ auf dem Papier?
Dann haben wir Spielraum für deine Talente – z. B.:
beim Verfassen von Blog-Artikeln für unsere Web-Seite (dein Personal Brand freut sich!)
bei deiner fachlichen Weiterentwicklung im Selbststudium & für Zertifizierungen
Dein Profil passt? Dann melden wir uns innerhalb von 5 Arbeitstagen für ein erstes Online-Gespräch mit einem der Gründer.
Wenn’s für beide Seiten gut aussieht, folgt ein lockeres Kennenlernen mit einem weiteren Teammitglied.
Immer noch ein Match? Dann geht's ans Eingemachte bei einer kurzen Fallstudie (2h, online oder bei uns – ohne Vorbereitung).
Jetzt wird’s konkret: Wir besprechen Rolle, Gehalt & Ziele.
Handshake? Let’s go – du startest bei Power Partners durch!
Klingt spannend? Dann bewirb dich – wir freuen uns auf dich!

Power Partners sucht Verstärkung – bist du dabei?


Warum eigentlich wir?

Weil wir Schweizer KMUs helfen, mehr aus ihren Daten rauszuholen – und das richtig gut.

Mit tiefem Unternehmensverständnis, klar strukturierten Power BI-Dashboards und solidem Data Engineering machen wir aus Zahlen echte Aha-Momente.

Über 50 KMUs vertrauen schon auf uns – und es werden laufend mehr.

Deshalb brauchen wir dich!


Deine Rolle bei uns

Du wirst zum echten Sparringspartner für unsere Kunden – direkt im Gespräch mit den Entscheidern.

Dein Alltag ist abwechslungsreich, hands-on und datengetrieben:

  • Du analysierst Kundenbedürfnisse und bringst Struktur ins Datendickicht
  • Du designst und entwickelst Power BI-Dashboards &
column2:
Reports – und testest sie gemeinsam mit den Kunden
  • Du arbeitest parallel an mehreren Projekten (10+ pro Jahr – langweilig wird dir sicher nie)
  • Bei kleineren Projekten übernimmst du direkt die Projektleitung


    • Was du mitbringen solltest

    • Mind. 2 Jahre Erfahrung im Daten- oder BI-Consulting (Power BI und Fabric sind ein Plus)
    • Deutsch auf Muttersprachniveau, Englisch verhandlungssicher
    • Du arbeitest eigenständig, denkst mit und hast Lust, dazuzulernen
    • Du kennst den Spagat zwischen mehreren Projekten und bleibst dabei cool
    • Grundlegendes BWL-Verständnis – oder zumindest Lust darauf

    Nice to have:

    • Erfahrung mit Azure, SQL oder Python
    • Kenntnisse von ERP-Systemen (z. B. Abacus, Dynamics, SAP, Odoo, etc.)
    • Französisch? Nice ... äh sympa!


    Was du von uns bekommst

    • Ein faires Gehalt – ganz ohne Bullshit
    • Flexible Arbeitszeiten
    • Modernes Büro mit allem Drum und Dran
    • Anspruchsvolle Projekte &
column3:
direkter Kundenkontakt
  • Viel Verantwortung, viel Freiheit, viel Raum zum Wachsen


    • ...but wait, there's more!

    Du bist mehr als nur „Consultant“ auf dem Papier?

    Dann haben wir Spielraum für deine Talente – z. B.:

    • bei der Organisation von Community-Events
    • beim Verfassen von Blog-Artikeln für unsere Web-Seite (dein Personal Brand freut sich!)
    • bei deiner fachlichen Weiterentwicklung im Selbststudium &
column4:
für Zertifizierungen


Unser Bewerbungsprozess (aka ""The Happy Flow""):

  1. Dein Profil passt? Dann melden wir uns innerhalb von 5 Arbeitstagen für ein erstes Online-Gespräch mit einem der Gründer.
  2. Wenn’s für beide Seiten gut aussieht, folgt ein lockeres Kennenlernen mit einem weiteren Teammitglied.
  3. Immer noch ein Match? Dann geht's ans Eingemachte bei einer kurzen Fallstudie (2h, online oder bei uns – ohne Vorbereitung).
  4. Jetzt wird’s konkret: Wir besprechen Rolle, Gehalt &
column5:
Ziele.
  • Handshake? Let’s go – du startest bei Power Partners durch!


    • Klingt spannend? Dann bewirb dich – wir freuen uns auf dich!

Vous êtes actuellement en cours de formation dans une université/haute école dans le domaine Informatique / Finance et recherchez un stage pour valider votre cursus (avec convention de stage).
Concevoir et développer des dashboards interactifs sur Power BI afin d’optimiser le suivi de l’activité.
Automatiser des workflows et optimiser les flux de données via des solutions no-code.
Collaborer avec les gestionnaires de portefeuille pour comprendre leurs besoins en reporting et en analyse.
Assurer la qualité des données et l’ergonomie des interfaces développées.
Vous êtes actuellement étudiant(e) en Informatique, Data Science, Finance, ou tout autre domaine pertinent.
Capacité à comprendre les enjeux financiers et à traduire les besoins métiers en solutions BI.
Maîtrise de Power BI : création de tableaux de bord, DAX, gestion des sources de données.
Sens du design et de l’expérience utilisateur (UX/UI).
La connaissance de Power Apps est un plus.
Une expérience (stage, projets scolaires/personnels) dans un domaine similaire est requise.

Job Description

Vous êtes actuellement en cours de formation dans une université/haute école dans le domaine Informatique / Finance et recherchez un stage pour valider votre cursus (avec convention de stage).

MISSIONS


  • Concevoir et développer des dashboards interactifs sur Power BI afin d’optimiser le suivi de l’activité.
  • Automatiser des workflows et optimiser les flux de données via des solutions no-code.
  • Collaborer avec les gestionnaires de portefeuille pour comprendre leurs besoins en reporting et en analyse.
  • Assurer la qualité des données et l’ergonomie des interfaces développées.


PROFIL


  • Vous êtes actuellement étudiant(e) en Informatique, Data Science, Finance, ou tout autre domaine pertinent.
  • Capacité à comprendre les enjeux financiers et à traduire les besoins métiers en solutions BI.
  • Maîtrise de Power BI : création de tableaux de bord, DAX, gestion des sources de données.
  • Sens du design et de l’expérience utilisateur (UX/UI).
  • La connaissance de Power Apps est un plus.
  • Une expérience (stage, projets scolaires/personnels) dans un domaine similaire est requise.
  • Autonomie, rigueur et esprit analytique.

4195940984,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/online-data-analyst-at-telus-digital-4195940984?position=21&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=3ahL1F2TWhWw%2BoXx4ha0DA%3D%3D,Online Data Analyst,TELUS Digital,"Schwyz, Switzerland","Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Werde Teil eines traditionsreichen Familienunternehmens, das Innovation grossschreibt und Kundenorientierung lebt. Gemeinsam arbeiten wir an wegweisenden Lösungen und schaffen nachhaltigen Mehrwert – für unsere Kunden, für dich und für die Zukunft.

165 Mitarbeiter und Mitarbeiterinnen schweizweit. Über 36.000 Artikel für das Bau- und Kfz-Handwerk. Professionelle Beratung und individueller Service mit über 50 Jahren Erfahrung. Aber hinter der Marke BERNER steckt etwas noch viel Wertvolleres: ein Familienunternehmen mit ebenso viel Herz wie Verstand.

4198568924,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/quantitative-analyst-at-charles-levick-limited-4198568924?position=23&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=qNgqRY%2F7qxSZxDPBcZ1qcg%3D%3D,Quantitative Analyst,Charles Levick Limited,"Geneva, Switzerland","Quantitative Analyst – Market Risk & Valuation

A leading commodities firm is looking for a skilled Quantitative Analyst to strengthen its Trading Risk & Quant Analytics Team. This role focuses on XVA pricing methodologies and supporting the development of a Quant Library, offering a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.
Strong grasp of derivatives pricing and risk concepts.
Proficiency in Python programming (knowledge of C++ or other languages is beneficial).
Strong ability to collaborate across different teams and functions.
Quick adaptability to new ideas and problem-solving approaches.
Experience in delivering optimised and well-structured code.
Designing and refining quantitative models and analytical tools.
Working closely with teams across the business, including Trading, Middle Office, Risk, Credit, and Technology.
Evaluating XVA-related risks associated with new transactions.
A Master’s degree or higher in a numerical field such as Mathematics, Engineering, Physics, Science, or Finance.
A minimum of 3 years’ experience in an XVA quant role - ideally within commodities (including CVA/FVA), though experience in rates or FX will also be considered.
Proven ability to write robust, production-level code using best practices (source control, CI/CD pipelines, unit/regression testing).
Direct interaction with Trading, Risk, Credit, Middle Office, and IT teams.
Reports to the XVA Lead covering energy and commodity trading.

column2:
Valuation


A leading commodities firm is looking for a skilled Quantitative Analyst to strengthen its Trading Risk &
column3:
Quant Analytics Team. This role focuses on XVA pricing methodologies and supporting the development of a Quant Library, offering a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.


What You’ll Need:

  • Advanced analytical and mathematical capabilities.
  • Strong grasp of derivatives pricing and risk concepts.
  • Proficiency in Python programming (knowledge of C++ or other languages is beneficial).
  • Strong ability to collaborate across different teams and functions.
  • Quick adaptability to new ideas and problem-solving approaches.
  • Experience in delivering optimised and well-structured code.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Designing and refining quantitative models and analytical tools.
  • Working closely with teams across the business, including Trading, Middle Office, Risk, Credit, and Technology.
  • Evaluating XVA-related risks associated with new transactions.


Your Background:

  • A Master’s degree or higher in a numerical field such as Mathematics, Engineering, Physics, Science, or Finance.
  • A minimum of 3 years’ experience in an XVA quant role - ideally within commodities (including CVA/FVA), though experience in rates or FX will also be considered.
  • Proven ability to write robust, production-level code using best practices (source control, CI/CD pipelines, unit/regression testing).


Who You’ll Work With:

  • Direct interaction with Trading, Risk, Credit, Middle Office, and IT teams.
  • Reports to the XVA Lead covering energy and commodity trading.

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protection in the building sector and industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika’s around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.
For our Web- & eCommerce Team we are looking for an additional member, who can be a full-time intern as well as staying with us longer term as a part-time working student.
As we have multiple different projects, we are able to offer interesting topics for students who are looking to gain some experience in fields such as
column2: data science and data engineering, business analysis, and other technical fields in order to create business applications and automate processes.

Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika’s around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.

For our Web- &
column2:

column3:
data science and data engineering, business analysis, and other technical fields in order to create business applications and automate processes.

4209613943,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/vie-data-analyst-suisse-f-h-x-at-canal%2B-group-4209613943?position=25&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=buEap%2FLN24CmieLw6lmxZQ%3D%3D,VIE - DATA ANALYST SUISSE - (F/H/X),CANAL+ Group,"Lausanne, Vaud, Switzerland","

💻 Les équipes de CANAL+ Suisse ? Situé à Lausanne, CANAL+ Suisse distribue ses offres de télévision payante sur le territoire suisse et gère le développement B2C (en direct avec ses offres SAT et OTT ou via les partenariats telco), B2B, et la commercialisation des espaces publicitaires Suisses. CANAL+ Suisse travaille en étroite collaboration avec les équipes françaises mais également les équipes des autres pays d’Europe dont le siège est au Luxembourg.

En tant que Data Analyst, vous serez responsable de l’analyse et de l’exploitation des données pour optimiser la performance des activités de l’entreprise. Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec un autre Data Analyst afin de transformer les données en insights stratégiques et opérationnels. Vous jouerez un rôle clé dans le suivi des objectifs, dans l’aide à la décision. Vous serez rattaché / rrattachée au Responsable PROJET & DATA de CANAL+ Suisse.
Suivi statistique mensuel des KPIs suivants : portefeuille abonnés, ventes, résiliations, usage des abonnés et comparer les performances réelles vs objectifs.
Travailler les atterrissages et prévisions avec le contrôle de gestion et les services en interne suisse (Marketing, Opérations, Service Client, Projets).
Analyse de performance des opérations et projets : interpréter les tendances et formuler des recommandations pour améliorer les résultats.
Organiser et animer des comités internes pour partager les analyses et suivre les plans d’actions.
Reporting et Visualisation : concevoir des tableaux de bord et des rapports automatisés en utilisant des outils comme Power BI pour faciliter la prise de décision.
Segmentation Client : identifier et segmenter les populations clients en utilisant des bases de données et des triggers, à déterminer en collaboration avec les services marketing.

Contribution dans les projets techniques en lien avec la data : En collaboration avec les différents services BI et DATA, contribuer aux avancées de projets data tels que la mise en place d’un DATALAKE, l’optimisation des outils de Marketing Automation, et la construction de modèle de prédiction de comportement clients.
🏆 Et si on parlait de vous ?
Diplôme BAC+5 spécialisé en BigData, Statistiques, Informatique, ou domaine équivalent.
Connaissance des stratégies marketing et CRM serait un plus.
Maitrise d’un outil de visualisation : Power BI en priorité (Tableau en backup).
Maîtrise des outils d'analyse de données : SQL en priorité. La maîtrise d'un autre langage information type Python ou R est un plus.
Expertise Excel : Gestion de macros, langage VBA, VLookup, Tableau croisé dynamique, illustrations graphiques…
Une expérience avec la plateforme Power Automate est nécessaire.
Des connaissances sur les plateformes Dataiku et Snowflake sont un atout supplémentaire.
Compétences en communication et capacité à vulgariser des analyses complexes.
Agilité et Adaptation au Changement : être flexible et réactif face aux évolutions et aux nouveaux défis.
Environnement dynamique avec des projets innovants.
Mix Travail en présentiel et Télétravail.
Compte CANAL+ collaborateur offert le temps de la mission.

En tant que média, producteur et distributeur de contenus, le Groupe CANAL+ a une responsabilité particulière. En interne ou à l’écran, nous soutenons une création ambitieuse, inclusive et respectueuse des limites planétaires.
👊 On agit pour l’égalité entre les femmes et les hommes, contre toute forme de discrimination ou harcèlement
🤝 On agit pour l’égalité des chances et l’inclusion de tous et toutes
🌍 On agit pour réduire notre impact environnemental et éco-concevoir nos produits
Si vous voyez cette annonce, c’est que vous avez votre chance et que nous n’avons pas encore trouvé la perle rare!

4195947186,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/online-data-analyst-at-telus-digital-4195947186?position=27&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=ngsuuEiZDthr%2B0t%2BiRrVCw%3D%3D,Online Data Analyst,TELUS Digital,"Zurich, Switzerland","Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

  • In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
  • Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.

  • Full Professional Proficiency in English &

4192741878,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/power-bi-plattform-specialist-at-swiss-post-4192741878?position=29&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=Hb2QPGTa4tfBLhWJyIZXOw%3D%3D,Power BI Plattform Specialist,Swiss Post,Lausanne Metropolitan Area,"80-100 %, Lausanne und Homeoffice

Do you love data analysis, visualization and sharing your knowledge? Then join our team and make a difference! Your expertise helps us to drive digitization – with modern BI solutions, efficient processes and robust platforms.
As a Power BI Specialist, you take Swiss Post to the next level with data analysis and visualization, you bring your knowledge to the organization, and you empower staff to work with BI tools.
You are part of our Business Intelligence solutions team, where you develop and stabilize the BI platforms, define framework conditions and ensure compliance with processes and governance guidelines.

As the driving force, you work with the Self-service team to steer Swiss Post's transformation into a data-driven company and empower staff through training and learning paths across the specialist units.

You contribute your expertise towards business analysis, consulting and the implementation of complex requirements, and you optimize BI reports and dashboards so they run smoothly and provide a basis for making data-driven decisions.
You coordinate with stakeholders, simplify processes and improve efficiency across the units.
Additionally, you work closely with data scientists and data engineers, and you also coordinate and empower internal and external staff.
You promote exchange of knowledge within the team and ensure that requests are processed efficiently.
You have a university degree in informatics or business informatics as well as several years of professional experience.
You have excellent knowledge of Power BI and Microsoft Fabric, including data integration, dashboard creation and scripting.
You have experience designing and managing complex IT landscapes, including the implementation of security and governance guidelines.
Your strengths include creating complex data models and transforming data from various sources.
Additional knowledge of other tools such as SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP Datasphere, BusinessObjects and AWS round off your profile.
Your ability to communicate clearly and concisely with stakeholders allows you to convey complex information in an intelligible way and develop solutions together.
As a team player, you have a good spoken and written command of German and English. Knowledge of another national language is a plus.
Anna Rensch People & Transformation Lead – Logistics Services Telephone +41772679069
CHF 116'400 - 131'400 Effective salary may differ from this salary range depending on experience and skills

As the driving force behind digitization, the Informatics/Technology function unit has an influence on the whole of Swiss Post and is an important partner in its success. We go beyond core IT tasks and empower the company in its digital transformation. We use the latest technologies and work to advance agile, bimodal and embedded IT innovations. We develop new, secure business models and ensure that Swiss Post has a modern, high-performing ICT infrastructure. In addition, we are committed to the issue of sustainability: our headquarters in Bern have been awarded two certificates for sustainability. All newly built logistics centers meet the Gold sustainability standard at a minimum.

80-100 %, Lausanne und Homeoffice

Do you love data analysis, visualization and sharing your knowledge? Then join our team and make a difference! Your expertise helps us to drive digitization – with modern BI solutions, efficient processes and robust platforms.

How You Make a Difference

  • As a Power BI Specialist, you take Swiss Post to the next level with data analysis and visualization, you bring your knowledge to the organization, and you empower staff to work with BI tools.
  • You are part of our Business Intelligence solutions team, where you develop and stabilize the BI platforms, define framework conditions and ensure compliance with processes and governance guidelines. 
  • As the driving force, you work with the Self-service team to steer Swiss Post's transformation into a data-driven company and empower staff through training and learning paths across the specialist units.
  • You contribute your expertise towards business analysis, consulting and the implementation of complex requirements, and you optimize BI reports and dashboards so they run smoothly and provide a basis for making data-driven decisions. 
  • You coordinate with stakeholders, simplify processes and improve efficiency across the units.
  • Additionally, you work closely with data scientists and data engineers, and you also coordinate and empower internal and external staff.
  • You promote exchange of knowledge within the team and ensure that requests are processed efficiently.


What You Have To Offer

  • You have a university degree in informatics or business informatics as well as several years of professional experience.
  • You have excellent knowledge of Power BI and Microsoft Fabric, including data integration, dashboard creation and scripting.
  • You have experience designing and managing complex IT landscapes, including the implementation of security and governance guidelines.
  • Your strengths include creating complex data models and transforming data from various sources.
  • Additional knowledge of other tools such as SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP Datasphere, BusinessObjects and AWS round off your profile.
  • Your ability to communicate clearly and concisely with stakeholders allows you to convey complex information in an intelligible way and develop solutions together.
  • As a team player, you have a good spoken and written command of German and English. Knowledge of another national language is a plus.


What We Have To Offer

  • 6 weeks' holiday
  • Parental Leave
  • Staff vouchers
  • Workation (IT)


Contact

Anna Rensch People &

At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

  • In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
  • Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.



Qualification Path


No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.


Basic Requirements

  • Full Professional Proficiency in English &
column2:
German language
  • Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
  • Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
  • Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
  • Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software


    • Assessment

    In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

4197971788,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/digital-analytics-intern-6-months-at-swiss-re-4197971788?position=31&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=NWTcSO9NSeARsHH3p2mMRw%3D%3D,Digital Analytics Intern (6 months),Swiss Re,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Are you ready to dive into a dynamic, multicultural team at the forefront of Specialty Underwriting in Zurich? At Swiss Re’s Digital Business unit, you'll collaborate with top experts across underwriting, product, and technology—driving innovation and shaping the future of our Specialty business. If you thrive in a fast-paced, global environment where teamwork fuels success, this is the opportunity for you!

The future is digital and data-driven! As we support and accelerate our clients' efforts to digitize and automate their operations, market trends and new capabilities will shape our strategy on digital analytics offerings. Your role will be pivotal in this transformation by reviewing these trends and developments and help shape our approach going forward:
Identify the main providers of analytic services to insurers and their product ranges through a market scan
Outline the main analytics use-cases of underwriting today, based on this market scan
Explore analytics trends in underwriting and the likely use-cases of the future
Evaluate the internal capabilities (today, and potential) to compare against the analytics trends
Test the findings with targeted questions to selected clients, to understand commercial attractiveness
Propose a framework to compare the intersection of analytics trends, our capabilities and client interest, to shape our strategic investment roadmap.
The internship will be for 6 months, starting in June 2025 in Zurich.

Speciality is a diverse team of problem solvers driven by passion and powered by knowledge. With over 200 underwriters across 10+ offices, our team combines Swiss Re's dedicated Specialty lines of business in the Reinsurance P&C business unit. We are Agriculture, Aviation, Credit & Surety, Cyber, Engineering and Marine & Energy. Our purpose is to make today's and tomorrow's complex risks more accessible and lead Swiss Re's innovation and sustainability ambitions.

We are looking for a brilliant critical thinker who is naturally detail-oriented and possesses strong interpersonal skills. Your flexibility and curiosity enable you to learn new skills quickly. Ideal candidates will have:
Master student in actuarial science, mathematics, statistics or engineering.
Excellent organisational skills and self-starter demeanour.
Proficiency in statistic software as well as Microsoft Office.
Eagerness to learn and adapt to dynamic insurance industry requirements.
Team player who thrives in an international work environment.
Excellent oral and written English. Other languages are a plus.
We are looking forward to your application! Good luck!

Due to immigration regulations non-EU/EFTA and UK citizens must provide a certificate from a Swiss university confirming that an internship is integral to their course of study. Kindly submit the mandatory letter from your University with your application documents
We provide feedback to all candidates via email. If you have not heard back from us, please check your spam folder.

Swiss Re is one of the world’s leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. We cover both Property & Casualty and Life & Health. Combining experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise, we create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 14,000 employees across the world.

Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. We embrace a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work and their passion for sustainability.
If you are an experienced professional returning to the workforce after a career break, we encourage you to apply for open positions that match your skills and experience.

Are you ready to dive into a dynamic, multicultural team at the forefront of Specialty Underwriting in Zurich? At Swiss Re’s Digital Business unit, you'll collaborate with top experts across underwriting, product, and technology—driving innovation and shaping the future of our Specialty business. If you thrive in a fast-paced, global environment where teamwork fuels success, this is the opportunity for you!

About The Role

The future is digital and data-driven! As we support and accelerate our clients' efforts to digitize and automate their operations, market trends and new capabilities will shape our strategy on digital analytics offerings. Your role will be pivotal in this transformation by reviewing these trends and developments and help shape our approach going forward:

  • Identify the main providers of analytic services to insurers and their product ranges through a market scan
  • Outline the main analytics use-cases of underwriting today, based on this market scan
  • Explore analytics trends in underwriting and the likely use-cases of the future
  • Evaluate the internal capabilities (today, and potential) to compare against the analytics trends
  • Test the findings with targeted questions to selected clients, to understand commercial attractiveness
  • Propose a framework to compare the intersection of analytics trends, our capabilities and client interest, to shape our strategic investment roadmap.

The internship will be for 6 months, starting in June 2025 in Zurich.

Speciality is a diverse team of problem solvers driven by passion and powered by knowledge. With over 200 underwriters across 10+ offices, our team combines Swiss Re's dedicated Specialty lines of business in the Reinsurance P&

MS Reinsurance is a global reinsurer domiciled in Switzerland with underwriting offices in Zurich, Bermuda, Miami, and New York. The Company underwrites non-life treaty reinsurance solutions on a worldwide basis through its three business units: Americas, International, and Specialty Lines. As part of the world-leading insurance group MS&AD, MS Reinsurance combines reliability and agility to make its clients’ businesses stronger. With a drive to move quickly and a commitment to long term partnership, MS Reinsurance supports its partners with the momentum and stability they can build on.

In this role, you will support the Analytics team in overseeing the MS Reinsurance underwriting portfolio through the Performance Management Framework. You will analyze internal data and external market insights to assess and refine underwriting strategies across various segments, providing both challenge and support to drive informed decision-making.
Organizing and preparing analysis for annual portfolio reviews.
Assessing underwriting performance across MS Reinsurance, collaborating with key teams to identify risks and opportunities.
Researching market data to benchmark MS Re’s portfolio and refine strategy.
Monitoring key performance indicators and communicating insights to underwriting teams.
Evaluating pricing, exposure management, and business plan adherence.
Attending reserving meetings to assess loss projections and reserve adequacy.
Developing analytical tools and collaborating with the Data team for reporting consistency.
Preparing reports for executive committee meetings.
University degree in mathematics, actuarial science, or related field
Knowledge of insurance/reinsurance and actuarial principles

column2: Power BI preferred

column1: Strong analytical skills and application to (re)insurance
Effective communicator with a collaborative mindset
Ability to work independently and manage priorities
Nearly/newly qualified in actuarial studies or data science preferred
Experience in insurance, ideally reinsurance, within actuarial or analytics teams

We offer a modern workplace, an entrepreneurial culture with room for innovation and a hybrid work model. Collaboration, Empowerment and Responsibilities are key values we live on a day-to-day basis. You will be part of a hands-on culture where you really can make an impact. We place mutual trust at the forefront of our collaboration and path to growth.
Note that we will only consider applicants eligible to work in Switzerland.
In case of questions, please contact us via email: careers@msreinsurance.com

MS Reinsurance is the market-facing brand of the risk carrying legal entity MS Amlin AG, a global reinsurer domiciled in Switzerland and operating in Bermuda as MS Amlin AG, Bermuda Branch, in the United States through MS Amlin Reinsurance Managers, Inc, and in Labuan, Malaysia as MS Amlin AG, Labuan Branch.

4211406084,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-quantitative-analyst-power-gas-at-vallum-associates-4211406084?position=35&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=FFu8WH9ZC4AU1sPFzPqOrg%3D%3D,Senior Quantitative Analyst - Power & Gas,Vallum Associates,"Geneva, Switzerland","Senior Quantitative Analyst - Power & Gas Markets

Our client is looking for an experienced Quantitative Analyst to join their dynamic energy trading and analytics team in Geneva, Switzerland. This role combines market expertise with quantitative skills to drive power and gas market strategies forward.

Our client is a leading expert in the energy markets, providing critical analysis, forecasting, and modelling services. Their work supports key stakeholders in navigating the energy transition while identifying valuable investment opportunities in sustainable energy systems.

As a Senior Quantitative Analyst, you will apply sophisticated quantitative methods to model European power and gas markets, create price scenarios, and develop actionable insights for trading desks and clients.
Model fundamental power and gas markets using proprietary systems and data analysis
Design and integrate new datasets to enhance trading strategies
Support trading desks in utilizing data for production systems
Develop and improve analytical products and methodologies
Manage data sourcing projects from acquisition through production
Communicate insights to clients and internal stakeholders
Collaborate with research and consulting teams
Degree in a technical or quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Data Science, or Economics)
Minimum 3 years of experience in quantitative analysis, data engineering, or similar roles
Strong programming skills in Python and familiarity with data analysis packages
Understanding of European energy markets and trading dynamics
Experience with financial data platforms is advantageous
Ability to work independently while collaborating in a global team environment
Excellent analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities

column2: German proficiency is a plus

column1: An opportunity to join a team at the forefront of the energy transition, where your analytical expertise will contribute to sustainable market solutions while generating value for their clients and stakeholders.
For a confidential discussion about this exciting opportunity in Geneva, please submit your application with a detailed CV.

column2:
Gas Markets


Location: Geneva, Switzerland


Our client is looking for an experienced Quantitative Analyst to join their dynamic energy trading and analytics team in Geneva, Switzerland. This role combines market expertise with quantitative skills to drive power and gas market strategies forward.


About Our Client

Our client is a leading expert in the energy markets, providing critical analysis, forecasting, and modelling services. Their work supports key stakeholders in navigating the energy transition while identifying valuable investment opportunities in sustainable energy systems.


The Role

As a Senior Quantitative Analyst, you will apply sophisticated quantitative methods to model European power and gas markets, create price scenarios, and develop actionable insights for trading desks and clients.


Key Responsibilities

  • Model fundamental power and gas markets using proprietary systems and data analysis
  • Design and integrate new datasets to enhance trading strategies
  • Support trading desks in utilizing data for production systems
  • Develop and improve analytical products and methodologies
  • Manage data sourcing projects from acquisition through production
  • Communicate insights to clients and internal stakeholders
  • Collaborate with research and consulting teams


Required Qualifications

  • Degree in a technical or quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Data Science, or Economics)
  • Minimum 3 years of experience in quantitative analysis, data engineering, or similar roles
  • Strong programming skills in Python and familiarity with data analysis packages
  • Understanding of European energy markets and trading dynamics
  • Experience with financial data platforms is advantageous
  • Ability to work independently while collaborating in a global team environment
  • Excellent analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities
  • Strong communication skills in English
column3:
German proficiency is a plus


What Our Client Offers


An opportunity to join a team at the forefront of the energy transition, where your analytical expertise will contribute to sustainable market solutions while generating value for their clients and stakeholders.


For a confidential discussion about this exciting opportunity in Geneva, please submit your application with a detailed CV.

Dans un contexte d'accélération technologique sans précédent, nous sommes le partenaire de confiance des entreprises qui innovent. Nous les aidons à développer un avantage compétitif et à améliorer le quotidien de millions de personnes.
Intégrer Expleo Switzerland, C’est 19 000 Collaborateurs, Dans 30 Pays, Avec €1.4Md De CA En 2024, Mais Également
Avoir un accompagnement technique et humain à chaque projet et un suivi performant de votre carrière
Réaliser des formations pour développer ses capacités professionnelles
Participer à des événements spéciaux dédiés

Pour accompagner notre développement en Suisse, nous recherchons un Data Analyst (H/F) dont la mission principale sera de récolter, analyser et interpréter des données de gestion (supply chain) d’un site de production industriel.
Participer aux projets d’amélioration du site en définissant des indicateurs de performance pertinents.
Extraire, traiter et analyser des données provenant de sources variées (ERP, PLM, MES, LES, équipements).
Traduire les besoins métier en problématiques analytiques et restituer les résultats de manière claire via des outils de data visualisation.
Collaborer avec les équipes IT pour automatiser les flux de données.
Assurer une veille sur les technologies et méthodologies d’analyse de données.
Diplôme HES/EPF en Data, informatique ou domaine équivalent.
Maîtrise des outils d’analyse (Python, SQL, Dataiku, Tableau Prep, Snowflake) et de visualisation (Tableau).
Esprit d’analyse, rigueur, autonomie et capacité à vulgariser des sujets complexes.
Excellentes compétences relationnelles, sens de l’écoute et aisance à communiquer à tous les niveaux.
Seules les candidatures des citoyens suisses et de l'UE seront prises en compte / Nos postes sont accessibles aux personnes en situation de handicap / Télétravail possible

Expleo propose une offre unique de services intégrés d'ingénierie, qualité et conseil stratégique pour la transformation digitale. Dans un contexte d'accélération technologique sans précédent, nous sommes le partenaire de confiance des entreprises qui innovent. Nous les aidons à développer un avantage compétitif et à améliorer le quotidien de millions de personnes.

Intégrer Expleo Switzerland, C’est 19 000 Collaborateurs, Dans 30 Pays, Avec €1.4Md De CA En 2024, Mais Également

  • Avoir un accompagnement technique et humain à chaque projet et un suivi performant de votre carrière
  • Réaliser des formations pour développer ses capacités professionnelles
  • Participer à des événements spéciaux dédiés
  • Intégrer une équipe dynamique

Data Analyst (H/F)

Pour accompagner notre développement en Suisse, nous recherchons un Data Analyst (H/F) dont la mission principale sera de récolter, analyser et interpréter des données de gestion (supply chain) d’un site de production industriel.

Missions

  • Participer aux projets d’amélioration du site en définissant des indicateurs de performance pertinents.
  • Extraire, traiter et analyser des données provenant de sources variées (ERP, PLM, MES, LES, équipements).
  • Traduire les besoins métier en problématiques analytiques et restituer les résultats de manière claire via des outils de data visualisation.
  • Collaborer avec les équipes IT pour automatiser les flux de données.
  • Assurer une veille sur les technologies et méthodologies d’analyse de données.

Profil Recherché

  • Diplôme HES/EPF en Data, informatique ou domaine équivalent.
  • Maîtrise des outils d’analyse (Python, SQL, Dataiku, Tableau Prep, Snowflake) et de visualisation (Tableau).
  • Esprit d’analyse, rigueur, autonomie et capacité à vulgariser des sujets complexes.
  • Excellentes compétences relationnelles, sens de l’écoute et aisance à communiquer à tous les niveaux.

Seules les candidatures des citoyens suisses et de l'UE seront prises en compte / Nos postes sont accessibles aux personnes en situation de handicap / Télétravail possible

We are always looking for talented professionals in software development, DevOps, cloud engineering and UX/UI Design. If you believe you have the right skills and mindset but don’t see a position that fits your profile, we encourage you to apply.

Top-tier work tools (MacBook Pro, IDEs of choice, ergonomic workspace).
Access to tech conferences, training, and personal development budget.
A growing library of tech books – if we don’t have it, we’ll get it.
Team events, hackathons, meetups, and fun activities supported by WellD.
