If you are interested, apply now and tell us why you would be a great fit.

About WellD

WellD is a fast-growing company specializing in custom software product development, with a strong focus on state-of-the-art technologies. We are a team of passionate and highly qualified developers and engineers who value curiosity, technology, and an analytical mindset over specific skill sets.

We are always looking for talented professionals in software development, DevOps, cloud engineering and UX/UI Design. If you believe you have the right skills and mindset but don’t see a position that fits your profile, we encourage you to apply.

What We Offer

  • Full-time permanent contract with competitive Swiss salaries.
  • Top-tier work tools (MacBook Pro, IDEs of choice, ergonomic workspace).
  • Discounted Swiss public transport passes.
  • Access to tech conferences, training, and personal development budget.
  • A growing library of tech books – if we don’t have it, we’ll get it.
  • Team events, hackathons, meetups, and fun activities supported by WellD.
  • Unlimited free coffee and company gadgets.

Who Can Apply

This position is open to Swiss citizens, residents, or Schengen EU citizens. Italian and English proficiency is required.

If you are interested, apply now and tell us why you would be a great fit.

4195942768,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/online-data-analyst-at-telus-digital-4195942768?position=41&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=LHkAZ1%2Bdqt5FpR5%2F%2BBRe4w%3D%3D,Online Data Analyst,TELUS Digital,"Montreux, Vaud, Switzerland","Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

4195831831,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-analyst-consultant-artificial-intelligence-data-data-management-data-platforms-focus-at-deloitte-4195831831?position=43&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=nP7yacmPZdiZ1qtAZFY1WA%3D%3D,Business Analyst / Consultant - Artificial Intelligence & Data - (Data Management & Data Platforms focus),Deloitte,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Job Description
Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making.

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.
For this role, we are currently offering start dates from February 2025.
How You Can Make An Impact
Design and implement modern data solutions in the areas of data management (e.g. data quality, master and reference data, catalogues, data platforms) that deliver high-quality, usable data
Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars.

Design complex data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations, which have significant organizational implications.
Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally.
Support business development opportunities to generate new projects.
Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence.
Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent.
Passionate individuals looking to make a career in AI & Data space.
Drive to learn new topics and master them
Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently.
Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations.
Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems.
Business-IT Translator: Ability to act as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions.
Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops
First practical experience with Data management or Data Platform solutions is highly recommended.

column2: fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders.

column1: First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields.
Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous.

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data – how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .
We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on “apply now” to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.
If you have any questions, please contact Julia at talent@deloitte.ch

We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria
column2: don’t hold yourself back – apply today.

4196536359,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analyst-cloud-data-ai-all-genders-at-valantic-4196536359?position=44&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=W9TUfkI0uxfdt6XRcc40HA%3D%3D,Analyst Cloud Data & AI (all genders),valantic,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Effective Field
As an Analyst in Cloud Data & AI, you are part of an innovative team in Zurich that is shaping the future of cloud solutions and AI technologies.
You support the development and implementation of tailored Data & AI solutions that help our clients optimize their processes and gain new insights.
Your creative ideas are in demand when it comes to transforming complex data into clear, action-oriented insights.
You work with modern cloud environments, such as AWS and Azure, and have the opportunity to participate in exciting projects that deepen your knowledge.
With your assistance in data visualization, we enable our clients to understand the stories behind their data.
You are passionate about the world of technology and hold a University degree in computer science, business informatics, or a similar field.
With profound experience in programming, preferably in Python or Java, as well as knowledge of cloud technologies such as AWS, you make the difference.
You are curious about AI solutions, enjoy developing innovative software, and have a high affinity for IT.
Your structured and careful approach to designing solutions sets you apart.
Your strong team spirit and trustworthy personality make you a valued team member.
You will become part of a community that values appreciation and support, and looks forward to shaping your path together.
Our modern valantic office in Zurich offers a comfortable atmosphere with lots of fun.
An environment where you can bring your own ideas and experience growth.
Flexible working hours and the possibility for home office, which allow you to optimally combine your practical experience with your career.
Insights into leading digital cloud & AI projects that expand your expertise and promote your development.
Diverse opportunities for networking and collaboration with experienced colleagues and mentors who share your passion for technology.

Effective Field

  • As an Analyst in Cloud Data &
column2:
AI, you are part of an innovative team in Zurich that is shaping the future of cloud solutions and AI technologies.

column3:
AI solutions that help our clients optimize their processes and gain new insights.
  • Your creative ideas are in demand when it comes to transforming complex data into clear, action-oriented insights.
  • You work with modern cloud environments, such as AWS and Azure, and have the opportunity to participate in exciting projects that deepen your knowledge.
  • With your assistance in data visualization, we enable our clients to understand the stories behind their data.

    • What distinguishes you

    • You are passionate about the world of technology and hold a University degree in computer science, business informatics, or a similar field.
    • With profound experience in programming, preferably in Python or Java, as well as knowledge of cloud technologies such as AWS, you make the difference.
    • You are curious about AI solutions, enjoy developing innovative software, and have a high affinity for IT.
    • Your structured and careful approach to designing solutions sets you apart.
    • Your strong team spirit and trustworthy personality make you a valued team member.
    • You speak fluent English.

4195946155,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/online-data-analyst-at-telus-digital-4195946155?position=46&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=p58zT9QjH%2F3VRjhbl91oCQ%3D%3D,Online Data Analyst,TELUS Digital,"Winterthur, Zurich, Switzerland","Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

4211331961,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/quantitative-researcher-at-anson-mccade-4211331961?position=49&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=%2F15Bg8bAdnwVvE%2FPiJ5LDw%3D%3D,Quantitative Researcher,Anson McCade,"Zurich, Switzerland","Systematic Quantitative Researcher - Entry/Junior Level - London/Paris/Zurich Office Locations

My client is a leading quantitative hedge fund with offices across Europe, North America and Asia. Their teams trade all traditional asset classes and cover a mix of MM/HFT, Stat Arb, Quant Macro, and Event-Driven strategies. The firm is looking for Junior Quantitative Researchers to be responsible for end-to-end strategy research. This is an excellent opportunity for PhD and Master’s graduates with a background in mathematics, statistics, computer science or a related field.

Successful candidates will work in a collaborative environment where they will gain exposure to the full research pipeline from the front office while working with developers and traders to optimize, implement, monitor and manage strategies.
Collaborate with other quantitative researchers and developers to clean datasets, discuss research, and optimise systematic trading strategies.
Involvement in all aspects of the strategy research/trading pipeline, from research based on large datasets to the development, backtesting and monitoring of strategies in live trading.
The ideal candidate will have a Master's or PhD in a numerate field of study, such as Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, or Engineering.
Excellent coding ability in at least one language. Previous successful candidates are proficient users of Python, C++, Java, MATLAB, etc.
Experience/knowledge of finance from academic studies, internships or professional work.
Strong attention to detail, excellent problem-solving abilities, and the ability to work well in a collaborative environment.

Systematic Quantitative Researcher - Entry/Junior Level - London/Paris/Zurich Office Locations


My client is a leading quantitative hedge fund with offices across Europe, North America and Asia. Their teams trade all traditional asset classes and cover a mix of MM/HFT, Stat Arb, Quant Macro, and Event-Driven strategies. The firm is looking for Junior Quantitative Researchers to be responsible for end-to-end strategy research. This is an excellent opportunity for PhD and Master’s graduates with a background in mathematics, statistics, computer science or a related field.


Successful candidates will work in a collaborative environment where they will gain exposure to the full research pipeline from the front office while working with developers and traders to optimize, implement, monitor and manage strategies.


The Role:

  • Collaborate with other quantitative researchers and developers to clean datasets, discuss research, and optimise systematic trading strategies.
  • Involvement in all aspects of the strategy research/trading pipeline, from research based on large datasets to the development, backtesting and monitoring of strategies in live trading.


Requirements:

  • The ideal candidate will have a Master's or PhD in a numerate field of study, such as Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, or Engineering.
  • Excellent coding ability in at least one language. Previous successful candidates are proficient users of Python, C++, Java, MATLAB, etc.
  • Experience/knowledge of finance from academic studies, internships or professional work.
  • Strong attention to detail, excellent problem-solving abilities, and the ability to work well in a collaborative environment.

4215342622,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/research-internship-%E2%80%93-data-analyst-at-universit%C3%A4t-z%C3%BCrich-4215342622?position=52&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=rcSOUxu4fMNEd2qj5JRVSg%3D%3D,Research Internship – Data Analyst,Universität Zürich,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","The Wyss Zurich Translational Center (Wyss Zurich) is a joint accelerator of the ETH Zurich and the University of Zurich, which was made possible by a generous donation from the Swiss entrepreneur and philanthropist Dr. hc. mult. Hansjörg Wyss. Wyss Zurich brings together some of the world's leading experts to form multidisciplinary teams, pooling their knowledge and expertise and the Recolony project is at the forefront of immune research in cancer.
Conduct literature reviews and analyze quantitative research data.
Curate, wrangle and integrate biological and clinical datasets.
Work with OMICS data from NGS, metabolomics, proteomics to extract meaningful insights.
Implement, test and optimize methods such as Variational Autoencoders (VAE).
Perform advanced neural network and statistical analyses using PyTorch, Python and R.
Generate a scientific report and documentation based on your research findings.
Collaborate with an interdisciplinary research team and participate in ongoing research.
Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's program in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Data Science, Biostatistics, or a related field.
Strong background in biological or clinical data analysis, and quantitative research.
Proficient in Python, with experience in data science (PyTorch) and machine learning.
Comfortable working with OMICS data, including NGS, metabolomics, and proteomics.
Knowledge of command-line tools and Linux-based workflows is plus.
Ability to work independently while seeking guidance when necessary.
Strong scientific communication skills and ability to write structured reports.
Please submit your application as one PDF file, including a motivation letter, your CV including relevant achievements and degrees, and available references.

The Wyss Zurich Translational Center (Wyss Zurich) is a joint accelerator of the ETH Zurich and the University of Zurich, which was made possible by a generous donation from the Swiss entrepreneur and philanthropist Dr. hc. mult. Hansjörg Wyss. Wyss Zurich brings together some of the world's leading experts to form multidisciplinary teams, pooling their knowledge and expertise and the Recolony project is at the forefront of immune research in cancer.

Your Responsibilities

  • Conduct literature reviews and analyze quantitative research data.
  • Curate, wrangle and integrate biological and clinical datasets.
  • Work with OMICS data from NGS, metabolomics, proteomics to extract meaningful insights.
  • Implement, test and optimize methods such as Variational Autoencoders (VAE).
  • Perform advanced neural network and statistical analyses using PyTorch, Python and R.
  • Generate a scientific report and documentation based on your research findings.
  • Collaborate with an interdisciplinary research team and participate in ongoing research.

Your profile

  • Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's program in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Data Science, Biostatistics, or a related field.
  • Strong background in biological or clinical data analysis, and quantitative research.
  • Proficient in Python, with experience in data science (PyTorch) and machine learning.
  • Comfortable working with OMICS data, including NGS, metabolomics, and proteomics.
  • Knowledge of command-line tools and Linux-based workflows is plus.
  • Ability to work independently while seeking guidance when necessary.
  • Strong scientific communication skills and ability to write structured reports.

Information on your application

Please submit your application as one PDF file, including a motivation letter, your CV including relevant achievements and degrees, and available references.

4143566228,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/quantitative-analyst-power-gas-at-gunvor-group-4143566228?position=54&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=bQ6gGhxSTQOO6cBHw2Xk8Q%3D%3D,"Quantitative Analyst, Power & Gas",Gunvor Group,"Geneva, Geneva, Switzerland","Job Title:

The Quantitative Analyst is part of the Power and Gas team, delivering advanced analytics for the power and gas trading desk within Gunvor, ideally based in London. They are responsible for providing high quality insights in the products markets across the Power/Natural Gas spectrum.
In-depth expertise in evaluating and assigning value to physical assets
Assist the traders with ad hoc market analysis / insights.
Maintain and improve existing pricing models
Identify the right set of models and develops the right code / package to execute them.

Evaluate the validity of the model (both scientifically as well as from a business perspective). Maybe rephrase(?) Understand the model limitations and the difference between model output and market fundamentals
Generate trade ideas based on model outputs & Articulate insights and recommendations (based on model output) to respective key stakeholders.
Support Origination activity and investment decisions.
Communicating technical jargon in plain English to colleagues within the team.
Prepare various reports and analysis for publishing internally.
Maintain and improve teams IT capabilities.
Develop systematic trading strategies for the Power/Natural Gas Market.

The ideal candidate has strong background in quantitative skills (like statistics, mathematics, advanced computing, machine learning) and has applied those skills in solving real world problems, particularly in the power & gas business. The required expertise includes (but is not limited to):
Natural Gas Modelling: Advanced experience with different forms of Power/Natural Gas modelling: Stack, Bid Offer, Interconnector.
Applied Machine learning techniques: Good to have latest applied machine knowledge to improve models
Statistics / Mathematics: Data Quality Analysis, Data identification, Hypothesis testing, distribution / probability theory.
Data Science: Time series analysis, Object Oriented Programming, Business intelligence, Databases.
Fundamental Knowledge: Good to understand the European Power/Natural Gas markets from fundamental perspective.
Between 3 and 8 years in a similar role in the Natural Gas Trading sector.
Advanced university degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Quantitative Science or Finance.
In depth knowledge of analytics tools and technologies: Python, R, MATLAB.
Mastery other computing language is a plus
Microsoft Office tools: excellent Excel skills (VBA).
Excellent interpersonal communication and influencing skills.
Eagerness to learn and ability to work with limited supervision.
Curious and Proactive, rigorous and meticulous.
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.
If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!
Our people make all the difference in our success.

Job Description:

The Quantitative Analyst is part of the Power and Gas team, delivering advanced analytics for the power and gas trading desk within Gunvor, ideally based in London. They are responsible for providing high quality insights in the products markets across the Power/Natural Gas spectrum.

Main Responsibilities:

  • In-depth expertise in evaluating and assigning value to physical assets
  • Assist the traders with ad hoc market analysis / insights.

  • Identify the right set of models and develops the right code / package to execute them.
  • Evaluate the validity of the model (both scientifically as well as from a business perspective). Maybe rephrase(?) Understand the model limitations and the difference between model output and market fundamentals
  • Generate trade ideas based on model outputs &
column3:
Articulate insights and recommendations (based on model output) to respective key stakeholders.

  • Communicating technical jargon in plain English to colleagues within the team.

  • Maintain and improve teams IT capabilities.
  • Develop systematic trading strategies for the Power/Natural Gas Market.


    • Profile / Key Skills

    The ideal candidate has strong background in quantitative skills (like statistics, mathematics, advanced computing, machine learning) and has applied those skills in solving real world problems, particularly in the power &

gas business. The required expertise includes (but is not limited to):

  • Applied Machine learning techniques: Good to have latest applied machine knowledge to improve models
  • Statistics / Mathematics: Data Quality Analysis, Data identification, Hypothesis testing, distribution / probability theory.

4192732128,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/tableau-administrator-at-lhh-4192732128?position=55&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=wXiOAF7oVdihI7fvrwSDpQ%3D%3D,Tableau Administrator,LHH,"Zurich, Switzerland","We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Tableau Administrator (m/w/d) to join team in Zurich.

As a Tableau Admin, you will oversee the administration and maintenance of Tableau environments. Your role encompasses managing security, performance tuning, upgrade planning, and user training. Your expertise will ensure high availability and scalability of Tableau solutions, enabling stakeholders to visualize and interpret data effectively.
Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Perform installation, migration and upgrade of Tableau Servers and Desktops under High Availability scenario
Design, develop, and maintain Tableau reports and dashboards
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and deliver high-quality solutions on time.
Troubleshoot issues related to data integration, ETL processes, and SQL queries in Tableau.
Provide technical support to end-users on the usage of Tableau tools.
Perform performance analysis of existing Tableau Servers and make Best Practice recommendations
Perform day to day administration of Tableau Servers
Provide periodic reports on Tableau Server usage
Publish Tableau workbooks and data extracts
Configure and maintain Active Directory integration with Tableau Server
Administer and maintain Tableau Server and Tableau Online environments.
Monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues as routine maintenance tasks and optimize system performance.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and develop solutions
Identify improvement areas in Environment hosting and upgrade processes.
Implement best practices for data governance and security.
Support and train end-users on Tableau functionality and data visualization techniques.
Design and develop interactive dashboards and reports as needed.
Coordinate with other IT and data teams to integrate Tableau with various data sources.
Plan and execute upgrades and patch management for Tableau software.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related fields or equivalent work experience required
5 years of professional experience in Tableau Administration
Demonstrable experience in providing technical support to Tableau users, addressing issues related to cloud connectivity and data access.
Experience with Tableau Server, Tableau Online, SQL, Data Visualization, Dashboard Design Shell Scripting, Data Governance Performance Tuning
Strong verbal and written communication skills to collaborate with various teams.
Good understanding of database concepts including writing SQL statements
Duration: 6 months with an option for the extension
Working hours: Normal business hours, 40 hours per week

We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Tableau Administrator (m/w/d) to join team in Zurich.


As a Tableau Admin, you will oversee the administration and maintenance of Tableau environments. Your role encompasses managing security, performance tuning, upgrade planning, and user training. Your expertise will ensure high availability and scalability of Tableau solutions, enabling stakeholders to visualize and interpret data effectively.


Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:


  • Perform installation, migration and upgrade of Tableau Servers and Desktops under High Availability scenario
  • Design, develop, and maintain Tableau reports and dashboards
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and deliver high-quality solutions on time.
  • Troubleshoot issues related to data integration, ETL processes, and SQL queries in Tableau.
  • Provide technical support to end-users on the usage of Tableau tools.
  • Perform performance analysis of existing Tableau Servers and make Best Practice recommendations
  • Perform day to day administration of Tableau Servers
  • Manage sites and projects
  • Configure and manage project permissions
  • Provide periodic reports on Tableau Server usage
  • Publish Tableau workbooks and data extracts
  • Configure and maintain Active Directory integration with Tableau Server
  • Administer and maintain Tableau Server and Tableau Online environments.
  • Monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues as routine maintenance tasks and optimize system performance.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and develop solutions
  • Identify improvement areas in Environment hosting and upgrade processes.
  • Implement best practices for data governance and security.
  • Support and train end-users on Tableau functionality and data visualization techniques.
  • Design and develop interactive dashboards and reports as needed.
  • Coordinate with other IT and data teams to integrate Tableau with various data sources.
  • Plan and execute upgrades and patch management for Tableau software.


Your profile:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related fields or equivalent work experience required
  • 5 years of professional experience in Tableau Administration
  • Demonstrable experience in providing technical support to Tableau users, addressing issues related to cloud connectivity and data access.
  • Experience with Tableau Server, Tableau Online, SQL, Data Visualization, Dashboard Design Shell Scripting, Data Governance Performance Tuning
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills to collaborate with various teams.
  • Good understanding of database concepts including writing SQL statements
  • Good understanding of Agile process
  • Strong troubleshooting skills
  • Fluent in English


Summary about project


  • Duration: 6 months with an option for the extension
  • Location: Zürich
  • Working hours: Normal business hours, 40 hours per week
  • Languages: English

4195943823,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/online-data-analyst-at-telus-digital-4195943823?position=56&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=Z%2F9EwlZ8H9zmx3scbrHFVg%3D%3D,Online Data Analyst,TELUS Digital,"Bern, Berne, Switzerland","Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

  • Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

4195831830,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-analyst-consultant-artificial-intelligence-data-data-management-data-platforms-focus-at-deloitte-4195831830?position=58&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=i9OPeAHxwqxF%2FE1j9cQyew%3D%3D,Business Analyst / Consultant - Artificial Intelligence & Data - (Data Management & Data Platforms focus),Deloitte,"Basel, Basel, Switzerland","Job Description
Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making.

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.
For this role, we are currently offering start dates from February 2025.
How You Can Make An Impact
Design and implement modern data solutions in the areas of data management (e.g. data quality, master and reference data, catalogues, data platforms) that deliver high-quality, usable data
Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars.

Design complex data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations, which have significant organizational implications.
Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally.
Support business development opportunities to generate new projects.
Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence.
Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent.
Passionate individuals looking to make a career in AI & Data space.
Drive to learn new topics and master them
Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently.
Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations.
Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems.
Business-IT Translator: Ability to act as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions.
Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops
First practical experience with Data management or Data Platform solutions is highly recommended.

column2: fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders.

column1: First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields.
Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous.

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data – how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .
We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on “apply now” to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.
If you have any questions, please contact Julia at talent@deloitte.ch

We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria
column2: don’t hold yourself back – apply today.

4208109300,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-sigma-suisse-4208109300?position=59&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=4MUyF%2FqASM4XVfbevTlQWA%3D%3D,Data Scientist,Sigma Suisse,"Geneva, Switzerland","Sigma Suisse is seeking for it's client, a company in the trading sector, a Data Scientist with experience in the physical world : commodity industry, transportation or logistics :

We are seeking a skilled professional to join our client's team specializing in data science and machine learning. This role involves collaboration with various departments, including technical experts, software developers, and business teams, to develop and implement advanced analytical models and applications.

The position spans multiple areas such as trading, operational processes, and other supporting functions, requiring adaptability to diverse technologies and stakeholder needs. The selected candidate will be involved in every stage of project development, from defining objectives with stakeholders to data preparation, exploratory analysis, model optimization, and deployment of production-ready solutions.

This role demands a hands-on approach to handling complex datasets and delivering actionable insights. The candidate will join a group of experienced professionals focused on addressing significant challenges within the energy sector while exploring innovative possibilities for improvement.
Apply data science to development applications in the commodities trading sector
Design and implement optimization, improvement, and automation solutions for trading applications
Analyze data related to physical movements (vessel locations, etc.) in the commodities industry
Develop models and analyses to extract insights from physical world data
Collaborate closely with the software development team to create clean and modular code
Participate in the continuous improvement of existing trading applications
Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related field
5 to 10 years of experience in data science, ideally in the commodities sector
Strong skills in mathematics, statistics, and machine learning
Advanced proficiency in Python and ability to write clean, modular, and well-documented code
Proven experience analyzing data related to the physical world (transportation, logistics, etc.)
Ability to translate complex problems into effective technical solutions
Knowledge of the commodities sector and trading applications is a significant advantage
Experience in C# development appreciated but not mandatory

Sigma Suisse is seeking for it's client, a company in the trading sector, a Data Scientist with experience in the physical world : commodity industry, transportation or logistics :


We are seeking a skilled professional to join our client's team specializing in data science and machine learning. This role involves collaboration with various departments, including technical experts, software developers, and business teams, to develop and implement advanced analytical models and applications.


The position spans multiple areas such as trading, operational processes, and other supporting functions, requiring adaptability to diverse technologies and stakeholder needs. The selected candidate will be involved in every stage of project development, from defining objectives with stakeholders to data preparation, exploratory analysis, model optimization, and deployment of production-ready solutions.


This role demands a hands-on approach to handling complex datasets and delivering actionable insights. The candidate will join a group of experienced professionals focused on addressing significant challenges within the energy sector while exploring innovative possibilities for improvement.


Job Description


  • Apply data science to development applications in the commodities trading sector
  • Design and implement optimization, improvement, and automation solutions for trading applications
  • Analyze data related to physical movements (vessel locations, etc.) in the commodities industry
  • Develop models and analyses to extract insights from physical world data
  • Collaborate closely with the software development team to create clean and modular code
  • Participate in the continuous improvement of existing trading applications


Qualifications


  • Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related field
  • 5 to 10 years of experience in data science, ideally in the commodities sector
  • Strong skills in mathematics, statistics, and machine learning
  • Advanced proficiency in Python and ability to write clean, modular, and well-documented code
  • Proven experience analyzing data related to the physical world (transportation, logistics, etc.)
  • Ability to translate complex problems into effective technical solutions
  • Knowledge of the commodities sector and trading applications is a significant advantage
  • Experience in C# development appreciated but not mandatory

4195746217,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analyst-cloud-data-ai-all-genders-at-valantic-customer-experience-4195746217?position=60&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=%2BJjLXhFlYmnRgB6%2BKwa%2BTA%3D%3D,Analyst Cloud Data & AI (all genders),valantic Customer Experience,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Dein Wirkungsfeld
Als Analyst im Bereich Cloud Data & AI bist du Teil eines innovativen Teams in Zürich, das die Zukunft von Cloud-Lösungen und KI-Technologien gestaltet.
Du unterstützt die Entwicklung und Implementierung maßgeschneiderter Data & AI-Lösungen, die unseren Kunden helfen, ihre Prozesse zu optimieren und neue Erkenntnisse zu gewinnen.
Deine kreativen Ideen sind gefragt, wenn es darum geht, komplexe Daten in klare, handlungsorientierte Erkenntnisse zu transformieren.
Du arbeitest mit modernen Cloud-Umgebungen wie AWS und Azure und hast die Möglichkeit, an spannenden Projekten teilzunehmen, die dein Wissen vertiefen.
Durch deine Unterstützung bei der Datenvisualisierung ermöglichen wir es unseren Kunden, die Geschichten hinter ihren Daten zu verstehen.
Du bist leidenschaftlich an der Welt der Technologie interessiert und verfügst über einen Universitätsabschluss in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder einem ähnlichen Fachgebiet.
Mit bereits fundierten Erfahrungen in der Programmierung, vorzugsweise in Python oder Java, sowie Kenntnissen in Cloud-Technologien wie AWS, machst du den Unterschied.
Du bist neugierig auf KI-Lösungen, entwickelst gerne innovative Software und hast eine hohe Affinität zur IT.
Deine strukturierte und sorgfältige Herangehensweise an die Gestaltung von Lösungen zeichnet dich aus.
Dein starker Teamgeist und deine vertrauenswürdige Persönlichkeit machen dich zu einem geschätzten Teammitglied.
Du wirst Teil einer Gemeinschaft, die Wert auf Wertschätzung und Unterstützung legt und sich darauf freut, gemeinsam deinen Weg zu gestalten.
Unsere modernes valantic Büro in Zürich bietet eine angenehme Atmosphäre mit viel Spaß.
Ein Arbeitsumfeld, in dem du deine eigenen Ideen einbringen und Wachstum erleben kannst.
Flexible Arbeitszeiten und die Möglichkeit zum Homeoffice, die es dir ermöglichen, deine Praxis optimal mit deiner Karriere zu kombinieren.
Einblicke in führende digitale Cloud- & KI-Projekte, die deine Expertise erweitern und deine Entwicklung fördern.
Vielfältige Möglichkeiten zum Networking und zur Zusammenarbeit mit erfahrenen Kollegen und Mentoren, die deine Leidenschaft für Technologie teilen.

Dein Wirkungsfeld

  • Als Analyst im Bereich Cloud Data &

4192565314,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-at-audemars-piguet-4192565314?position=1&pageNum=2&refId=mlrWzhUnbdlWg%2Bq66K2N6g%3D%3D&trackingId=oVTO3KDycoPWJfeyEF87yw%3D%3D,Data Engineer,Audemars Piguet,"Le Chenit, Vaud, Switzerland","Description de l'entreprise

Le présent et le futur d’Audemars Piguet se construisent grâce à la contribution de tous nos talents. Inspirés par la richesse de notre passé, nous sommes enthousiastes à l’idée de ce que nous créerons dans le futur. Ensemble, nous sommes résolument tournés vers l’avenir et en quête continue d’excellence dans tous nos métiers.
Si notre mission vous inspire, venez poursuivre votre parcours au sein de notre famille pour que l’on continue de créer l'extraordinaire. Écrivons le prochain chapitre de votre carrière ensemble !

Au sein de notre Data Office, nous recherchons notre futur Data Engineer. Vous serez responsable de la conception et de la mise en œuvre d'architectures de données robustes, tout en assurant la conformité aux réglementations et en améliorant la performance des systèmes de traitement des données. Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de Data, les équipes IT et les autres départements pour comprendre les besoins en données et fournir des solutions adaptées.
Vous élaborez et mettez en œuvre des architectures de données solides, incluant bases de données, entrepôts de données et systèmes de traitement des données en temps réel
Vous planifiez et créez des structures de bases de données relationnelles pour garantir une récupération efficace et rapide des informations
Vous développez des systèmes capables de traiter des flux de données en temps réel pour répondre aux besoins opérationnels immédiats et assurer une prise de décision rapide
Vous assurez la conformité aux réglementations sur la protection des données et améliorez la performance des systèmes de traitement des données
Vous travaillez en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de Data, les équipes IT et les autres départements pour comprendre les besoins en données et fournir des solutions adaptées
Vous créez et mettez à jour la documentation technique, incluant guides d'utilisation et schémas techniques, pour faciliter la compréhension et la maintenance des solutions
Vous avez un diplôme de Master en informatique, en gestion des données, ou dans un domaine connexe
Vous justifiez de plus de 3 ans d'expérience en tant que Data Engineer
Vous justifiez d’une solide expérience avec les bases de données relationnelles, NoSQL, DBT, ETL (Talend ou équivalent), Python, Pyspark

Vous avez des compétences et connaissances avérées en conception et mise en œuvre d'architectures de données, des réglementations sur la protection des données et des meilleures pratiques en matière de sécurité des données
Vous possédez une expérience de développement dans le Cloud – la connaissance d’Azure Databricks est un plus
Vous avez des notions dans les concepts et technologies suivants : Spark, agilité, AI/GenAI
La prise en charge des assurances maladie (base et complémentaire)
5 semaines annuelles de vacances et 2 semaines supplémentaires entre Noël et Nouvel An grâce au cumul quotidien de minutes additionnelles
Une contribution à vos activités sportives ou culturelles
La possibilité selon la fonction de travailler à distance

Vous souhaitez exprimer votre expertise au sein d’Audemars Piguet ? N’hésitez pas et postulez en ligne ! Nous nous réjouissons de discuter des opportunités qui pourraient correspondre à votre prochaine aventure professionnelle.
Le masculin vaut pour le féminin.

Description de l'entreprise

Le présent et le futur d’Audemars Piguet se construisent grâce à la contribution de tous nos talents. Inspirés par la richesse de notre passé, nous sommes enthousiastes à l’idée de ce que nous créerons dans le futur. Ensemble, nous sommes résolument tournés vers l’avenir et en quête continue d’excellence dans tous nos métiers.

Si notre mission vous inspire, venez poursuivre votre parcours au sein de notre famille pour que l’on continue de créer l'extraordinaire. Écrivons le prochain chapitre de votre carrière ensemble !

Description du poste

Au sein de notre Data Office, nous recherchons notre futur Data Engineer. Vous serez responsable de la conception et de la mise en œuvre d'architectures de données robustes, tout en assurant la conformité aux réglementations et en améliorant la performance des systèmes de traitement des données. Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de Data, les équipes IT et les autres départements pour comprendre les besoins en données et fournir des solutions adaptées.

Vos missions principales :

  • Vous élaborez et mettez en œuvre des architectures de données solides, incluant bases de données, entrepôts de données et systèmes de traitement des données en temps réel
  • Vous planifiez et créez des structures de bases de données relationnelles pour garantir une récupération efficace et rapide des informations
  • Vous développez des systèmes capables de traiter des flux de données en temps réel pour répondre aux besoins opérationnels immédiats et assurer une prise de décision rapide
  • Vous assurez la conformité aux réglementations sur la protection des données et améliorez la performance des systèmes de traitement des données
  • Vous travaillez en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de Data, les équipes IT et les autres départements pour comprendre les besoins en données et fournir des solutions adaptées
  • Vous créez et mettez à jour la documentation technique, incluant guides d'utilisation et schémas techniques, pour faciliter la compréhension et la maintenance des solutions

Qualifications

  • Vous avez un diplôme de Master en informatique, en gestion des données, ou dans un domaine connexe
  • Vous justifiez de plus de 3 ans d'expérience en tant que Data Engineer
  • Vous justifiez d’une solide expérience avec les bases de données relationnelles, NoSQL, DBT, ETL (Talend ou équivalent), Python, Pyspark
  • Vous avez des compétences et connaissances avérées en conception et mise en œuvre d'architectures de données, des réglementations sur la protection des données et des meilleures pratiques en matière de sécurité des données
  • Vous possédez une expérience de développement dans le Cloud – la connaissance d’Azure Databricks est un plus
  • Vous avez des notions dans les concepts et technologies suivants : Spark, agilité, AI/GenAI

Informations supplémentaires

Ce que nous offrons :

  • La prise en charge des assurances maladie (base et complémentaire)
  • 5 semaines annuelles de vacances et 2 semaines supplémentaires entre Noël et Nouvel An grâce au cumul quotidien de minutes additionnelles
  • Une contribution à vos activités sportives ou culturelles
  • La possibilité selon la fonction de travailler à distance
  • Un restaurant d’entreprise
  • Une LPP avantageuse

Vous souhaitez exprimer votre expertise au sein d’Audemars Piguet ? N’hésitez pas et postulez en ligne ! Nous nous réjouissons de discuter des opportunités qui pourraient correspondre à votre prochaine aventure professionnelle.

Le masculin vaut pour le féminin.

4195947186,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/online-data-analyst-at-telus-digital-4195947186?position=2&pageNum=2&refId=mlrWzhUnbdlWg%2Bq66K2N6g%3D%3D&trackingId=6HMdxA3dMQt8fgWr7E8Hkg%3D%3D,Online Data Analyst,TELUS Digital,"Zurich, Switzerland","Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

4192741878,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/power-bi-plattform-specialist-at-swiss-post-4192741878?position=4&pageNum=2&refId=mlrWzhUnbdlWg%2Bq66K2N6g%3D%3D&trackingId=3c92WJIoShFmYcr%2Fo2Qe1A%3D%3D,Power BI Plattform Specialist,Swiss Post,Lausanne Metropolitan Area,"80-100 %, Lausanne und Homeoffice

Do you love data analysis, visualization and sharing your knowledge? Then join our team and make a difference! Your expertise helps us to drive digitization – with modern BI solutions, efficient processes and robust platforms.
As a Power BI Specialist, you take Swiss Post to the next level with data analysis and visualization, you bring your knowledge to the organization, and you empower staff to work with BI tools.
You are part of our Business Intelligence solutions team, where you develop and stabilize the BI platforms, define framework conditions and ensure compliance with processes and governance guidelines.

As the driving force, you work with the Self-service team to steer Swiss Post's transformation into a data-driven company and empower staff through training and learning paths across the specialist units.

You contribute your expertise towards business analysis, consulting and the implementation of complex requirements, and you optimize BI reports and dashboards so they run smoothly and provide a basis for making data-driven decisions.
You coordinate with stakeholders, simplify processes and improve efficiency across the units.
Additionally, you work closely with data scientists and data engineers, and you also coordinate and empower internal and external staff.
You promote exchange of knowledge within the team and ensure that requests are processed efficiently.
You have a university degree in informatics or business informatics as well as several years of professional experience.
You have excellent knowledge of Power BI and Microsoft Fabric, including data integration, dashboard creation and scripting.
You have experience designing and managing complex IT landscapes, including the implementation of security and governance guidelines.
Your strengths include creating complex data models and transforming data from various sources.
Additional knowledge of other tools such as SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP Datasphere, BusinessObjects and AWS round off your profile.
Your ability to communicate clearly and concisely with stakeholders allows you to convey complex information in an intelligible way and develop solutions together.
As a team player, you have a good spoken and written command of German and English. Knowledge of another national language is a plus.
Anna Rensch People & Transformation Lead – Logistics Services Telephone +41772679069
CHF 116'400 - 131'400 Effective salary may differ from this salary range depending on experience and skills

As the driving force behind digitization, the Informatics/Technology function unit has an influence on the whole of Swiss Post and is an important partner in its success. We go beyond core IT tasks and empower the company in its digital transformation. We use the latest technologies and work to advance agile, bimodal and embedded IT innovations. We develop new, secure business models and ensure that Swiss Post has a modern, high-performing ICT infrastructure. In addition, we are committed to the issue of sustainability: our headquarters in Bern have been awarded two certificates for sustainability. All newly built logistics centers meet the Gold sustainability standard at a minimum.

80-100 %, Lausanne und Homeoffice

Do you love data analysis, visualization and sharing your knowledge? Then join our team and make a difference! Your expertise helps us to drive digitization – with modern BI solutions, efficient processes and robust platforms.

How You Make a Difference

  • As a Power BI Specialist, you take Swiss Post to the next level with data analysis and visualization, you bring your knowledge to the organization, and you empower staff to work with BI tools.
  • You are part of our Business Intelligence solutions team, where you develop and stabilize the BI platforms, define framework conditions and ensure compliance with processes and governance guidelines. 
  • As the driving force, you work with the Self-service team to steer Swiss Post's transformation into a data-driven company and empower staff through training and learning paths across the specialist units.
  • You contribute your expertise towards business analysis, consulting and the implementation of complex requirements, and you optimize BI reports and dashboards so they run smoothly and provide a basis for making data-driven decisions. 
  • You coordinate with stakeholders, simplify processes and improve efficiency across the units.
  • Additionally, you work closely with data scientists and data engineers, and you also coordinate and empower internal and external staff.
  • You promote exchange of knowledge within the team and ensure that requests are processed efficiently.


What You Have To Offer

  • You have a university degree in informatics or business informatics as well as several years of professional experience.
  • You have excellent knowledge of Power BI and Microsoft Fabric, including data integration, dashboard creation and scripting.
  • You have experience designing and managing complex IT landscapes, including the implementation of security and governance guidelines.
  • Your strengths include creating complex data models and transforming data from various sources.
  • Additional knowledge of other tools such as SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP Datasphere, BusinessObjects and AWS round off your profile.
  • Your ability to communicate clearly and concisely with stakeholders allows you to convey complex information in an intelligible way and develop solutions together.
  • As a team player, you have a good spoken and written command of German and English. Knowledge of another national language is a plus.


What We Have To Offer

  • 6 weeks' holiday
  • Parental Leave
  • Staff vouchers
  • Workation (IT)


Contact

Anna Rensch People &

4197971788,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/digital-analytics-intern-6-months-at-swiss-re-4197971788?position=6&pageNum=2&refId=mlrWzhUnbdlWg%2Bq66K2N6g%3D%3D&trackingId=Vj1QwU2QctjXDIrpPnzLjw%3D%3D,Digital Analytics Intern (6 months),Swiss Re,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Are you ready to dive into a dynamic, multicultural team at the forefront of Specialty Underwriting in Zurich? At Swiss Re’s Digital Business unit, you'll collaborate with top experts across underwriting, product, and technology—driving innovation and shaping the future of our Specialty business. If you thrive in a fast-paced, global environment where teamwork fuels success, this is the opportunity for you!

The future is digital and data-driven! As we support and accelerate our clients' efforts to digitize and automate their operations, market trends and new capabilities will shape our strategy on digital analytics offerings. Your role will be pivotal in this transformation by reviewing these trends and developments and help shape our approach going forward:
Identify the main providers of analytic services to insurers and their product ranges through a market scan
Outline the main analytics use-cases of underwriting today, based on this market scan
Explore analytics trends in underwriting and the likely use-cases of the future
Evaluate the internal capabilities (today, and potential) to compare against the analytics trends
Test the findings with targeted questions to selected clients, to understand commercial attractiveness
Propose a framework to compare the intersection of analytics trends, our capabilities and client interest, to shape our strategic investment roadmap.
The internship will be for 6 months, starting in June 2025 in Zurich.

Speciality is a diverse team of problem solvers driven by passion and powered by knowledge. With over 200 underwriters across 10+ offices, our team combines Swiss Re's dedicated Specialty lines of business in the Reinsurance P&C business unit. We are Agriculture, Aviation, Credit & Surety, Cyber, Engineering and Marine & Energy. Our purpose is to make today's and tomorrow's complex risks more accessible and lead Swiss Re's innovation and sustainability ambitions.

We are looking for a brilliant critical thinker who is naturally detail-oriented and possesses strong interpersonal skills. Your flexibility and curiosity enable you to learn new skills quickly. Ideal candidates will have:
Master student in actuarial science, mathematics, statistics or engineering.
Excellent organisational skills and self-starter demeanour.
Proficiency in statistic software as well as Microsoft Office.
Eagerness to learn and adapt to dynamic insurance industry requirements.
Team player who thrives in an international work environment.
Excellent oral and written English. Other languages are a plus.
We are looking forward to your application! Good luck!

Due to immigration regulations non-EU/EFTA and UK citizens must provide a certificate from a Swiss university confirming that an internship is integral to their course of study. Kindly submit the mandatory letter from your University with your application documents
We provide feedback to all candidates via email. If you have not heard back from us, please check your spam folder.

Swiss Re is one of the world’s leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. We cover both Property & Casualty and Life & Health. Combining experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise, we create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 14,000 employees across the world.

Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. We embrace a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work and their passion for sustainability.
If you are an experienced professional returning to the workforce after a career break, we encourage you to apply for open positions that match your skills and experience.

Are you ready to dive into a dynamic, multicultural team at the forefront of Specialty Underwriting in Zurich? At Swiss Re’s Digital Business unit, you'll collaborate with top experts across underwriting, product, and technology—driving innovation and shaping the future of our Specialty business. If you thrive in a fast-paced, global environment where teamwork fuels success, this is the opportunity for you!

About The Role

The future is digital and data-driven! As we support and accelerate our clients' efforts to digitize and automate their operations, market trends and new capabilities will shape our strategy on digital analytics offerings. Your role will be pivotal in this transformation by reviewing these trends and developments and help shape our approach going forward:

  • Identify the main providers of analytic services to insurers and their product ranges through a market scan
  • Outline the main analytics use-cases of underwriting today, based on this market scan
  • Explore analytics trends in underwriting and the likely use-cases of the future
  • Evaluate the internal capabilities (today, and potential) to compare against the analytics trends
  • Test the findings with targeted questions to selected clients, to understand commercial attractiveness
  • Propose a framework to compare the intersection of analytics trends, our capabilities and client interest, to shape our strategic investment roadmap.

The internship will be for 6 months, starting in June 2025 in Zurich.

About The Team

Speciality is a diverse team of problem solvers driven by passion and powered by knowledge. With over 200 underwriters across 10+ offices, our team combines Swiss Re's dedicated Specialty lines of business in the Reinsurance P&
column2: C business unit. We are Agriculture, Aviation, Credit &amp
column3: Surety, Cyber, Engineering and Marine &amp
column4:
Energy. Our purpose is to make today's and tomorrow's complex risks more accessible and lead Swiss Re's innovation and sustainability ambitions.

About You

We are looking for a brilliant critical thinker who is naturally detail-oriented and possesses strong interpersonal skills. Your flexibility and curiosity enable you to learn new skills quickly. Ideal candidates will have:

  • Master student in actuarial science, mathematics, statistics or engineering.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent organisational skills and self-starter demeanour.
  • Proficiency in statistic software as well as Microsoft Office.
  • Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
  • Eagerness to learn and adapt to dynamic insurance industry requirements.
  • Team player who thrives in an international work environment.
  • Reliable, open-minded, creative, and enthusiastic.
  • Excellent oral and written English. Other languages are a plus.

What Next?

We are looking forward to your application! Good luck!

Due to immigration regulations non-EU/EFTA and UK citizens must provide a certificate from a Swiss university confirming that an internship is integral to their course of study. Kindly submit the mandatory letter from your University with your application documents

We provide feedback to all candidates via email. If you have not heard back from us, please check your spam folder.

About Swiss Re

Swiss Re is one of the world’s leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. We cover both Property &
column5: Casualty and Life &amp
column6:
Health. Combining experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise, we create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 14,000 employees across the world.

Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. We embrace a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work and their passion for sustainability.

If you are an experienced professional returning to the workforce after a career break, we encourage you to apply for open positions that match your skills and experience.
